We'll be sure to add more things we discover to the Lexica Botania as we find them.
    Managlass can be turned into Panes, while Manasteel can be formed into Blocks for easier storage.
    Looking at all our research, we're going to be using more and more Mana in the tools we make. Plus, we don't quite look the magical part, no? I mean, we're working with Mana and stuff...
    So, enter the Manaweave Cloth. By combining Mana Infused String to create Cloth, you can then form the Cloth into various pieces of Manaweave Clothing. By wearing an entire set of Manaweave Clothing, all tools and devices you use that require Mana will take a good bit less! That means you can use them for much longer, and to boot you look quite fetching!
    Since it might take a good bit for you to gather enough Mana and String, I'll only ask you to make the Robe Top.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Manipulation of Mana
betterquesting.desc:
It takes more time than we really care for to examine how each new flower we discover works, how much power its generating, etc. We've worked in a bit of older technology into our research, the Redstone Dust technology. With it, we've been able to create devices that let us detect, spread, and remove Mana from what we are calling a Mana Network. During this research, we've also discovered a new Flower that will detect if your Mana Network is either gaining or losing Mana. 
    When a Mana Burst travels through the Mana Detector, it will emit a Redstone signal. 
    The Mana Distributor only spreads the mana to pools that are touching it. Make sure not to accidently block the Mana Bursts with one of the pools!
    Any Mana Burst that hits the Mana Void is destroyed. Completely. Never existed!
    When the Manastar is Blue, it means the Mana Network it is on is gaining Mana. If it is Red, well, better find what's draining your Mana.
    When worn in your Amulet slot, the Manaseer Monocle allows you to see Mana Bursts, even if something else is in the way.
    Need to transport your Mana long distances? Well, put it on a Minecart with Mana Pool! You can combine a Mana Pool and Minecart, and then pump Mana ino it with a Mana Pump. Mana is pulled from the Blue side of the pump and put into the Pink side of the pump. You cannot fill or empty Mana from a Mana Minecart any other way.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Signal to Noise
betterquesting.desc:
We've been combining various Petals and items in different ways to see what we come up with. At first, we created a pretty yet useless, and slightly Unstable, Cube. 
    We continued researching it, and by surrounding a Pearl from one of those really creepy Endermen in these to create an Unstable Beacon, a signaling device that is moderately more useful. You can stop the fireworks this shoots out with a Redstone Signal.
    This gave one of my assistants a brilliant (or slightly crazy...) idea of turning that into a gun! Well, more specifically, a Signal Flare that not only acts like its name, it ALSO seems to emit some supersonic sounds we can't hear that incapacitates Monsters around you temporarily!
    Speaking of noise, one of the assistants got back from some sportsball event sporting some sort of long horn noise maker. It was loud and annoying, but it gave us an idea! The Cacophonium can mimic any creature's natural sounds and play them back. Just Right Click it onto any creature, then hold Right Click to play it back.
    You can also Right Click the Cacophonium onto a Note Block to turn it into a Cacophonium Block, which you can activate like a normal Note Block.

display:10.Name:8: Any Unstable Cube
Any Unstable Beacon
Any Signal Flare
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Teacher to Student
betterquesting.desc:
Since we're dealing with Magic here, we've been in contact with some of the Magical branches of The Ferret Business. They've given us some excellent ideas on what we can do. One of them is to alter our Mana Pool into a sort of Alchemical cauldron.
    Another would be to break down common items into their very essence and form Runes of concentrated power. We're still testing the extents of these additions to our Mana Network, and will update the Lexica Botania with our findings!
    The Alchemy Catalyst is placed underneath a Mana Pool. It lets you convert a wide variety of things, all of which we'll list in the Lexica Botania. One of the most useful we've found is turning Rotten Flesh into Leather!
    The Rune Altar is what we'll use to break down things into their very essences and combine them back into powerful items. You MUST bind the Altar to your Mana Network before you can create Runes. Look at your Lexica Botania to find out how. Then make a Mana Rune to test it.
    Other than the Rune of Mana, the first tier of Runes are the Elements : Fire, Water, Earth, and Air. When you create any first tier Rune, you get two of them, which is super handy! To boot, when you use a Rune in the Runic Altar to make something, the Rune is not consumed. It, instead, acts as a Catalyst, and will be given back when the item is created.
    There are a few magical flowers you can miniaturize with an Alchemy Catalyst. They have a shorter range than normal flowers. When this is done with a Passive Flower like the Daybloom, it instead becomes a Motif, which is purely for decoration and will not generate Mana, nor will it Decay.
    Now that we are making a lot more Mana Generating flowers, and require much more Mana, we need a good way to connect these flowers to Mana Pools. Doing it one at a time is... tedius. Enter the Floral Obedience Stick. Right Clicking it onto a Mana Pool will bind all relevant flowers within range to it.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: New Blossoms
betterquesting.desc:
So we've been trying various combinations of regular and Mana infused Petals to see if we can come up with some new Flowers. We made a breakthrough by adding more than just Petals to the Apothecary: carefully cutting some Grass with some Shears, and then coating it with Redstone Dust gave us a controlled way to add Redstone to the Apothecary. 
    The Redstone Root lead to the discovery of two even more interesting Flowers! Both 'damage' creatures, but in different ways from each other. One of the assistants has been 'testing' them with flocks of chickens. Lots of chickens. We're pretty sure he just wanted the results for his barbecue...
    The Bellethorne will damage ALL creatures, good or bad, around it, except for you and any other Assistants you have with you.
    Unlike the Bellethorne, the Dreadthorne Flower will only kill Adult farm animals.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Better Equipment
betterquesting.desc:
One of the first things we did after discovering Manasteel is trying to forge it into tools. It seems that we can make armor, tools, and weapons out of it. Its a little stronger than Iron, and has more capacity for Enchantment. If you make and charge a Mana Tablet, the Manasteel equipment will consume Mana from it instead of taking damage. As well as protecting your Armor, a Mana Tablet can also be used in conjuction with this Blaster we devised. While you cannot fire Mana Bursts as potent as a Spreader, this makes it outright portable, which is good!
    Manasteel makes fantastic tools, like the Manasteel Pickaxe. You can also make a Vitreous Pickaxe, which enables you to safely remove Glass without breaking it.
    Manasteel also makes decent armor. If you wear all four pieces of Manasteel armor, your Mana Tools take 10 percent less Mana.
    Any item that can hold Mana, like this Mana Tablet, can be charged by throwing it on top of a Mana Pool set to give Mana. You can change a Pool between Giving and Taking Mana by Sneak + Right Clicking it with your Wand of the Forest.
    The Mana Blaster fires Mana Bursts, fueled by any Mana holding items in your inventory. If you have any sort of Lens, you can combine it with the Mana Blaster as well. Just craft the Blaster itself to remove the Lens.
    The Livingwood Slingshot uses Vine Balls for Ammo, and will launch them pretty far. When the Vine Ball hits something, it will lower down strong Vines that can be climbed!
    Combining the Spellbinding Cloth with an Enchanted item will remove the Enchants from it. Good when you've botched an Enchantment on a rare item!
    If you don't like looking like a Mega Zero in your spiffy blue armor, or any other Mana armor, you can combine a piece of it with Phantom Ink to make it invisible! You can also make your accessories like Rings invisible! Combining Phantom Ink with a Phantom'd item will remove the effect.
    You can upgrade the Assembly Halo by combining it with a Mana Diamond to create the Manufactory Halo. When you aren't holding the Halo, it will automatically try to do every crafting recipe saved on it, on a regular basis. We've found this is a great way to automatically compress Cobblestone, or other similar things.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Battle of Gaia
betterquesting.desc:
The Elves have mentioned another material they use, but since its technically a living thing, they cannot send it to us. They have, however, told us how to obtain this material, called Gaia Spirits. Unfortunately, its fairly dangerous. It involves a ritual summoning of a Guardian, who you will have to slay to prove yourself worthy of obtaining the Spirits. The Elves warn me that this is VERY dangerous and will require excellent fighting skills, strong weapons, and excellent armor to survive. You will need to gather 9 blocks of strong material. Iron is the cheapest, but Gold, Emerald, and Diamonds work as well. Constructing the Ritual area is explained in your updated Lexica Botania, thanks to the Elves. You'll require 4 Gaia Pylons for the ritual.
    When the Elves say it is a difficult fight, they mean it. Prepare to die often if you are ill-equipped. The Elves suggest a Terra Blade, Terrasteel Armor, and copious amounts of Brews! Your reward, they say, will be Gaia Spirits, the very essence of the Guardian.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Otherworld Materials
betterquesting.desc:
We've read the passages in your updated Lexica Botania, which now seems to be linked to the... Elven?... world. Looks like both of our groups will be giving you lots of information! The first thing we need to do is trade the Elves some of the resources they are missing and see what they give us in return. It looks like they'll exchange the following : 
    Dreamwood for Wood
    Elementium for Manasteel
    Dragonstone for Diamond
    Pixie Dust for Ender Pearls
    Elven Quarts for Nether Quartz
    Alfglass for Managlass
    This is something the Elves mentioned to us : If we can capture the air of the world we call The End in a Glass Bottle, we can use it in various ways. Throwing it at some normal Stone seems to change it to End Stone. I think with The Business doing all this research, we should be able to make a... reasonable facimile. Check your Store page.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Special Eyes
betterquesting.desc:
The eerie Endermen of your world has been a growing interest of many laboratories in The Ferret Business. Examining their Pearl-like eyes and doing some tests, we've created various devices based on their strange, unique vision properties. Hopefully, they'll be helpful to you!
    The Ender Overseer can detect when it is being looked at. If you or another Assistant are looking at it, it will output a Redstone Signal.
    Attach a Comparator next to the Eye of the Ancients, and it will count the number of animals within six blocks and output a Redstone Signal. The strength of the Redstone Signal seems to be determined by how many animals it sees, but it won't emit the signal for anything less than 2 animals.
    A Japanese tradition some folks here at the Ferret Business like to do is make these little dolls, called Teru Teru Bozu, and hang them up when hoping for sunny weather. Making them out of Manaweave Cloth imparts some magical properties to the ghostly looking dolls. When you make one and place it somewhere, any Rainstorm or Snowstorm won't last as long.
    A bonus, giving the Teru Teru Bozu a Sunflower by Right Clicking the flower onto it, or throwing it at it, will bring the sun back immediately.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Flowers of Winter
betterquesting.desc:
During the Winter, everything is dark, cold, and quiet. Flowers bide their time, waiting for spring, as people huddle and wait. The Winter encourages those still alive to eat to keep going, while the cold causes emotions to spike high as it effects how creatures move and react. 
    The Rune of Winter encompases the wet and cold lands. The Rune of Gluttony expands upon the need to eat as much as you can, when the cold times can offer very little. The Rune of Wrath expands in a different aspect, the fear of the dark and the cramped, cold months coalescing into anger to survive. The Rune of Envy expands on the aspect of wanting that which others have in this cold time of the year.
    The Tangleberrie will create a wall of force that keeps creatures inside it, but does not prevent creatures from entering the circle.
    Conversely, the Jiyuulia will create a wall of force that keeps creatures out. It does not stop creatures inside the wall from walking out of it, though.
    The Medumone will heavily slow down any creature (other than you and your assistants, of course!) that get near it.
    The Entropinnyum is a special Flower. If you set off some TNT near it, the explosion will be absorbed and converted into a LOT of Mana.
    The Rose Arcana, though, will consume your Experiences when you stand close to it, turning them into Mana.
    The Munchdew generates Mana by consuming Leaves.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Flowers of Summer
betterquesting.desc:
In the Summer, many flowers reach their full blooms, inviting fun celebrations!  During the Summer, flowers and people tend to consume more as they enjoy the heat, form friendships and enjoy their time together.
    The Rune of Summer encompases the Earth and Air, with all the fun of beach Sands and treats like Melon. Building on the Summer Rune, the Rune of Lust encompases the Summer heat and joy, with a bit of love and passion. The Rune of Pride expands upon the feelings of superiority and importance of those who survived to this bountiful time.
    We're starting to require more and more Mana, so we need better Mana generating flowers. We've found one that will drink a block of water in the 3x3 area around it. Hydroangeas only consume Water on the same level of it, and seem to work better when it is raining. Like Dayblooms and Nightshades, they will die off after a few days. If the water it drinks is in an infinite water pool (Water physics in your world is... weird ...), it won't consume the block when it drinks. 
    The Exoflame will heat up any Furnace nearby as long as it is fed Mana.
    The Narslimmus will instantly kill naturally spawning Slimes in Slime Chunks, generating Mana from them. The Slimes will not split, nor will they drop anything.
    The Gourmaryllis is a very hungry plant, and will consume any edible Food in reach. Watch out, as it will overeat, but only generate Mana for the first Food item it grabs.
    The Pollidisiac will ellicit a feeling of... well, something close to love, in farm creatures near it. And then Nature takes its course. Enough said.
    Thermalillies are similar to Hydroangea's, except they consume Lava instead of Water, and they won't die off in a few days. They take a long while to cool down after consuming the hot drink, but provide a lot of Mana. If a Thermalilly consumes Lava within five minutes of it's last meal, it's cool down timer will reset, and not give you Mana.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Elven Flowers
betterquesting.desc:
The Elves have helped expand our botanical catalogue with a few special flowers. These, generally, either create or consume a LOT of Mana compared to the other flowers we've made.
    The Orechild is a very Mana hungry Flower, but for good reason. With enough Mana, it can transform Stone around it into a random Ore!
    The Loonium requires a ton of Mana to feed it, but in return, it will a random item out of thin air, usually something old and mystical that looks right at home in a Dungeon chest.
    The Heisei Dream will alter a monster's vision so that instead of his own comrade, he will see his most hated enemy, and be filled with a burning rage so that he attacks them.
    The Kekimuras is a bit more picky than the Gourmaryllis. It will only eat large Cakes placed around it.
    The Spectranthenum teleports items dropped near it to a defined point. You can define this point similar to how you Bind a Mana Spreader to a target. You can see the target of the Spectranthenam by Sneaking while holding your Wand of the Forest.
    The Spectrolus generates Mana by consuming Wool... but only certain colors at certain times. It will eat ALL wool dropped near it, but it will only generate Mana for the first White Wool it eats, then it will want the next color in the spectrum. The Spectrum is : White, Orange, Magenta, Light Blue, Yellow, Lime, Pink, Gray, Light Gray, Cyan, Purple, Blue, Brown, Green, Red, Black.
    The Bubbel, when supplied with Mana, will create a bubble of air around it, extremely useful when building underwater.
    The Orechild Ignem is like the normal Orechild, except it will produce Ores found in the Nether, and only in Netherrack.
    Passive Flowers, such as the Daybloom and Nightshade, usually are only really good for jumpstarting ones Botaniacal adventures. They produce very little Mana in the scope of things, and don't last long. They are, though, not useless at all. The Rafflowsia is a special Elven flower that can consume Passive flowers to generate a decent amount of Mana. The Flowers just need to be planted close to it, and it will consume them. The Rafflowsia will give diminishing returns if it consumes multiple of the same Passive flower in a row, so it's best to vary the flower's diet!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Flowers of Autumn
betterquesting.desc:
Autumn brings about changes, both in people's minds and in the world around you. Both flowers and creatures look to change and prepare for winter. Stockpiling food, making things easier, protecting themselves for the harshness of the dark, cold months coming ahead.
    The Rune of Autumn combines the warmth at the end of summer, with the airy winds of change. The Rune of Sloth expands on the feelings of change, working in preperation towards the sedantary time of winter, slowing things down.
    The Rannuncarpus will pick up items dropped near it and try to place or plant them on the ground. It will only place them on the same ground that the block under the block its planted on is: if the block under the dirt is Sand, it will only place the items on Sand.
    The Hopperhock will pick up any item dropped close to it, and place it into a Chest or other inventory it can reach. If the inventory has an Item Frame in it, the Hopperhock will ONLY insert items that match ones already in the inentory.
    The Marimorphosis will transform regular Stone near it into decorative Stone, based on the Biome its located in. You can use this stone to make slabs and stairs, and also to make alternate versions of the Petal Apothecary!
    The Tigerseye seems give both the look and the presence of a very large Cat being present. If you have anything afraid of a Cat that's Creep'n around, well...
    Vinculotus is a strange, eerie Flower that is quite helpful when you are facing the Endermen. It will prevent them from being able to Teleport!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Flowers of Spring
betterquesting.desc:
Spring is a time of blossoms, of new growths after a hard, cold winter. The world comes back alive as the cold gives way to warmer rains, bringing life back to the world.
    The Rune of Spring encompasses new growths and new opportunities. The Rune of Greed expands on the feeling of gathering all the new bounties Spring brings, lest a cold snap takes them away again.
    The Daffomil will act like, well, a giant fan, and blow items away from it. You can aim a Daffomil much like you can a Mana Spreader : Sneak + Right click it, then Sneak + Right Click where you want it to blow towards.
    With enough Mana, the Clayconia will slowly transform Sand close to it into Clay.
    The Hyacidus causes heavy amounts of mental pain to all creatures, mimicing a Poison. The Poison will not kill the creature, only hurt it badly. It will not Poison you or your assistants.
    The Solegnolia is specifically for certain Mana Accessories that attract items, disabling their effect.
    The Agricarnation infuses the land with Mana, increasing the speed in which crops grow. It can be controlled with a Redstone Signal.
    The Jaded Amaranthus will most likely be one of your best friends, as it will grow more Mystic Flowers with enough Mana.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Form and Function
betterquesting.desc:
The Living Wood and Stone blocks you've made have a lot of amazing properties... but they also look fairly nice as well! You can arrange them in various ways to get more decorative blocks, even combine them with Seeds or Glowstone Dust to get other looks! This has inspired us to try making other materials more pleasing to look at as well! This isn't to say all some of these things do is look nice, some of them also do various interesting things as well. Maybe not quite useful, but interesting nonetheless.
    Simple designs can be made, like the Livingrock Brick or Livingwood Planks. Mundane materials can also be used to make Thatch or Roof Tiles, or you can use slightly more unique materials to make Soul Bricks. We've come up with more patterns and designs than these. You can check them out in your Lexica Botania.
    The Abstruse Platform is only solid to those who stand on top of it. If you walk through the side or under it, or Sneak while standing on it, you will drop through it. Mana Bursts will always pass through Abstruse Platforms. You can also hide the Abtruse Platform by right-clicking it with the block you wish to use as Camouflage.
    The Open Crate is... only somewhat useful. If you like making a mess. Any items put into the Crate will instantly drop straight downward. Perhaps more useful, if you supply it a Redstone Signal, any item it drops won't be picked up by another Flower for a short bit.
    We basically put a Mana Spreader onto a Piston and turned it up. For what? To spread Mana to Pools at a distance, of course! The Spreader Turntable will slowly rotate around, and if it aims at a valid Mana Pool or other Mana accepting device, it will fire a Mana Burst.
    Want to access your Ender Chest from anywhere? Use the Ender Hand! (Note that the recipe requies a vanilla Ender Chest, one that is made with mostly Obsidian)
    Oh, right, if you've been stockpiling Petals, you can combine nine of a single color into a decorative block.

display:10.Name:8: Any Color Petal Block
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Quartz Conundrum
betterquesting.desc:
The Quartz you can find in the Nether has quite a lot of uses. It is also quite pretty when used to decorate with, and we've been able to combine it with various materials to give you even more decorative ideas! You can even throw it into a Mana Pool to infuse it into Mana Quartz. If you throw it into a Mana Pool augmented with a Catalyst, though, you get something completely different!
    Add a Lilac or Alium to some Quartz makes Lavendar Quartz. Redstone makes Redquartz. Sunny Quartz is made with a Sunflower. These special varieties of Quartz can be made into Blocks and Slabs and Pillars just like regular Quartz.
    You can arrange Quartz into a patterned block called an Azulejo. You can rearrange the patterns of it in a dozen different ways by simply crafting the Azulejo itself.
    Quartz infused in a Mana Pool with an Alchemical Catalyst creates Prismarine. You can combine these into a Block, and you can also combine them with a Glowstone Block to create a lovely Sea Lantern.
    here are four special stone varients you can make as well, sort of a glimpse into the future(according to one of the odder Assistants I have...). You can get Andesite by tossing Stone into an Alchemy augmented Mana Pool, then each result can be thrown in again for a different one. Andesite to Basalt to Diorite to Granite and back to Andesite. You can then turn these into Polished versions, as well as Stairs and Slabs the normal way.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Wild Creations
betterquesting.desc:
My assistants have been quite busy lately exploring all the possibilities Botania has to offer us. Most of what we've found has to deal some way with Nature, which isn't surprising given this is a Flower basic magic system. To that, we have created a good handful of various tools, items, and implements for you.
    One assistant has found a way to easily change the lands into Mycellium or Podzol, letting you enrich the ground around you. Another assistant has created quite pretty decorations in their effort to discover more uses. My last assistant has been combining music theory with his research, and while somewhat odd, he has come up with a few items of his own to help you!
    There are three normal types of Pasture Seeds and six special types. Each will instantly grow Grass or more on Dirt. The normal Pasture Seeds turn dirt or grass into some common types : 
    Pasture grows Grass
    Boreal grows Podzol
    Infested grows Mycellium.
    The six special Pasture Seeds make decorative grass variants. For example, Mutated Pasture Seeds make a purpley looking Grass!
    By coating a Mystical Flower in Glowstone Dust, you get a Glowing Mystical Flower, which emits light. By adding it to some dirt with a Pasture Seed, you make it its own floating island! You can then combine this Floating Flower with any flower with an effect to place THAT flower on the island instead!
    Making a horn out of Livingwood and decorating it with a Pasture Seed creates a powerful Horn. When blown, will uproot all vegetation nearby, dropping Seeds and Plants for you to retrieve. Combine the Horn with some Leaves, and instead the Horn will destroy Leaves. Combining the Horn with a Snowball will instead let it destroy Snow.
    By encasing a Horn in Livingwood, and topping it with Leather to create a Drum, you get a stationary device that reacts to Mana Bursts. When one hits it, it acts as if you blew the original Horn itself.
    These little Sparks of life are somewhat handy! You can place one on top of a Mana Pool, then another on any device that requires Mana (That you'd usually hit with a Mana Burst, for example), and it can instead tap into the Mana Pool's reservoir, as long as it isn't too far away.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Power Tools
betterquesting.desc:
Bandit, a lot of the different research areas of The Business have been sharing your findings with each other. Various labs are requesting ways to convert Mana into their respective power systems. There are very few ways we've found, unfortunately, but there are a bunch of useful, powerful tools we ARE able to help them with. 
    The Mana Fluxfield converts Mana directly into RF Energy. Unfortunately, this conversion is only ONE way. You cannot convert RF back into Mana.
    You can infuse a Piston with Mana, and then Bind it (like a Mana Spreader) to another block. The Piston will still push this item back and forth as if it were in front of the Piston. Initially not that useful, but we discovered we could move the Mana infused Piston around and it would not effect the Bound block.
    The Tiny Potato is a cute little guy. No idea what he does other than look cute. Isn't that enough? Hey, you can even name it on an Anvil! I wonder if certain names would...
    The Assembly Halo lets you craft on the go, without having to place down a Workbench all the time. Holding the Halo will show you a ring around you. Right Click the Workbench to start crafting, loading the last recipe you made with it if you have all the pieces. Right Clicking an empty spot on the Halo will save the saved recipe to it, and you can Right Click this area to craft it again if you have the parts. Empty a saved recipe by Sneak + Left Clicking it.
    The Livingwood Bow will fire normal arrows like any other standard bow, but it will also repair itself with Mana.
    The Blaze Lamp condenses Blaze Rods into a light source. It can also be used as a Solid Fuel, or turned into Obsidian by a Pure Daisy.
    Keeping an accurate timer is easily done with computers, but it lacks... elegance and a bit of magic, you know? So, we came up with this Hourglass. By inserting sand into it, it will tick down and emit a Redstone pulse before flipping itself over. How long depends on how much and what kind of sand you add. Regular Sand is 1 second each, Red Sand 10 seconds, and Soul Sand 1 minute. You can only add one type of Sand at a time, and you have to be holding the exact amount you want.
    Given the... blocky... nature of things, sometimes it is hard to build something circular in design. When done properly, it looks aesthetically pleasing! Otherwise, it just looks... lopsided? Well, Manasteel seems to give some special properties to normally mundane tools, and a Sextant is no different. You can Right Click and Hold the Worldshaper's Sextant onto a block you want as the center of a circle, then look outward to change the size of the blue line that appears.
    When you release Right Click, ghostly Cobblestone will appear as a building guide. Super handy! You can Right Click one of these ghost blocks with your Worldshaper's Sextant to dismiss the guide.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Quite a Spectacle
betterquesting.desc:
Lately we've been wondering if there are ways we could alter the Mana Bursts themselves. We're creating lots of new Flowers lately, but that is only one side of the equation, right? Well, two sides, some Flowers MAKE Mana, some Flowers TAKE Mana. But what about in-between? I mean specifically the Mana Network and the Mana Bursts themselves. 
    We decided to see if we could effect the Mana Bursts, and I decided to try making a giant Lens out of glass and Manasteel. Well, it didn't seem to do anything, until one of the assistants spilled some Dye on the lens, and suddenly the Mana Burst that passed through it turned a different color! Since then, I've had all my assistants researching and testing new Lenses. We've come up with a whole lot! We've also found you can combine two Lenses together with a Slimeball : the Lens will look like the first one, but have the effects of both. Not all Lenses seem to work together though.
    Potency increases the amount of Mana each Burst can have. 
    Resistance will increase the time before a Mana Burst starts losing Mana. 
    Efficiency will decrease the time, but also decrease how much Mana is lost over time.
    Bounce causes Mana Bursts to bounce off objects instead of breaking on them. 
    Gravity makes the world's gravity effect the Burst, making it arc downward. 
    Bore enables the Burst to break blocks it hits, consuming Mana from the Burst itself.
    Damaging causes the Burst to damage creatures it passes through. 
    Kindle sets a block on Fire if it hits it, but not creatures. 
    Entropic causes the Mana Burst to explode when it breaks on a block.
    Influence will cause all nearby fallen items to move along the same vector as the Burst. 
    Force pushes the block the Burst hits as if it was pushed by a Piston. 
    Weight causes blocks the Burst hits to fall like Sand.
    Phantom causes the Burst to pass though blocks. 
    Velocity causes the Burst to travel much faster, but start losing Mana faster. 
    Magnetizing causes the Burst to home in on devices that can store mana.
    The Flash Lens will create a magical fire where the Burst hits. It will be colored the same as the Lens, but only provide light, as it is a decorative flame. Another Burst from a Flash Lens will put the flame out.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Accessorizing
betterquesting.desc:
Manasteel is quite pretty, I have to say. Its become a bit of a lab fashion to wear a ring or necklace of Manasteel. It also gives us a handy piece of material to test things with. It was inevitable, then, for us to consider the possibility of giving function to our form. We immediately began researching posibilities of harnessing Mana and overall magical effects we've discovered thus far in useful little packages : jewelry. True, it is a bit of a trope to have magical rings and necklaces, but we ARE working with Magic so... (You can access your Jewelry by pressing the ring to the upper right of your portrait in your Inventory. Or you can bind a button to Baubles in your options menu)
    The Band of Aura will generate Mana slowly and put it into any Mana storing items in your inventory, such as a Mana Tablet, or the Band of Mana, which stores Mana as well.
    The Soujourner's Sash will make you lighter, allowing you to move faster and jump higher. 
    The Tectonic Girdle, conversely, makes you heavier and invincible against knockback effects.
    The Ring of Chordata will clear your vision when you are under water, and if you are carrying Mana in a Tablet or Ring, you'll also breath underwater. 
    The Ring of the Mantle will speed up your hands a bit, making you mine faster.
    The Pyroclast Pendant will put you out if you catch on Fire, but will not save you if stand IN Fire... or Lava for that matter. 
    The Snowflake Pendant will turn water under your feet into Ice temporarily, but not if you are IN the water. That'd be... disasterous.
    The Spectator will highlight inventories that contain the same item you are currently holding. You can also crouch, and it will highlight all dropped items around you.
    The Ring of Magnetization will draw in all dropped items around you when not Sneaking. It will stop magnetizing for 5 seconds if you toss an item out of your inventory.
    As long as you have the Tiny Planet equipped, Mana Bursts close to you will fly towards you, then orbit around you. You can also encase it in a pedastal of Stone, to have a stationary version.
    The Tainted Blood Pendant can be used in place of a Vial in the Botanical Brewer to imbue that effect into the Tainted Blood Pendant. While worn, the Imbued effect will consume Mana. Keep in mind not all Brews can be Imbued into a Tainted Blood Pendant.
    The Ring of Correction will automatically swap the tool you are using to one more appropriate for breaking the material you are working on. It will only works with Mana Tools though.
    Accessories such as the Orange Shades, Eerie Mask, and Questgiver Mark allow you to add more flair to your jewelry ensemble, or to change the look of your Botania accessories! There are 32 different ones, and you can combine one with any Botania accessory that goes in the same slot to change its look. You can also just wear it as it is.
    Accessories are not only for you and your assistants! The Manatide Bellows can be connected to the side of a Mana Pool to increase the rate it outputs Mana. You can also place it against a Furnace to speed it up. Do note that the Bellows don't work on their own when speeding up a Furnace, you will need to man them.
    With all these Accessories you can make, it feels odd to only be storing them in normal chests and boxes, you know? To that, we've come up with a handy Bauble Case! It's kind of like a Jewelry Case, but for Baubles! You can use it to store and swap between your various Baubles, and it can even hold Mana storing items for you.
    The Planestrider's Sash is an alternate to the Sojourner's Belt. Instead of outright boosting your speed, you will speed up as you walk around. If you walk enough, you will go much faster than the Sojourner's Sash or similar accessory

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Strength of the Earth
betterquesting.desc:
We've discovered quite a stronger material than the Manasteel you've been using. By infusing together Manasteel, Mana Diamonds, and Mana Pearls, along with a ton of Mana, you can create a Terrasteel Ingot. It has great Mana harnessing ability we've found in our initial tests. To create it, you'll need to create a ritual area : a 3x3 checkerboard of Livingrock and Lapis Lazuli blocks, with a Terrastial Agglomeration Plate atop the center. Look at your Lexica Botania for a better explanation on how to do this. Meanwhile, while we do more tests, we've already created a few new tools for you to use with this new material!
    The Terra Blade is a powerful weapon. Every time you swing it, it seems you have a small chance of also releasing a Mana beam that will damage your targets as well!
    Instead of having to recharge a Mana Tablet all the time, you can use this Mana Mirror. Sneak + Right click it on a Mana Pool to bind it, and it will directly draw Mana from that pool for your items.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Power and Elegance
betterquesting.desc:
We've tested a few things with the Alchemy Catalyst and have discovered a few extra things, like creating a rough dirt that grass will not grow on, and is great for making special paths. You can toss regular Dirt into a Mana Pool augmented with an Alchemy Catalyst to get a coarser version, which can then be used to make these ornamental, Trodden Dirt footpaths.
    Meanwhile, we've also been advancing research of infusing items with Mana. We decided to see if we could create a sort of focus. The Mana Pylon will draw energies from the earth to power up many of your advanced Botanical creations. If you put it near an Enchanting table, it'll increase the power of the Enchants you can imbue, for example. Its quite useful when you don't want to have a giant box of bookcases around the little enchanting table... This has also become useful as a Ritual Focus in Thaumaturgic rituals.
    But speaking of Enchanting, we had a visit from one of the Thaumaturgic research lab to discuss some similarities between our Occult fields. With his help, we have been able to construct a sort of... ritual area using these Pylons, that enables us to do some advanced Enchanting. I've written down all you need to know in your Lexica Botania.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Strength of Gaia
betterquesting.desc:
These Gaia Spirits are... amazing. The material is unlike anything many of the other Occult branches have seen yet. We've begun careful research since it is very difficult to get a reasonable amount of of the material, but we've already created a few things you may be interested in.
    The top tier of Mana Spreaders, the Gaia Mana Spreader is improved in every single way.
    Monster Spawners are quite fragile, you cannot remove them easily without breaking them. The Life Aggregator allows you to pick up a Spawner and place it down somewhere else. You can only do this once per Aggregator though.
    When put on any tool that normally takes Damage with use, Timeless Ivy will instead allow the tool to consume Mana you are carrying in place of Damage, much like Mana and Terrasteel tools do.
    BE VERY CAREFUL! When you use the Shard of Laputa on the ground at your feet, it will infuse a sphere around 14 meters radius with Mana, and then piece by piece raise it high into the sky. You cannot stop it once it starts! You can also increase the radius by a meter or two with each Gaia Spirit you combine with the Shard of Laputa.
    The Rod of the Unstable Reservoir, at the cost of lots of Mana, will constantly summon Arcane Missles that target enemies around you randomly.
    Crafting a Gaia Ingot and using it in the Gaia summoning will summon an even stronger, deadlier Gaia. The risk, though, comes with great rewards if you succeed!
    The Dice of Fate is a special reward to those brave enough to face the challenge of Gaia. The Elves say that the Gods play Dice with the Universe, and you can as well. By rolling the dice, you can get one of six different Relics. The legend says a person can only ever get one of each Relic.
    Be careful with the Manastorm Charge. Using a Gaia Spirit to super charge some TNT is a dangerous, foolish endeavour, but... it looks so cool! You can only set the Manastorm Charge off with a Mana Burst. This will create a Manastorm Epicenter, which will fire Mana Bursts in all directions, which WILL EXPLODE when they hit something.
    The Elves speak of something that is a combination of a Game and a source of Mana. By using Guardian Spirits to create a special Flower, and using logic and reasoning, you too can play it. The Dandelifeon requires a 25x25 block area to function properly, with the Dandelifeon placed in the center. If you understand the rules to Conway's Game of Life, you'll understand a good portion of this... Game. You'll need some Cellular Blocks, made from Cactus, as well. Look in your Lexica Botania for more information.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Charms of Gaia
betterquesting.desc:
Gaia Spirits seem to eminate with quite a lot of power. I've given each of my assistants a few Spirits each to research, and with the help of the Elves, we've come up with some excellent Accessories you can make use of.
    Ever wanted to the fly? Make yourself a Flugel Tiara! It gives you short term flight when worn, which is quite useful. While flying, you can Dash in the direction you are facing by hitting the Run button. You can also Glide by Sneaking while flying or falling.
    An improvement to the Soujourner Sash, Gaia Spirits give the Globetrotter's Sash a big speed boost!
    While wearing the Charm of the Diva, when you strike an enemy and have enough Mana, you will temporarily convert the enemy to your side to protect you.
    The Golden Laurel Crown will prevent you from dieing. Once, that is. If you are wearing this when you die, the Crown will break and you will still live.
    A serious improvement to the Pyroclast Pendant, the Crimson Pendant will even allow you to stand in Lava with no problems.
    We've come up with two Cloaks, which go into your Belt slot. They activate when you take damage, then take 10 seconds to recharge. The Cloak of Virtue will block all damage of a single strike, while the Cloak of Sin will damage all hostile enemies around you for the same amount of damage.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Even Better Equipment
betterquesting.desc:
Like Manasteel, you can forge the Terrasteel into various pieces of armor. It's much stronger than Manasteel, resembling the strong crystalline structure of Diamonds, without the brittleness. Like Manasteel armor, it will consume Mana from a tablet before taking damage itself. We then tried to make more tools with the Terrasteel, but unlike its Manasteel counterpart, only a few of these tools actually functioned well... and boy did they function! Two of these tools will be quite useful to you, as they'll help you carve your own place into that deserted world.
    Wearing all four pieces of Terrasteel armor will allow you to renegerate health even if you hunger bar isn't full, and your Mana tools will take 10 percent less Mana.
    The Terra Shatterer is special. We've found we can feed it Mana by Charging it like any other Mana containing item, but you cannot take Mana out. Instead, as it holds more and more Mana, the more powerful it becomes. After you've charged it with some Mana, you'll have to activate it by Right Clicking.
    Be careful with this! This tool is able to terraform large areas of land around you as you use it, though it takes a LOT of Mana. Unlike the Terra Shatterer, this destroys all the materials in the process!
    The Thorn Chakram is thrown with a Right Click, where it will pierce through enemies and possibly poison them. It can bounce off a few walls before returning to you like a boomerang.
    By adding some Terrasteel to the Ring of Magnetization you get the Greater Ring of Magnetization, a more powerful version that has a farther distance!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Magic Staves
betterquesting.desc:
All these Magical creations and processes, from Alchemy to Altars to Magic Rings, have given us the idea to keep expanding on the Wizard angle of Magic. More precisely, what is a Wizard without an old, gnarly Staff that can do something Magical? Probably not old and wise enough, I guess. Or he doesn't have a bad leg or back... Where was I? Oh yes! We've utilized the power of various materials like Runes, which have created quite a variety of useful Staves for you to use.
    Aim the Rod of the Hells at the ground and activate it, and a low ring of Fire will appear around you. I suggest running, because after a few seconds, it won't be a small ring anymore. It will burn everything inside it... including you!
    For just a bit of Mana, wherever you activate the Rod of the Seas, it will create Water! This is especially helpful as you can use it to instantly refill a Petal Apothecary.
    When you activate the Rod of the Skies, it will propel you 20 meters up into the air, and then start recharging. As long as it is recharging, you will not take fall damage.
    The Rod of the Lands simply lets you create blocks of Dirt on the spot. As if you didn't have enough Dirt.
    When you activate the Rod of the PLentiful Mantle, it will highlight many Ores all around you.
    While not a Staff, this Soulscribe has a very particular set of abilities. Abilities that make it a nightmare for Endermen in your world. If you strike one with this, it will be the death of it. But if you do, you can only strike a few times, and then it will break on you.
    The Rod of the Depths works like the Rod of Lands, but summons a block of Cobblestone instead.
    The Rod of the Molten Core has the ability to change a block of material into another. Cobblestone turns into Stone, Sand into Glass, etc.
    The Rod of the Shifting Crust is quite a handy tool. It allows you to swap materials placed in the world with a material in your inventory. To select what block you want to swap to, Shift + Right Click this Rod on it. You can then Left Click any solid block with the Rod to swap it with the chosen one, as long as it is in your inventory. Right Clicking, though, will cause a larger transformation, swapping all highlighted blocks instead. Remember, this requires both Mana and the blocks in your inventory! Also, if you have certain other Rods in your inventory, you can augment the Swap. Rod of the Lands, for example, will allow you to swap for Dirt infinitely, as long as you can pay the Mana cost for generating the Dirt as well.
    The Livingwood Avatar is a mannequin made of Livingwood and a Mana Diamond, that can be given certain Rods and they will function similarly as if you were using them yourself. A good example is the Rod of the Skies. Giving it to a Livingwood Avatar allows you or any of your Assistants the ability to jump high when near the Avatar.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Elven Upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
These Elven materials are fantastic, and the Elves themselves are quite intrigued by what we've learned and discovered. With their help, we've come up with a handful of new and upgraded devices you can use.
    You can make an upgraded Elven Mana Spreader with Dreamwood. It will fire more Mana Bursts, with more Mana, that last longer before they begin to lose Mana.
    The Elves found the Open Crate... amusing. They also had an idea on how to make it more useful. You can pipe items into the Crafty Crate in a specific order to automatically craft them. The Crafting Placeholder is for when an item has an "Empty" spot. Look at your upgraded Lexica Botania for more detailed instructions.
    The Spectral Platform is an upgraded version of the Abtruse Platform. It works just like it, except now everthing can pass through it.
    An improved version of the Drum of the Wild, when a Mana Burst hits the Drum of the Gathering, all sheep around it become sheared. If a bucket is under a Cow, it will be filled with Milk.
    Making Brewing Vials with Alfglass instead of Managlass gives you a stronger, somewhat larger container called a Flask. This results in more drinks per Brew!
    The Mana Pedestal can be passed through by both creature and Mana Bursts. You can place a Mana Lens in it, and any Mana Burst that passes through it will change to that lens' type. You can turn it off by applying a Redstone Signal.
    End Stone is mystrious in its own right, and a nice color. The Elves have shown us we can make some nice decorative designs with it as well, such as End Stone Bricks and End Stone Stairs.
    The Resolute Ivy can be combined with any item. When you die, this item will appear with you when you respawn. The effect only lasts once per use.
    You can upgrade the Terra Blade with some fairly useful abilities. The first is called the Starcaller. Each swing has a chance of summoning a shooting star from the sky, which will fall onto the area you are aiming at. Any entity hit with it will take damage. The second upgrade involves imbuing the Terra Blade with the power of the Storm to make the Thundercaller. By sacrificing the long range attacks, instead you can cause a lightning attack to arc to multiple enemies. Each time the lightning arcs from one enemy to another, the damage it deals decreases.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Elvish Devices
betterquesting.desc:
The wonderful, magical properties of these Elven materials has really sparked the creativity of my assistants and I, and we've been working night and day to create new devices for you to play with. The Elves as well are quite creative, and have helped out in these designs. 
    When colored with a Dye, Mana Spreaders equipped with the Paintslinger Lens can Paint blocks by shooting them with a Mana Burst. Only blocks like Wool, Carpet, etc can be painted.
    The Conjuration Catalyst augments a Mana Pool like the Alchemist Catalyst, but allows you to double some materials at the cost of Mana. You can duplicate Redstone, Glowstone, Nether Quartz, Coal, Snowballs, Netherrack, Soul Sand, and Gravel just by throwing it into the Mana Pool.
    Those Monster Spawners in your world only seem to create monsters if you or an assistant are close by. With the Life Imbuer, you can make it spawn horrible deadly creatures at all times. Why? I don't know, but you might find some use out of it.
    Overcast sky all the time? Too much light pollution? Even the Elves have this problem. They've come up with a solution called the Starfield Creator, which will cast a stary filled sky above you. Quite peaceful and beautiful!
    Adding the Lens Clip to your Mana Blaster allows you to have six Mana Lenses on it instead of one. Shift + Right Click to change which slot you are on. When you add a Lens, it adds it to the slot you are currently on.
    The World Seed will teleport you back to the World Spawn (where you first appeared) if you are over 24 meters away.
    The Warp Lens changes a Burst so that if it hits a Force Relay, it will warp to the block the Relay is bound to, maintaining Momentum and Direction. Bore Lenses will not break Force Relays or Pistons.
    The Cocoon of Caprice is an odd little item. I don't know if you'll have a use for it under normal circumstances. The Elves use it for various challenges and events they hold to test themselves. This Cocoon, after being placed, will eventually grow a baby animal inside of it. Usually it'll be a farm animal, but occasionally you'll get something like a baby wolf. The Elves say that you can entice it by using an Emerald on the Cocoon while its growing...
    Slimeballs still contain a bit of the living essence of Slimes themselves. By encasing it in a magical jar of Alfglass and Elementium, it has enough life to it to react. When holding the Slime in a Bottle and you enter an area where Slimes naturally spawn underground, the little bitty Slime will start bouncing around! Cute and helpful!
    The Redirective Mana Lens can only be used in a Mana Spreader. When it fires a Burst, any other Mana Spreader it hits will turn to face the Spreader with this Lens.
    We also have a pair of Mana Lenses that are more for display and fancy visuals than function. The Celebratory Mana Lens causes the Burst to explode in fireworks when it hits something. The Flare Mana Lens changes the Mana Burst into a Mana Stream, like a continuous sparkler or flare firework!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Best Equipment?
betterquesting.desc:
Its only logical that after making Manasteel and Terrasteel equipment, that when given an even more powerful metal, we forge it into something useful, right? Well, Bandit, thats what we did! And these armor and tools all do something different!
    Each piece of Elementium armor you wear increases the chance that a Pixie will spawn when you get it. This Pixie will counterattack for you. When holding the Elementium Sword, the chance is increased, and the Pixies will hit harder as well. Also, if you are wearing all four pieces of Elementium Armor, your tools take 10 percent less Mana, and Pixies can give you random Potion effects.
    The Elementium Pick will atomize Stone, Dirt, and other simple materials, leaving precious Ores behind.
    The Elementium Axe is very good at decapitating enemies.
    The Elementium Shovel will not only dig Sand or Gravel, but it will destroy it, and all like it connected to the same pile.
    If you wield the Elementium Shears like a bow (Don't ask how we figured THIS one out...), all Sheep around you will automatically Sheer themselves.
    The Extrapolated Bucket has a bottom... and it doesn't. All liquids you scoop into this Bucket will vanish, forever.
    The Ring of Far Reach will extend your arm's reach by about three blocks.
    Like Elementium Armor, the Great Fairy Ring will increase the chance of a Fairy spawning when you get hit.
    The Crystal Bow doesn't fire normal arrows: instead it creates them out of Mana and fires them faster than a normal bow.
    The Black Hole Talisman is useful if you need to store a ton of a single thing on you, such as Cobblestone if you are deep in a mine. Right Click an empty Talisman on any block to set the Talisman to it. Then you can Shift + Right Click to activate the Talisman. You can keep grabbing as many of the item as you want, but the Talisman will make sure you keep only one stack of it in your inventory at all times. If you Right Click the Talisman on an inventory, it will dump its contents into it.
    The Thorn Chakram can be upgraded to be a bit more powerful by imbuing it with some Pixie Dust and setting it on fire, making it a Flare Chakram. It will then ignite any enemy it hits!

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Masterwork Magic Staves
betterquesting.desc:
We revisited our research into Magic Staves and Rods since we now have access to new materials. Elvish materials give us a slew of new things to try, and we've come up with a few new toys for you!
    An upgraded Rod of the Lands, the Rod of the Highlands enables you to materialize dirt in midair! Good to save yourself from a fall. Unless you can fly, that is.
    Freezing ice to make a path is good, but Elementium enables us to go one step further. The Rod of Bifrost creates a magical rainbow broad in the air and lasts 15 seconds, so move quickly! You can also enchant a piece of Alfglass by combining it with the Rod of Bifrost to make a Bifrost Block, which resembles the Rainbow Road, and this can further be turned into Bifrost Panes, or combined with other material to make Shimmerock and Shimmerwood! Shimmerrock can also be made into a fantastic, colorful, Fabulous Mana Pool as well.
    The Rod of the Shaded Mesa allows you to negate the gravity around a creature and pick them up. If you swing the Rod of the Shaded Mesa while carrying one, you will propel them away from you.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Don't Lose Your Head Over It
betterquesting.desc:
You know, we're not even sure what to make of this. The Elves don't either, as its a strange combination of both of our research areas. It seems that you can combine a skeleton skull with a few mystical objects in the Runic Altar, and by adding a Name Tag with the name of another person written on it on an Anvil, you can get a faux head that looks just like theirs! Why don't you create one of The Ferret Business CEO: caigan?
    It seems the cosmos are a bit odd in the name registry. You'll have to spell the CEO's name in lowercase : caigan. Not Caigan. Weird.
    Anyways, the instructions and ingredients list is, as always, in your Lexica Botania already, in the Misc section.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Augmented Life
betterquesting.desc:
Our research with the Pixie Dust has resulted in some strange creations, I have to say. They'd be almost alarming if they weren't also just so dang interesting. 
    Take these two viruses for example! No, don't worry, they only effect a single creature at a time... and only horses at that. It doesn't spread... I don't think. Infecting a horse with the Nullodermal Virus will make it a ghostly skeletal horse, while the Necrodermal Virus will make it an undead zombie horse. Either way, it seems to make them much stronger, faster, healthier, you name it! Horses infected with one of the two Viruses will not take fall damage, nor will their rider, as well.
    Alternatively, we've found a set of Augments that will be useful for those Sparks we discovered a while back. Each does something different to a Spark.
    Placing the Dispersive Augment on a Spark will allow it to send Mana to objects you or o your assistants are carrying to Charge them.
    A Spark with the Dominant Augment will draw Mana to its Pool from all other Mana Pools nearby that have an un-Augmented Spark on them.
    The opposite of the Dominant Augment, the Recessive Augment will cause the Spark to send Mana out to all other Pools nearby with an un-Augmented Spark on them.
    To prevent a Mana Pool with a Spark on it from interacting with other Augmented Sparks, you can use the Isolated Augment.
    The Spark Tinkerer is an interesting device allows you to change the Augments on Sparks automatically.  By placing it next to Mana Pools or other things with Sparks attatched to them, the Tinkerer will connect to those Sparks. You can Right Click any augment onto the Tinkerer to add it. When a Redstone Signal hits the Tinkerer, it will randomly select a connected Spark that has a different Augment than what it is holding, and switch them.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Beautiful Brew
betterquesting.desc:
Brewing potions has been a pretty standard thing here at The Business for a while. Pick me ups, resistances, and more are quite useful in this very busy place. With so many things being rearched here at the Botanical Gardens, we wanted to see if we could improve on the classic Brewing system... and I think we definitely have! These Brews are a bit more potent than their classic counterparts, letting you drink from the same flask a few times to get the same effect.
    After placing your Botanical Brewer, you need to bind a Mana Spreader to it and supply it with Mana to Brew anything.
    No matter the Brew, you need a vessel to hold it. Vials are made with Managlass and hold around four doses. To start a Brew, first add a Vial by dropping it onto the Brewer or Right Clicking the Vial onto it.
    Fleetfeet lets you move faster.
    Uprising lets you jump higher.
    Adrenaline lets you do things faster.
    Gills lets you breath underwater.
    Owlsight lets you see in the dark.
    Cloaking hides you from sight.
    Fortitude strengthens your resistance to damage.
    Magmaskin strengthens your resistance to Fire.
    Vigor makes you hit harder.
    Mending instantly heals you.
    Restoration strengthens your ability to heal over time. Revitalization is a more potent version, but doesn't last as long.
    Shielding enables you to absorb some damage.
    Absolution clears all potion effects.
    Sane Thoughts is a useful brew if you are delving into Thaumaturgy, unbending your mind somewhat from the Warp.
    Overload boosts your strength and speed, but at the cost of making you weak and hungry.
    Feather Feet makes you light as a feather, letting you float to the ground instead of fall.
    Marine Allure increases your luck when Fishing.
    Crossed Souls will enable you to regain health for each monster you kill.
    Vanity's Emptyness stops (or at least reduces) monsters from spawning around you. Crimson Shade does the opposite, increasing the amount of monsters that spawn.
    These potions are fantastic for quick pick-me-ups and short term help... but sometimes you don't feel like chugging a potion every few minutes if you are doing a long project in your workshop. This is where our new creation comes in! Many brews can be imbued into these fancy Incense Sticks. They'll last 60 times longer this way! The downsides, though, is it'll take 10 times the Mana to brew these. You also can only burn them in the Incense Plate, which has a range of about 24 blocks. Use either a Flint and Steel or a Mana Burst through a Kindle Lens to ignite the Incense Plate.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Red String Theory
betterquesting.desc:
Ever heard of String Theory? Some of the other research labs have talked about it in the lunch area a few times and it got us thinking of possibilities. After some research and testing, we've come up with something we like to call Red String Theory. Not just Theory, really, we've actually made string. Thats red. And works amazingly!
    You can create devices with it that can connect to something up to eight meters away from one of the block's faces (So, straight from any of a block's six sides). Each Red String Device connects to a different kind of block or device, and does something different, and each Device can only bind to one thing at a time. You can literally see the Red String connection by holdinging your Wand of the Forest! Once bound, any blocks can be placed between the two without breaking the String.
    The Red String Container will bind to any inventory it finds. You can then insert items into the Red String Container with a Hopper or other inserting device, and the items will instead be inserted into the inventory.
    The Red String Dispenser can bind to either a Dispenser or a Dropper. It acts much like the Red String Container, any item inserted into the Red String Dispenser will instead be placed in the bound block, but with the addition of a Redstone Signal on the Red String Dispenser will cause the bound block to activate.
    The Red String Nutrifier can bind to any block that can be fertilized with Bonemeal. Fertilizing the Red String Nutrifier will instead fertilize the bound block.
    The Red String Comparator can bind to anything that can be read by a Comparator, like Containers, Mana Pools, etc. Then placing a Comparator next to the Red String Comparator, facing out, it will emit a Redstone Signal at the proper strength, as if the Comparator was right next to the bound block.
    The Red String Spoofer can bind to any Flower and even some Mushrooms. You can then place any flower with an effect on top of the Red String Spoofer. The bound flower or mushroom will no longer function as itself, it will instead act exactly like the Flower on top of the Red String Spoofer.
    The Red String Interceptor can be bound to any complex block, like a Furnace or a machine. When you or an assistant Right Clicks that block, the Interceptor will emit a Redstone Pulse.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Corporea Item Logistics
betterquesting.desc:
Our prior research into these little bundles of life we made called Sparks intrigued some of the other Research branches here in the Business. A few of them have been working with us and the Elves to come up with something new and innovative with them. With the poweful nature of both Elven materials and Ender Air, instead of transporting Mana between each Spark, we are able to create a network of Sparks that can move whole items between inventories! You will need a Master Corporea Spark and a bunch of Corporea Sparks for each network, plus a way to Interface with them to make requests.
    Corporea Sparks can be placed on top of any inventory, similar to how Sparks are placed on top of Mana Pools. They can connect to other Corporea Sparks within 8 blocks, creating a network (if there is also a Master Corporea Spark). Each Corporea Spark has access to the inventory directly below it.
    To create a Corporea Network, you must have one Master Corporea Spark. Each Network is seperated by a color, which you can see floating around the Corporea Sparks. You can change the network a Corporea Spark is on by Right Clicking some Floral Powder onto the spark. Note that the inventory a Master Spark is on cannot have its items pulled by normal Sparks.
    The Corporea Funnel can connect to any Corporea Network via placing a Corporea Spark atop it. By placing Item Frames on each side of the Funnel, it will pull any items placed into these Frames from the network and put them into an inventory one to two blocks below it. It will do this one item at a time, and at random between the Item Frames. You can rotate the item in the frame to have it pull multiples of that item at once.
    To pull items out of your Corporea Network, you'll need a Corporea Index. By placing this down and connecting it to a Corporea Spark Network like any other Inventory, you can stand next to it and say what you want. It will search all connected inventories and give you the item. You can preceed the request with a number to get that many, or say "this" to get more of the item you are holding in your hand. You can also type count (like count iron bar) to see how many are in the network.
    The Corporea Intercepter listens to your Corporea Requests, and will output a Redstone Signal if a request is not fulfilled. To do this, it must have at least one Item Frame with an item on the Intercepter, and if a request for said item cannot be completed, it will emit the Redstone Signal. This can be used to activate machines or other things.
    The Corporea Crystal Cube allows you to easily see the amount of an item in your Network. Place it down and attach it to a network with a Corporea Spark. Right Click any block or item onto the Spark to have it track that item. You can then Left Click to request 1 of that item, or Sneak + Left Click to request an entire stack.
    Placing the Corporea Retainer next to a Corporea Interceptor enables to to remember the last request sent to the network, and repeat it if a Redstone Signal hits it. This is especially useful for Automation purposes, as crafting can be activated by the Corporea Interceptor, then the request repeated after it is done.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Thaumic Visitor!
betterquesting.desc:
Hello? Hi! I'm pretty sure you remember me, I'm Wiggles, Wizard Watson's familiar. I've been helping him guide you on your path to becoming a great Thaumaturge (and I hope you listened to me rambling about my own knowledge of Auras...). But right now, he's sent me here to the Botanical Garden to assist you in a bit of cross-lab discoveries! See, my Master isn't like most wizards, he approves of knowing and understanding ALL schools of magic! Other old wizards consider it Forbidden for a Thaumaturge to approve of other Magic, but I think they are silly!
    I uh... um... don't let my Master know I was talking about the others. He doesn't want me to get in trouble with them....
    Where was I... Oh yes! If you open your Thauminomicon, low on the left side is a tab called Apocryphia, which is a fancy term for Forbidden Magic (at least, I think it is...) You'll find all the Researches there!
    Livingwood is magical stuff, so it only makes sense it should make a decent Wand Core with the Livingwood Rod! You'll have to put the Rod into a Mana Pool to revitalize it, keep in mind. A Thaumic Wand created with Livingwood will transform Botanical Mana into Thaumic Vis, drawing it from any Mana storage device on you.
    Manasteel is infused with a lot of magic, and you can shape it into Manasteel Caps. Like Livingwood Rods, you'll need to put it into a Mana Pool to revitalize its power. When using it in a Wand, it provides a better Vis usage rate, and if made with a Core that transforms Botanical Mana, it will make the conversion more efficient.
    When provided with Botanical Mana, the Whisperweed will whisper bits of arcane Knowledge to you when you are nearby. The whispers, after a while, might have a bit of a side effect though.
    The Euclidaisy, when provided Botanical Mana, will pull Ethereal Essences from the void, which can help provide you much needed Essentia. A Redstone Signal will disable the flower.
    The Tainthistle is definitely a Thaumaturge's friend. If your Alchemical or Infusion efforts produce Flux Goo, the Tainthistle will absorb it, turning it into Mana.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Thaumic Dreams
betterquesting.desc:
Hi, it's Wiggles again! The world of the Elves, Alfheim, seems to be steeped with all sorts of magic. All the materials you trade for? Those would make excellent Wand pieces, I think!
    Dreamwood is infused with more than enough magic to turn it into a Dreamwood Rod or Dreamwood Staff Core. Like Livingwood, it will need to be put into a Mana Pool to awaken it. Staves made of Dreamwood store a lot more Vis, and boost the power of any Foci used with it.
    Elementium makes fantastic Wand Caps, but require a bit more than just a dip in a Mana Pool to wake them up. You'll need to Infuse some Runes and a Gaia Spirit to properly use it as a Wand Cap. Elementium Wand Caps are fantastic at channeling Vis, and when combined with a Wand Core that converts Botanical Mana, reduces the cost greatly.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: To Invent Some Extra Utilities!
betterquesting.desc:
What? Whats an Inventologist you ask? Why, I am, of course! Oh, what does the term mean you mean? I mean uh... you... mean...
    Er, okay, Inventologists research past inventions and create new ones! The difference between me and a normal inventor? Why, the ologist part! Seven letters! Okay lets just get into the swing of things, lets see what things you can show me! Send me samples of fairly common building materials in your world...

display:10.Name:8: Any Glass
Any Wood Plank
Any Wool
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Decorate and Collect
betterquesting.desc:
As time goes on, I'm noticing you collect a whole lot of Cobblestone. Massive amounts, really. You have to mine and dig out all your supplies, and to get to them without advanced machinery, you have to carve yourself tunnels and paths and whatnot. That cobblestone takes up a whole lotta space, yeah? Not to mention just how much Dirt is around you as well, and other common materials... Let's find some uses for all of them! 
    We can make nicer looking materials out of those, for sure. And... how about we compress some of it down for better storage? We could probably find a use if you compress Cobblestone down far enough... Oh, and send me samples of everything please? This lab is kind of drab and... well, it WAS a tiny office, not a laboratory. Now it's kind of both. 
    You can compress down some common materials for better storage. Some can be compressed to quite unrealistic proportions!
    There are a lot of blocks you can Paint with a Paintbrush, more than what I'm showing you here! You can also Sneak + Right Click the Paintbrush onto any of these blocks to copy the color of it.
    There are multiple decorative things you can make with Gravel beyond just Road.
    Beyond just normal Stone, you have a few more options on edging patterns for your stone constructions, such as with Border Stones. Or, combining the cool look of ice to make Frosted Stone.

display:10.Name:8: Any Colored Block of Coal
Any Colored Stone
Any Colored Bricks
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Research - Shiny Material
betterquesting.desc: Your QUEST Tablet scanners show lots of wonderful, rare gems and metals in the ground. Could you send me some samples of the nice, really shiny, sparkly things? Please? I promise, it's for research!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Research - Mystical Material
betterquesting.desc:
I've gotten some intriguing information from some of the other branches of The Business, Bandit. Your world is infused with mystical energies of all kinds! I'd like you to send me various samples of the 'Magical' nature of your world...
    Amongst the magical materials are some special ones. For example, to make Burnt Quartz, simply cook a Block of Quartz in a furnace. 
    As well, you'll need to kill The Wither, a super tough creature you'll have to summon. You'll need 4 soulsand and 3 Wither Skeleton Skulls to summon it. I suggest summoning it in a safe area, as it will destroy everything around it while fighting. I won't take the Nether Star, I just want a direct scan...

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Inventing New Tools of Old
betterquesting.desc:
One thing I've noticed with all the materials you've sent us... that is, myself and the rest of The Ferret Business... is that everything in your world seems to be suffused just a bit with a bit of Magic. This means all the materials of your world seem to... slightly bend? Yeah, slightly bend the laws of physics and logic. 
    All these tools are normal tools we have here in our world, you've probably used some of them before your accident. But when we change the design a bit and use materials from your world? We then create all new tools! And this... this is one of the hearts of Inventology! Reworking the old into new!
    Your world's crops seem to grow faster than ours normally do. By using the magical nature of your Iron, we can create a watering can that can speed it up even faster with just a bit of water. Don't forget to fill up the Watering Can by Right Clicking some water!
    By constructing a liquid Drum out of your magical Iron, we get a container that can hold much more water than it normally should. It can even hold molten Metal and Lava!
    I took the old, classic design of a stovetop heating coil, and remade it slightly, adding some Redstone to it. Now this one can hold RF Energy like a battery, and power a Furnace as if it were Wood or Coal!
    Usually used in older ah... military... setups, these Iron Spikes usually are deployed against dangerous monsters, and will damage and destroy anything that lands on them. With my redesign, they hurt anyone touching them, but items don't break and vanish. Experience Orbs do not drop, though.
    You can also make Wooden Spikes, which will nearly kill the creature stepping on it. One good punch will finish it off.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Magical Energy Generation
betterquesting.desc:
Because of the Pink Generator, I decided to start looking more into using more Magical materials for Power generation. I've definitely invented some quite amazing varieties for your use, and to boot I've gotten ideas for even bigger Generators! Give me some time, try these out first please.
    We eat Food to Fuel our bodies, right? Why not use Food to make Power as well? The Culinary Generator can do just that! The more filling and satiating a food is, the more power it will generate!
    The basic Furnace Generator is good, but I felt that it wasted a lot of Heat... and Heat is nothing but Energy! The High-temperature Furnace Generator slowly heats up, but as it does, it becomes more and more fuel efficient!
    Alchemy is a bit of a new thing to me, though I have had a Pick Me Up Potion once before. It gave me the idea to convert the Magical energy in Potions into Power! The more 'steps' it takes to make a potion, the more Power it will generate in the Potion Generator.
