When connected to a cVis network, the Focus Manipulator can change and upgrade almost any Wand Foci in various ways. Some upgrades can be taken multiple times, others only once. Some upgrades require lower tier ones first. Experimentation is key! Unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be a way to remove upgrades.
    The Wand Focus: Portable Hole is handy to have around. It lets you tear a temporary hole through most simple materials, that stays open for a few seconds. This lets you make temporary doors and pathways, for exploring or escape. The amount of Vis used depends on how much material you are making a Hole through. More complicated things like machines will not be cut through.
    Invariably, with your trips to the Nether for materials, you've come across the most annoying creatures, on par with your fabled Creepers: Hellbats! Now, though, you can harness their annoyance and send them at your enemies! The Wand Focus: Nine Hells allows you to fire off a Hellbat. You can even research a way to turn it into a Vampire bat, which has a chance of healing you when it attacks. If you don't see the Nine Hells research in the Thauminomicon, try scanning a Firebat with your Thaumometer first.
    You've made Warded Doors, Pressure Plates, and Glass, and each has its own place... but what if you could Ward most any simple material? The Wand Focus: Warding lets you ward most simple materials. They become frozen in time, and cannot be interacted with or broken until you use your Wand on them again to Unward them. When holding your Wand with the Warding Focus, you'll be able to see all the blocks you and you alone have Warded.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Metal Mania
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you know how to make Thaumium, it's time to learn how to work the basic metals and ores better as well. Both in and out of Thaumaturgy, Metals are very widely used, and any method to increase them is helpful. In the Alchemy tab, off of the Thaumium research, are two more researches. After researching these, it'll open up a great number of researches. Thankfully, they only require Research Points to unlock, but you may miss one final research this unlocks pertaining to working Ore and Metal. The final tab, on the right side, of your Thauminomicon is labeled AOBD. It has a single research labeled Ore Purification, which you should also Research.
    By putting Ordo and Metallum Aspects into your Crucible, you can purify Iron Ore into Native Iron Clusters. This purified version of the Ore, when smelted will give you two Iron Ingots instead of one!
    Researching all the extra mentioned Purifications, including the AOBD one, will give you the ability to double almost every Ore you can get. You can make Tin Clusters, Native Copper Clusters, Native Silver Clusters, Native Osmium Clusters...
    Ore Purification isn't the only thing you can do. By breaking down metals into Metallum, and mixing with a few other Aspects, you can Transmute them into different metals! Yes, this is where the Lead into Gold scenario comes into play!
    It is quite simple to just break down an Iron Ingot into 9 nuggets, so why not take those 9 nuggets and triple them into 27 Iron Nuggets for me! Well, Wiggles says it isn't hard for you to just break down 2 more Ingots as well, but that's up to you I guess. You're a Wizard, Bandit, you can do it however you like.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Infused Tools
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you know how to do basic Infusion, it's time to learn many of the useful tools you can make! A lot has opened up in the Artifice tab for you! Be sure, as well, to make sure your Altar is as stable as possible. Remember, try to keep things as symmetrical as possible! Crystal shards, skulls, and candles all aid in stability. 
    Eventually, you'll want to balance at least twelve Arcane Pedestals in a pattern around the Infusion Altar. This is best done in a Clock pattern. When placing ingredients for symmetry in the Clock pattern, it's quite simple. When you place an ingredient, count 6 Pedestals in either direction for it's opposite. 12 O'Clock is 6 O'Clock. 4 O'Clock is 10 O'Clock.
    The Pickaxe of the Core imbues fire into a Thaumium Pickaxe. When mining with it, occasionally you will turn Ores into Native Clusters, doubling the Ingots they make. You can also Right Click to survey the area for Ores. If you want to use it like a normal Pickaxe, you can Sneak while mining with it.
    The Axe of the Stream makes chopping down tall trees easy. When used on normal wood items, it acts like normal, but when chopping Logs and similar, the Axe takes effect. When you chop a Log with the Axe of the Stream, it will instead break the furthest Log of the same type in an unbroken chain. So if you chop the bottom of a tree, it will start at the very top, working its way down. Each log will then flow down to you. If you hold down Right Click while holding the Axe, it will draw all items nearby to you, not just Logs. If you hold Sneak while using it, it will act like a normal axe.
    The Sword of the Zephyr is a blade infused with the element of Air. When you strike with it, you'll slash in a wide arc and hit multiple enemies. When you hold Right Click to block, you'll summon a wall of air around yourself, pushing enemies and objects back and deflecting projectiles. While this is active, you'll slowly lift into the air as well.
    Shovel of the Earthmover is a great tool for both clearing soft materials and for building. When you dig with it, it will dig up a 3x3 area. When you Right Click with it, though, it will attempt to place a 3x3 area of the same material you are aiming at, as long as it's in your inventory. By Sneaking, you'll see where you are placing the blocks. You can change the shape of the pattern by hitting the hotkey. By default, this is G, but you'll have to rebind it if you want to use this function. As usual, if you dig while Sneaking with this tool, it'll act like a normal shovel.
    The Hoe of Growth is a farmer's helper. When Right Clicked onto dirt, it will till a 3x3 area. When Right Clicked onto a crop, it will act like Bonemeal, making it grow faster, but at the cost of some extra Durability from the Hoe. Sneaking while tilling the ground will till a normal 1x1 area.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Infused Devices
betterquesting.desc:
The power Infusion grants us can be used in a wide variety of devices.  We can even make magical versions of various common 'technological wonders', even though these creations were first dreamed up by wizards centuries older than both of us. My familiar Wiggles says it doesn't really matter who thought it first, and I tend to agree. Usually. She doesn't have to have debates with some of the other departments on a regular basis like I do, though.
    Ah, you may have noticed this research much earlier. I chose not to show it to you yet, as while it is quite useful, it tends to have odd... interactions with various other devices and machines outside the Thaumaturge's area of study. In the Artifice tab is the Arcane Lamp research. This Lamp will light up a large area, as it will create smaller lights within 16 blocks of it to remove all the dark spots it finds. These lights, though, are what can cause issues with other devices, so use these with a caution!
    Taking the Arcane Lamps and Imbuing the energy of Life into them is a good way to turn them into something more useful. By providing the Lamp of Growth with Herba Essentia (via Essentia Tubes), it will glow brightly. Plants touched by it's glow will grow at a faster rate than normal. The Lamp of Fertility works in a similar way, though it works off Victus Essentia. Animals in it's light will seek out a mate and have babies. This won't affect animals when there are 8 or more of it's type already present.
    The Arcane Bore is a magical device that expands and improves on the Wand Focus: Excavation. You need to place the Arcane Bore on top or underneath an Arcane Bore Base. Right Click your Wand on the Arcane Bore to aim it in the direction you want to excavate, and on the Arcane Bore Base to change which direction it will deposit items (Don't forget to place a chest down!) When you open up the Arcane Bore, you can place a Wand Focus: Excavation in the left hand slot, and any Pickaxe in the right hand slot. The enchantments on both will effect the Bore, and the Durability of the Pick will effect how long the Bore can run. To activate the Arcane Bore, simply supply a Redstone Signal to the Arcane Bore Base. Supplying Perditio Essentia or CVis to the Arcane Bore will increase its speed.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Infused Equipment
betterquesting.desc:
We've made a pair of boots infused with Magic... and that is only the beginning! Infusing pieces of armor, rings, and other such bits and baubles can be just as useful as an imbued sword. Combining all of them will keep you well protected and ready for any situation that arises.
    The Thaumostatic Harness imbues the power of Aer into a Leather Armor construction. This will enable you to fly in the air! As long as you keep it powered, that is! The Harness is fueld by pure Potentia Essentia. Fill a Warded Jar with Potentia, and then Right Click while holding the Harness to open it. Place the Potentia Jar inside, and then wear it. To activate or deactivate the Harness, you'll need to rebind the Harness button from H in your options, under Miscellaneous. 
    While active, the Thaumostatic Harness will drain Potentia from the Jar. The Thermostatic Girdle, on its own, will negate most fall damage, but doesn't have enough power itself. When combined with the Harness, it will increase the speed you can move while flying, but at the cost of a bit higher Potentia consumption.
    Researching Runic Shielding will aid you in keeping you alive, by showing you how to make a three piece set of jewelry : A Ring of Runic Shielding, An Amulet of Runic Shielding, and A Girdle of Runic Shielding. The Runic Shielding works differently than normal armor. When you take damage, the Runic Shielding will take the hit first. If you take more damage than you have Shielding left, you will be hurt normally. Runic Shielding regenerates slowly by drawing Aer and Terra Vis from the Wands you carry.
    You can improve on the Runic Shielding jewelry by imbuing both an Element and a magic potion to each one. Each one of these has a bit less Shielding power to them, but in exchange have special effects : 
      The Charged Ring of Shielding will speed up Shield Regeneration by 25 percent. You can wear two of them for a 50 percent increase.
      The Revitalizing Ring of Shielding will release a burst of Regenerative energy when you are hit, but will only do so once every 20 seconds.
      The Kinetic Girdle of Shielding will cause a burst of kinetic energy when you are hit, damaging and knocking back creatures around you. This can only happen once every 20 seconds.
      The Amulet of Emergency Shielding will, when you run out of Shielding, immediately add 8 Shielding Points to you. This can only happen once every minute.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Golemancy
betterquesting.desc:
The Hungry Chest was only the start to giving the spark of life and animation to your creations. Researching Straw Golems will open up a whole lot of new possibilities for you! Golems are a great help to any Thaumaturge. They are simple creations, both in creation and in intelligence, but with some careful work and thought, you can create an army of Golems to help with many tedious tasks. From gathering, farming, sorting, there's a lot that can be done.
    Wiggles loves the golems. She has her own little army of helpers.
    The first step in learning how to make and control golems is making the Straw Golem.
    Golems can be Right Clicked onto a block, or Shift + Right Clicked onto a chest or other block with an inventory, to place it. This will be the 'Home' location for the Golem. The normal range for a Golem is 16 blocks from this Home. A freshly made and placed Golem will be inactive, though, as it needs...
    ...a Golem Animation Core. Golem Animation Cores give a golem function. Gathering, planting, etc. To give a placed Golem a Core, just Right Click it onto it. Make a Gather core, and then you can then Right Click the Golem with the Gather Core and put specific items into it for it to gather. Otherwise, it will gather all dropped items in range.
    The Golemancer's Bell is a specialized tool to help control Golems better. Given how simple minded these creations are, it's useful to avoid frustration. By Right Clicking the bell on a placed Golem, a small glowing gear will appear on the block that is its Home. You can then Right Click on a location, a block, etc to Mark it. The Golem will only interact with these marked places. Right Click the Mark to either remove it, or cycle through the colors. Shift + Right Clicking a Mark will always remove it.
    If you Left Click on a Golem with the Bell, it will allow you to pick it up with its Core and any upgrades on it. Shift + Left Clicking a placed golem will instead separate it into its different components, but any Cores and upgrades have a chance of being destroyed this way.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Golem Goodies
betterquesting.desc:
Sometimes, its a bit difficult to tell your Golems apart when you have a  lot of them. Wiggles could always tell them apart in a single glance, I don't know how. Thankfully, for us with less than stellar sight, we can create some nice accessories for them. Not only do they look good, but they also help boost the Golems in various ways!
    It's hard to get a Golem to stop what it's doing so you can put an accessory on it. By placing a Golem Fetter and powering it with a Redstone Signal, any Golem that walks over it will immediately pause what it's doing and stand there. When the Redstone Signal is turned off, the Golem will resume its task.
    There are many Golem accessories you can choose from : 
      A Golem wearing a Top Hat will have more health and vitality.
      A Golem wearing a Fez will regenerate health faster.
      A Pair of Spectacles on a Golem will increase its range.
      A Visor not only adds a little Armor to the Golem, it will also cause creatures it kills to drop XP Orbs.
      The Bowtie will make a Golem move faster.
      Iron Plating will increase the defense of a Golem that wears it, but will also weigh it down.
      The Dart Launcher can only be attatched to combat Golems, and will give it a ranged attack.
      The Golem Mace will outright increase a Golem's melee damage.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: More Golems
betterquesting.desc:
Expanding the types of Golems you can make brings lots of variety. Some golems are faster, others more durable. More advanced Golems have more capability to hold Upgrades, which improve them even more. 
    Wooden Golems repair and move faster, but are a bit less durable and have slightly less strength.
    Clay Golems are more durable and can carry more, but their self-repair is slower.
    Stone Golems are stronger and more durable, but slower. They also weigh more and can sink in Water.
    Iron Golems are much slower, but more durable and can carry a lot more.
    Tallow Golems are average across the board, but are able to hold two Upgrades instead of one.
    Flesh Golems aren't very durable or strong, but they repair very quickly and can have two Upgrades.
    Thaumium Golems are fairly durable and strong, repair fast and can carry a lot. Their weight makes them move slower and sink in water.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Core Upgrade
betterquesting.desc:
Golems have a wide variety of options, some of them more suited to different tasks. The major way to differentiate what a Golem can do is what Golem Animation Core you give them. Each Core is a certain task it can do, giving you a variety of options. 
      The Empty core will have a Golem taking out all items from the Inventory marked as it's home, and bring it to Marked locations. If these Marked locations are inventories, it will put the items into it.
      The Fill core will search marked areas and chests for items, and place them into the Inventory marked as its home. It has two modes : Any and Precise. Any will fill the Home inventory with as many of the items it can find, while Precise lets you choose exactly how much to keep the inventory stocked with.
      The Sorting core acts like the Empty core, but only if one of the items in it's Home Inventory matches one of the items in a Marked inventory. This is super useful for sorting things!
      The Use core enables a golem to Left or Right Click on Marked areas. You can configure which button, what items it will use if its Home is an inventory, etc.
      The Decanting core, when put on a golem connected to a liquid inventory, will draw liquids from Marked areas to fill it. Place a bucket or other container of the liquid into the Golem to transfer only that liquid.
      The Alchemy core is a specialized Decanting core. When placed on an Alembic or Alchemy Furnace, it will move Essentia from it to Warded Jars that have been marked. They can also move Essentia between most containers and Essentia accepting blocks.
      The Harvest core will make a Golem harvest fully grown plants in an area around its Home. It isn't smart enough to recognize every plant, nor is it smart enough to replant the seeds. Though, with the proper Upgrade, you can probably get it replanting seeds at least...
      The Fishing core will enable a Golem to fish. It will do best when placed in deeper waters.
      The Chop core will make a Golem chop down all trees in an area around its Home. It will not, however, replant saplings. (Note, for this one, you'll need to have learned how to make the Axe of the Stream. Check the Infused Tools quest for more information!)
      The Guard core will turn a Golem into a protector. It will guard the area of its Home, attacking all Hostile enemies who get close. With the proper Upgrade, you can change what it will target.
      The Butcher core will make a Golem kill farm animals. It is smart enough only to attack the oldest, fully grown animal, and it will always leave a pair of them for breeding more.
    Another way to customize your Golems is to give them Golem Upgrades. Depending on what your Golem is made of will determine how many of these Upgrades it can have. Some Upgrades also give certain Cores special boosts. 
      The Fire Upgrade will enable a Golem to filter or sort more items, and will give it's melee attack the abilty to ignite enemies.
      The Earth Upgrade will increase how much a Golem can carry, as well as how much damage it does. It will also speed up any task based on strength, such as harvesting.
      The Air Upgrade will increase a Golem's Speed and its Ranged Attack Speed.
      The Water Upgrade will increase the traveling range of a Golem.
      The Order Upgrade will enable a Golemancer's Bell to make Colored Marks, which some Cores can use for greater control.
      The Entropy Upgrade will cause damage to anything that damages the Golem.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Advanced Golemancy
betterquesting.desc:
With the creation of so many Golems and Upgrades, the process and understanding of what makes a Golem a Golem becomes much easier, we've noticed. Little things can be done to improve Golems, whether its a combination of Core and Upgrades that does something special, or just better knowledge how to control them with the Golemancer's Bell.
    We can imbue a bit more magic into our creations to improve them even further. Increase the power and life in them helps improve their abilities. Your Infusion Altar will help immensely. Do note, that to place a Golem onto a Pedestal, you'll need to Sneak + Right Click, otherwise it will consider the Pedestal it's Home location instead.
    It isn't adding Legs to it, but it'll do. You can infuse the Hungry Chest with more energy, and it will becoming a Traveling Trunk.  The Trunk will hop around, following you, acting like a normal Chest to help you store things. It will travel with you to other dimensions as well. You can have it stay by clicking the button in its inventory.
    The Trunk can take a single Upgrade, which will give it a special ability depending on which one it is given. Like a Golem, it can also be picked up by Left Clicking it with a Golemancer's Bell.
    We can do the same thing we did with the Traveling Trunk with any Golem. By imbuing it with more energy and intelligence, it can help us even more. An Advanced Golem will have an extra Upgrade slot, though it still will only be able to hold two of a single type. They will also be slightly faster and have a farther range.
    Wiggles has a request : Make an Advanced Thaumium Golem!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Deeper Understanding
betterquesting.desc:
Now, the first thing I need to ask you, Bandit, is if you've come across a few strange Obelisks in your world? Perhaps a Sinister Node on its own? The Obelisks are strange creations, ones from a darker force. They look like a floating Obsidian pillar, surrounded by a circle of Obsidian looking pedestals. Who created them, I'll cover in a bit, but you MAY have come across them already in your exploration. They are everywhere... followers in blood red robes.
    Sinister Nodes can be easily spotted by the much darker, almost black, patches of grass around them. At night, both these Nodes and the Obelisks are very dangerous places. Creatures that rarely spawn anywhere else can be found there. And it is at these that you'll find the means to advance from a simple Thaumaturge to an amazing one.
    Now, given I don't know your world beyond this... massive... amount of data the technological branches have given me, I'm not sure how prevailant these Sinister Nodes and Obelisks are. I have a solution though! I have given the shopkeeper, Penny, some special materials that may help you. Wiggles and I have collected many a thing, as have all our assistants and apprentices over the years. Most of them are little scraps of knowledge. You too might be able to find some in your world, perhaps from some of those Villagers? But as I was saying, the General Store now has a stash of items (for sale of course) that can help furthur your Thaumaturge career.
    One of the things you'll find, either from Sinister Nodes at night, or from my research materials, is a very very Angry Zombie. Be sure to scan it, and a Brain, with your Thaumometer to start a new line of Research.
    The Brain in a Jar is basically a reanimated... Re-reanimated Zombie Brain! It feeds off the knowledge and energy of creatures that die near it, storing their XP. Giving the Jar a tap will release some of this XP for yourself.
    Normal Thaumium Armor is a decent bit of protection, but with the more dangerous things we'll be dealing with, it just isn't enough. This is where Thaumium Fortress Armor enters the picture! Not only does it look better(I mean, just look at the Thaumium Fortress Helm!), it provides much more protection. Just like Thaumium Armor, it is highly enchantable as well. To Research Fortress Armor, you'll need to Research Infusion Enchanting as well, which should be helpful in its own right!
    Now, usually you have to decide between a protective helmet and your Goggles of Revealing... but no more! With the power of the Infusion Altar you can combine the two with a Slimeball! The downside is you'll lose the Vis discount the Goggles give you. But don't worry, the Thaumium Fortress Helm has a bonus : You can Infuse materials into it to create a fearsome mask. A Thaumium Helm can have both a Mask and the Goggles at the same time.
    Ah, Wiggles reminded me of something! Have you done the Dark Research quest yet? Or learned how to make a Sinister Lodestone? Well, the Sinister Lodestone is carved with a symbol that will glow brightly when you are facing toward a Sinister Node... if you are in range of it. It's a good tool to bring with you, I feel, while exploring!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tinkering Delights
betterquesting.desc:
A somewhat more recent branch of Thaumaturgy deals with tinkering existing ideas and concepts into brand new paths. This includes merging it with technology, delving deeper into Forbidden Knowledge, and working with other magical branches.
    See, while Wiggles and I are pretty open minded about there being other magic, many Thaumaturges, especially centuries old ones, are a bit stuck in the mud. "Thaumaturgy is the only true magic!" they like saying. As, you know, a mage fueling himself with blood energy blasts apart his tower piece by piece. Yep. One true magic.
    Anyways, in your Thauminomicon is a tab marked Thaumic Tinkerer, which will start your Research into this new, different branch.
    A simple change to Quartz can be achieved by combining it with Coal or Charcoal, turning its pristine white coloring to a dusky black of Smokey Quartz.
    That Enchanted Fabric you learned how to make is great for making objects that are highly enchantable. But what if you get an enchantment you don't want? Enter the Spellbinding Cloth. With it, you can wipe away Enchantments from an item by merely combining the two in a crafting bench.
    By distilling the essences of light and air and bottling it, you get this really useful gas. Gaseous Illuminae can be Right Clicked in an area you wish to light up, without having to put down Torches or Lamps.
    Usually you have to decide between armor or your Goggles of Revealing. With a little bit of work, though, and a bit of Vis, you can combine a normal Thaumium Helm and your Goggles into a single piece Wiggles calls the Helmet of Revealing.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Tinkered Flame
betterquesting.desc:
Taking the idea of the Gaseous Illuminae further, we can create few new items on the same concept of gaseous infusion. 
    The flip side of the coin of Illuminae, using a vial of Gaseous Tenebrae will instead fill an area with darkness instead of light.
    No longer need an area filled with Gaseous light or darkness? Shift + Right Click a Fume Dissipator in the area, and it will get rid of all of the gas nearby.
    Hyperenergetic Nitor has a special property to it. As long as it is in your inventory, it will cast a light behind you as you travel.
    The Essentia Funnel should help you transfer Essentia between jars. Place a Hopper pointing to the Warded Jar you want to fill, then place this Funnel on top of the Hopper. Right Click another Warded Jar onto the Essentia Funnel, and it'll empty it's contents into the first Jar... if the essentia will fit, that is.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tinkering with Infusion
betterquesting.desc:
The Hyperenergetic Nitor shows us that we can take Alchemical infusions even further. Wiggles is very insistant in me warning you, though, that some of the research you are about to learn can be VERY DANGEROUS. For reasons of legality and totally NOT because I hate paperwork from accidents, the Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet will automatically be labelling the dangerous items. 
    Now, there are six types of Imbued Fire. Four of them are very dangerous if used wrong. Ordo is one of the safer Imbued Fires. If you make a pile of Ores and Right Click the Ordo Imbued Fire onto it, the flames will consume the Ore, and leave around three times the Metal behind.
    Did you use Imbued Fire wrong? Do you need to contain it? Well, Wiggles and I did warn you. You can 'try' to put out the magical fire with the use of Perdito Imbued Fire, but if it's spread too wide it is probably too late.
    When you Research all of the Infused Fires, you can then Research something a bit safer. You can infuse normal Seeds with any of the six basic elements. When you grow them, you'll get Infused Grains. When you grow different Aspects in the same soil, they can fuse into Combined Aspect seeds. Infused Seeds will also draw aspects from adjacent plants. The Thauminomicon has more information on how this system works.
    Have a lot of worn down tools you don't want to trash and rebuild from scratch? Well, the Thaumic Restorer can definitely help out. Hooking up an Essentia Tube system with jars of Instrumentum Essentia to the Restorer will enable it to repair tools you place into it.
    �lWIGGLES NOTE : �r�oThe Thaumic Restorer infusion does not always work. We haven't figured out why, but you can make it in the Arcane Workbench instead!�r

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tinkered Focus
betterquesting.desc:
Wand Foci are super useful tools for the skilled Thaumaturge, and we can take them even further with a bit of Tinkering. By either combining or altering existing Foci, you can achieve greater and more unique abilities!
    The Wand Focus: Efreet's Flame enables you to convert materials already placed in the world. The effect is the same as if you smelted the block in a vanilla Furnace : So Cobblestone would turn into Stone, for example.
    The Wand Focus: Uprising will allow you to fly in the direction you are aiming. A skilled Thaumaturge can time activations of this Foci on long decents to minimize Vis usage while also not splattering against the ground.
    By refocusing an Uprising Focus into a Wand Focus: Distortion, you can create an air shield around yourself. It will deflect most standard projectiles like Arrows, Snowballs, and Potions. Do note that it is not strong enough to deflect Fireballs or Wither Skull attacks.
    The Wand Focus: Telekinesis allows you to move dropped items around on the ground. By Left Clicking, items will gravitate toward where you aim, while Right Clicking will draw them towards you instead.
    While the Wand Focus: Equal Trade will exchange blocks for other blocks, the Wand Focus: Dislocation Foci will instead teleport blocks as a whole, including Chests and their contents. Right Click a block you want to transport, then Right Click the spot you want to move it. The Vis cost of moving it will be a lot higher than a normal Equal Trade, and even greater if you are Dislocating a Mob Spawner.
    The Wand Focus: Ender Rift lets you access your Ender Chests, whether it be the basic vanilla Ender Chest, or the special color coded ones. By Right Clicking with the Foci on a color-coded Ender Chest, it will copy the color code and open that chest when used. Shift + Right Clicking will open your vanilla Ender Chest.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Mirror Mirror
betterquesting.desc:
By chance, have you scanned an Ender Pearl yet? It's mirrored, otherworldly surface should help lead you to some new research in your Artifice tab, dealing with Mirror Magic. Mirrors, while being great for looking at yourself, are also fantastic conduits of magic. They, like Ender Pearls, seem to bridge a gap in the void between worlds.
    Magic Mirrors work in pairs. You can place one on a wall, then 'bind' a second one to it by Right Clicking it onto the placed Mirror. When you have both Mirror's placed, any items thrown into one will come out the other one. Do note that living things (like you) cannot be teleported between them, and that the more items you send at once, the slower the transfer becomes.
    The Magic Hand Mirror can be linked to any placed Magic Mirror, even if it's bound to another one. You can then Right Click the Magic Hand Mirror and put items into it to send them to the other Mirror. Items can only be be transported FROM the Magic Hand Mirror, though.
    Essentia Mirrors work just like Magic Mirrors in placing and linking, but they do not transport items between them. Instead, though, it will draw Essentia through, if something like an Infusion Altar draws it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tinkered Devices
betterquesting.desc:
We can use the special Thaumic properties of materials in various ways, just by tinkering with them a little. Add in the abilities of the Infusion Altar, and we can bring out the power of them as well! Wiggles particularly likes the Transvector devices, since they play with time and space in very intersting ways, you'll find!
    The Ethereal Platform is an interesting device. Anyone standing on top of it finds it a solid platform... until they start Sneaking, then they will fall through. If you approach it from the sides or underneath, you will pass through it as well.
    Normally, a block only has six sides. By tinkering with time and space, though, we can effectively double this number, using the Transvector Interface!  Place the Interface within 4 blocks of the machine or block you want to Transvector. Then Right Click a Transvector Binder on the Interface, then the block you want to link it to.
    Voila, double the faces! You can now pipe items, power, and more into and out of the Interface, and it will be just like you are doing it to the linked block. You can also disguise the Interface by Right Clicking another block on it, or remove a disguise by Right Clicking with an empty hand.
    The Transvector Dislocator works much like the Interface, only instead of increasing the number of sides, it is able to swap the position of the linked block with whatever block is in front of it. When you place the Dislocator down, you can change which way it is facing with your Wand. You can then use a Transvector Binder on it, then any block within 16 blocks to link that specific location. When a Redstone Signal is applied to the Dislocator, it will swap the block in front of it with the block at the linked location, also swapping any entities next to it. Like the Interface, you can disguise and undisguise the Dislocator.
    By binding the Telekinesis Foci into a free-standing Device, we can have more control over how it works. The basic version is called the Kinetic Attractor. It has two states you can switch between with Right Click : Red to Attract, and Blue to Repel. When you apply a Redstone Signal to it, it will push or pull items nearby depending on how strong the signal is. At max strength, it will effect items 7.5 blocks away.
    The Corporeal Attractor works just like the Kinetic Attractor, except it pushes or pulls creatures and other entities instead of items. You can also Right Click a Soul Mould on a creature to copy it as a Pattern. Then Right Click the Corporeal Attractor with your Wand to open the interface, and place the Soul Mould into it. It will only effect that type of creature, and you can choose whether it effects adults or children.
    Furthuring the research on Golems, you can take a blank Golem Core, and work it into a stationary device that will magically animate and use almost any item you want. The Dynamism Tablet can be configured to Left or Right Click an item or block, and whether to do it all the time or when a Redstone Signal is applied. You can change the direction of the Dynamism Tablet by Right Clicking it with your wand : the circle on top shows which way it is pointing.
    Tinkering with and advancing on the Arcane Levitator, you can create a Levitational Locomotive. By placing two Relays in a straight line, they will project a power beam between each other. Placing a Levitational Locomotive in this beam will enable it to move along it, while also moving any block placed atop it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Tinkered Offensive
betterquesting.desc:
There are a variety of things you can do with Thaumaturgy. Create golems, forge armor, make tools. All of these things, with a clever mind, can help a wizard survive even the most dangerous situations. 
    There are a few tools Wiggles and I can suggest to give you that edge. I'll warn you ahead of time, though, you'll want to use all the tricks you can to stabilize your Infusion Altar. 
    By now you've probably collected a good bit of warp from the darker, more eldritch knowledge of the universe. While sometimes the side effects are good, other times the effects can be a little disconcerting. The Talisman of Remedium can help stop these side effects. By holding it and Right Clicking it to activate it, you can then wear it in your Amulet slot.  When a Warp effect would hit you, the Amulet will absorb it instead, taking damage.
    A good Thaumaturge always has a good weapon by his side for when his Wand fails. Only a foolish wizard believes he is untouchable. The Cursed Spirit's Blade is a powerful weapon, capable of severing the souls of the creatures you kill. By Shift + Right Clicking while holding the blade, you activate this severing property. These souls are rich in Essences.  Note that this special ability will wear the sword down faster.
    The souls that drop from creatures killed with the Cursed Blade are different for each creature. You can use these souls to reanimate the creature once again with this Tablet of Necromancy. Place the tablet down, and then 3 Arcane Pedestals next to it. In these Pedestals, place 3 of these souls that make up the creature you want to resurrect. You can take 9 of one type of these Souls and combine them into a Condensed Soul. Then Infuse 9 of these together (1 in the center, 8 around it) into an Infused Soul Aspect. These will not be consumed to summon the creature, but each summoning will be slow.
    Normal Enchanting leaves a lot to be desired, but it is fairly simple in return for its randomness. The Osmotic Enchanter, though, is a complex device that is well worth the effort! The Osmotic Enchanter is much more complex than I can explain here. Your Thauminomicon is much better at explaining it than I am.
    When holding and Shift + Right Clicking this Talisman, you activate its ability to store Experience. You can then Right Click with the Talisman and an empty Glass Bottle in your inventory to extract it into a Bottle o' Enchanting. This should help store extra Experience and keep it safe from loss via an untimely death.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Truth of the Universe
betterquesting.desc:
As you may have noticed, the deeper into Forbidden Knowledge you delve, the frequency of Warp Events increases. That is because this knowledge is beyond even the most powerful Thaumaturge's ability to understand, as they deal with dark gods, dark beings, and the truth of the universe : that there are things of such power that we cannot comprehend them without going mad. If you stop even temporarily Warping your mind, as well as stop all methods of preventing Warp events, their occurance will eventually stop...
    But you you cannot, must not, ignore it. Hiding under the covers doesn't make the monster go away. You must face the Eldritch head on, control your fear, and master it.
    Your Thauminomicon should have a new tab called Eldritch, beneath Golemancy. If it does not, advance your knowledge in other areas of Thaumcraft, and then come back here so Wiggles and I can guide you.
    Your first steps into understanding the Eldritch is to learn how to make Void Metal, a material with strange self-healing properties. Research the Void Metal before attempting to create the Void Seed, which is needed to make the Void Metal. From there, you can shape the Void Metal into various tools. It isn't as magically enchantable as Thaumium, but any damage it takes seems to slowly repair itself.
    Beyond normal tools, you can shape the Void Metal into Wand Caps. While the Void Metal itself seems to be resistant to magic, it appears to be able to channel it with ease. Like many powerful Wand Caps, you'll need to infuse it to make a Charged Void Metal Cap.
    Using the shape changing properties of Void Metal also enables you to make much larger, more versatile Essentia storage devices. The Essentia Reservoir can hold up to 256 Essentia of any combination. Like Warded Jars, it can only accept Essentia from one side, but you are able to change which side that is. The downside, though, is that you cannot fill or remove Essentia by hand, only via Tubes or Golems.
    Oh, uh, do note... please please please do not dismantle and pick up an Essentia Reservoir that still has Essentia in it. Please? Now then...
    Some crafty Thaumaturge added a way to check your Warp levels to the Thauminomicon with a small device called the Sanity Checker. The problem is he was also paranoid, and obsfucated the way the information is presented...

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Primal, Wild, Dangerous
betterquesting.desc:
Working with Void Metal will lead you to understanding a force of creation known as Primal. In a way, it is the representation of the power of chaos and order combined, the balance of the worlds in its most pure form. Working with Primal is to work with chaos, but a good Thaumaturge balances risk and reward on a daily basis.
    Wiggles says you may not see the Research for the Primal Focus to start with. She couldn't either, until she held a Primal Charm for a few minutes, trying to understand it's nature.
    The Wand Focus: Primal is a weapon, pure and simple and destructive. The problem is, it works off Chaos, so it is also unpredictable, both in damage and how it travels. When used, you launch a Primal missle, which will randomly twist and turn in the air, and explode when it hits something. Wiggles says to be sure to scan the Primal Focus with your Thaumometer, it should lead you to further Research.
    By combining all the speciality wand rods with a pair of Primal Charms via infusion, you can create one of the best, and dangerous, Wand Staff Cores around. Like each individual rod, the Staff Core of the Primal will slowly replenish its own stores of Vis, and it will also boost the power of any Foci used with it. Like any Rod or Staff Core, you'll need to add your own Wand Caps to it.
    There is a barrier of knowledge that seperates Master and Grandmaster Thaumaturges : How deep their knowledge of the Eldritch goes. By now, you've gained some Warp, enough to start delving into the Eldritch, forbidden knowledge, but it may not have been enough.  The Eldritch Revelation may not hit a Thaumaturge for many weeks, or it may have already hit. If it hasn't, Wiggles and I have discovered a way to push it along.
    Zombie Brains. Yuck, yes, but... eating them gives you a temporary view into the Warp from the once-living's eyes. If you do choose to take this path, you can make yourself hungry by exhausting yourself on Paving Stones of Travel, or spending a night battling monsters. Keep an eye on your Sanity Meter, keeping it as full as you can.
    While waiting for this Warp Event, you should locate and read the Crimson Rites book. Either find and kill Crimson Cultists in your world, or procure one from the Thaumic Research Materials item in the Shop. Both are very rare.
    Fortress Armor is great, but we're going to be stepping into even more dangerous areas. We need something to protect us from the dangers of the Eldritch, the chaos, the void. Void Thaumaturge clothing does this quite well. We'll only ask you to make the Hood, as you may have found better armor yourself by now.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Outer Lands
betterquesting.desc:
The Crimson Rites book the Cultists hold sound like the ravings of madmen... but in their ramblings lies deeper understanding into the Eldritch knowledge. This has opened an opportunity that not even Wiggles and I have had : Traveling to the Eldritch realm known as The Outer Lands. What will you find there, we can only guess... You are going to have to do the research and infuse Eldritch Eyes, and this will enable you to open the gate yourself. Remember any of those Obelisks that you sometimes find the Cultists around? That is where you'll need to take them.
    Infuse the Four Eldritch Eyes and bring them to an Obelisk, one that still has its Aura Node intact. Right Click the Eyes on the center Altar, and then you will need to use a Wand with 100 of each Vis to force the portal open. When ready... step through. 
    Please be careful. Arm, Armor, and Equip yourself with everything you think you need to survive, and then go further. The only things we know of the Outer Lands is that they are supremely dangerous. We'll look at the data your Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet will be feeding us directly. Safe journey, Bandit.
    You are bringing your Thaumometer right? Start scanning everything. Add this information to your Thauminomicon as fast as you can.
------------------------
    What? This place is very strange. It isn't what we expected from the research... and scanning the Glyphed Stones and Runes in the walls shows that this place isn't normal, something else constructed it... but why? Search deep, Bandit, we need to figure this mystery out... Our scans are vaguely signifying a powerful key hidden somewhere in the maze. A Runed Tablet?
    The Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet shows that the tablet has the same magical resonance as another device in the Outer Lands. Beyond that device seems to sit a very powerful creature.
    Wiggles has tried to decipher the readings on the tablet as best she can. She can only make out that the tablet is a key, and it will lead you to a "Champion of the Eldritch."
    Be very careful, Bandit. This sounds extremely dangerous.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Primordial Power
betterquesting.desc:
That Primordial Pearl... we've only heard barest hints of it from the most powerful Thaumaturges of the ages. Things they said in passing, warnings of the destructive power of the fabric of creation. That these... Eldritch Champions hold them is very chilling news.
    With your discovery of how to reach the Outer Lands, Wiggles, myself, and some other Thaumaturges have already made an excursion into it. The Outer Lands stretch... forever. Not just in space, but in time. I was hoping we could use it to get you home, but... No, I feel this is one of the  keys to getting you home. Our group fought hard, and we obtained a few of these Primordial Pearls, but had to fall back. The fact that you, on your own, obtained one is amazing.
    We've already begun research into using the Pearls. Scan your Pearl with your Thaumometer, and you'll see what we've started to research.
    The first thing we've come up with is using the power of the Primordial Pearl to alter and improve on the Alchemical Furnace design, by creating an Advanced Alchemical Construct. Creating these will not consume the Pearl, thankfully. Your Thauminomicon will have the layout you need, and the proper information, for the new Alchemical Furnace.
    If you take a quick glance at the Apocryphia tab in your Thauminomicon, in the upper right is a Research you can do for Primordial Scribing Tools. This finally fixes the need to have so much black dye for ink, making your Scribing Tools never run out. This will not consume the pearl to craft! Don't forget to go back to the Eldritch tab for the last task!
    One of our successful Infusion attempts with the Primordial Pearl is the Primordial Crusher. Combining the Shovel of the Earthmover and the Pickaxe of the Core with Void Metal versions, infusing them onto a Pearl, creates this very powerful, destructive tool.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Thaumic Exploration
betterquesting.desc:
There is a whole universe of possibilities in the world of Thaumcraft, and exploring them can take a lifetime. It's one reason the Thauminomicon was created in the first place, as all Thaumaturges are able to tap into the information gathered. 
    In your Thaumonomicon, on the right side is a tab called Thaumic Esoterica. This delves into further exploration in the Thaumic Arts at all levels.
    At the top of this page should be the Magic Tallow research you've already done. From here, you can further Explore this branch. The first thing we can easily make is Floating Candles, which look very magical, but as Wiggles learned the hard way, don't help with the Infusion Altar.
    Further research can be done in curing Rotten Flesh from Zombies, and then finally making Cured Zombie Brains. While not completely useful just yet, it should only take a bit more Research to discover the possibilities.
    Working in the Tower, there has been many times that I've just forgotten to eat, or am so engrossed in my Research that Wiggles has had to force me to take a break and get a snack. The Talisman of Nourishment was made for busybodies like me. Keeping it on your hotbar, any simple food you also put on the hotbar will be consumed by the Talisman. It will then slowly nourish you over time.
    Wiggles has figured out how to link Warded Jars together into a sort of network. By creating a Binding Seal and binding Essentia to it in your Cauldron, you can make a Seal that you can add to empty Jars to create a network. This is an interesting thing and I'm still not fully clear on how it works.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Exploring Infusion
betterquesting.desc:
The ability to Infuse things gives us a wide rane of possibilities to explore. A lot of research has been done into this area, not only by other Thaumaturges, but by Wiggles and myself as well, as its an interesting and sometimes dangerous way of expanding knowledge. There is a handful of really interesting Infusions we think you can make use of, in your situation.
    The Everful Urn is a vessel of water that will never run out. You can pipe out the water from the top, or use buckets on it nonstop. As a bonus, the Everful Urn will fill nearby Crucibles, put out you or your assistants if they are on fire, and fill Petal Apothecaries from the Botania branch as well!
    The counter to the Everful Urn is the Everburn Urn. It will always contain Lava and dispense it... but for a cost.  The Everburn Urn requires a cVis network to power it.
    Sometimes discovering new research is tough. Finding fragments of knowledge from villagers, or from the supplies we've given the Corporate Shop, is slow and expensive. A new way to get these Knowledge Fragments was worked out using those Cured Zombie Brains. By putting a few in a Warded Jar with a few other bits and pieces, they can communicate with each other as they delve and consume stacks of Books. You'll need to set this Think Tank on a vanilla Bookshelf, and keep the 3x3 area around them clear, and fill their tank with as many Books as you can.
    The Void Jar is a useful tool for getting rid of extra Essentia, but it is quite limited. It only works on a single Essentia type, so you'd need a Void Jar of every Essentia in the long run. The Oblivion Jar is different. It will accept any Essentia piped into the top and immediately destroy it. It has the weakest 'draw' of all, so it will only pull Essentia in a pipe system if it has nowhere else to go.
    The Crucible of Souls is a dangerous but useful device. Any creatures, INCLUDING PETS, near it will slowly be drained of their life essence and killed. Instead of the normal things that creature would drop, it will instead be converted into Essentia that can be piped out. The good news is, it won't hurt you or your assistants. The bad news is, sometimes the Essentia breaks down to component aspects, or directly into Flux, which will need to be cleaned up.
    Given your current situation, I'm sure that you've run low on specific simple building materials quite regularly. Nothing says awkward like a house built of five different types of wood. Or thats what Wiggle says, I think essentricity is part of being a wizard. Well, the Thaumic Replicator can definitely help you. You can Right Click any simple material, like Logs or Stone, nothing too complex, onto the device, then Right Click it with your Wand. It will then draw Essentia nearby, similar to the Infusion Altar, to create a copy. You can automate this by applying a Redstone Signal to the Replicator, and have a Hopper underneath it pulling the duplicated item out.
    This curious device was devised by a friend. It's supposed to be able to hold some of your Warp, if you supply it with Mortuus Essentia and some cVis from a network, but he didn't leave full instructions on how it works.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Exploring Equipment
betterquesting.desc:
A good Thaumaturge needs good equipment to explore the wide universe. You already got a good amount, like the Traveler's Boots and the Thaumostatic Harness, but there is always better equipment. Whether its specializing a piece of equipment, improving a piece, or something entirely new, it's always a smart move to explore all your options, no?
    Improving the Boots of the Traveler is no small feat. By infusing the properties of ice and cold, you can turn them into Boots of the Comet. While giving you a speed boost, it will also freeze water under your feet, so no lake or ocean can stop your journey.
    A different way of improving the Boots of the Traveler will surely give you a step up in mobility. By Infusing the properties of fire, you can make the Boots of the Meteor. While giving you an even bigger speed boost, you can also launch yourself in the direction you are looking by Sneak + Jumping. If you Sneak again while in midair, you will slam on the ground and cause a small shockwave around you.
    You can craft some simple rings with a few Shards that will improve your useage of that element of Vis, like when using a Focus. The Ring of Water, for example, will give you a 3 percent discount on Aqua useage.
    The Wispy Dreamcatcher is a long time occult favorite, though it usually is branded as otherwise. They are made to catch bad dreams, and let only good ones through. A good Thaumaturge is able to make one not to catch bad dreams, but bad attacks, specifically from Tainted Creatures. It won't stop all the damage, but it will lessen it as long as you carry it on your hotbar.
    In a dangerous world, the wrong footing can land you in deep trouble. Sometimes its not your own footing, but the strength of the creature that just slapped you. The Thaumostatic Girdle, when worn, will negate any knockback from creatures that hit you. It will especially be helpful at night, and when wearing the Thaumostatic Harness.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Exploring Wandcraft
betterquesting.desc:
We've already made a big variety of Wands and Wand Caps, but there is always more to learn. Expanding one's choices is always a good idea, you know?
    The Necromancer's Staff Core has a pretty big Vis storage amount. To boot, it also gets four times the amount of Vis from killing enemies. The downside is, drawing Vis from a Node or other source is quite inefficient. Another upside? Makes a good smacking stick, since it causes the enemies to slowly wither away too!
    The Transmutative Rod and Transmutative Staff Cores don't have the best Vis storage, but they boast a pretty interesting feature! If any Vis is below 90 percent, it will transform any Vis above 90 percent into it. That way, if you have an abundance of one type of Vis, you can covert it into other types.
    �lWIGGLES NOTE :�r �oThe Transmutative Rod infusion does not always work. We haven't figured out why, but you can make it in the Arcane Workbench instead!�r
    Amber Rod and Amber Staff Cores cannot hold much Vis at all. But it can recharge all of the Vis types on its own. It's good for Foci use, I feel.
    The Mechanist's Wand Cap enables you to draw Vis from a Node much faster than normal.
    The Sojourner's Wand Cap enables your Wand to draw Vis from Nodes nearby without the need for a Wand Recharge Station and all the devices required to use it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Sticky, Ichy Power
betterquesting.desc:
There are very few things that separate the top tier of Thaumaturges from everyone else. You've already shown you are near the top, having traversed The Outer Lands and survived, which few Thaumaturges have done. You've explored the depth of Thaumaturgy, poured over books and scrolls and created wonderous devices. 
    There is something only fabled the greatest Thaumaturges can create, requiring super rare, dangerous ingredients. The kind we've rarely seen here at The Ferret Business, but your world... your worlds, in their untapped glory, may hold the keys.
    In your Thauminomicon, in the Thaumic Tinkerer section, you should see to the lower right, past the Enchantments, a new research called Ichor. If you do not, go back and make sure you've Researched every item, every bauble, in the Basic Information, Thaumaturgy, Alchemy, Artifice, Golemancy, Eldritch, and Thaumic Tinkerer tabs of the book.
    There are two dimensions very close to your own. You've had to go to at least one of them for materials for your Thaumaturgy already. You'll need to travel to both, though, for the first pieces.
    The Nether is home to usually non-hostile creatures called Zombie Pigmen. They will become bloodthirsty at the slightest provocation though. They hold the first thing you need, the Nether Shard.
    The End, though, is home to the odd, strange Endermen. And an Ender Dragon, but what you need is carried by the Endermen only in The End : The Ender Shard.
    The next item you'll need is a Nether Star. Here, it is near impossible to find them, but your world contains the ability to summon The Wither, a dangerous creature that can destroy the land around it easily. Place four Soul Sand in a T, and place three Wither Skulls on top. Be sure you are well away from your base, and equipped for a fight.
    Make sure your Infusion Altar is set up as best as it can be. You'll be using the Shards, a Diamond, and an Ender Eye to dismantle the Nether Star, and draw out the pure essence of power called Ichor.
    To utilize the Ichor, we're going to need to bind it to something. Ichorcloth should be able to hold it, if we use Diamonds to help control the power. Thankfully, it won't require an Infusion Altar, but... 
    Well, you are going to need the best dang wand you can make, that's for sure. And probably a full set of Thaumaturge's Robes.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Ichy Creations
betterquesting.desc:
Ichorium has such great power potential! Wiggles and I have been examing all the data and a few samples of it, and are constantly amazed at each new discovery we find! We should figure out just what we can do with Ichorium. Tools? Weapons? Devices? There are so many things... we should get started!
    Ichorcloth is fantastic for fabric creations, but if we want to make anything more solid, we should invest in creating an Ichorium. Combining some Ichor with Thaumium and a Diamond should do just fine!
    We can Infuse Ichorcloth, a Portable Hole Foci, and a few other pieces into your Foci Pouch to vastly improve it. Not only can you still use the Bottomless Pouch as a Foci Pouch, you can also store a lot of items in it.
    Ichorium Wand Caps vastly improve your useage of Vis, giving you a 30% discount on any wand made with Ichorium Wand Caps.
    The Feline Amulet, when worn in the Amulet slot, will scare away Creepers who get too close. It will also disable their explosion trigger.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Ichy Fashion
betterquesting.desc:
What better way to utilize Ichorcloth than to make... clothing! Ichor Robes should have the defensive levels of Diamond Armor, but it won't ever break. From there, we can Infuse and upgrade each piece to do something unique and powerful.
    By Infusing a Thaumonomicon, a Primal Focus, Goggles of Revealing, and a variety of other items, we can turn an Ichorcloth Cowl into a Cowl of the Abyssal Depths. Not only does it act as Goggles of Revealing, it also lets you breath and see underwater, and always regenerate health even on an empty stomach.
    Robes of the Stratosphere combine the strength of Ichorcloth Robes with the Distortion and Primal Foci, the Thaumostatic Harness, and more. The Robes grant unlimited flight, and will deflect minor projectiles like Arrows. Oh, make sure that the Thaumostatic Harness is fully repaired first.
    The Leggings of the Burning Mantle increase the light generative power of Hyperenergetic Nitor, projecting it forward like a flashlight. It also will convert normal fire damage into healing.
    Boots of the Horizontal Shield act like Boots of the Traveler, increasing your jump, move speed, and step height. They also induce a Haste II effect, making you move faster and turn Dirt into Grass when you walk over it.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Ichy Wandwork
betterquesting.desc:
From here, we can expand on the things we improve with Ichor to include Wand Cores and Foci. This should help lead us deeper into making the best tools and devices we can.
    By Infusing Ichor onto a Silverwood Wand Core, we create one of the best wand cores ever : The Ichorcloth Strapped Silverwood Wand Core! It holds one thousand of each Vis type!
    Filling such a powerful Wand is a daunting task. Thankfully, we can use Ichor to create the Wand Focus: Experience Drain that will convert our very own Experience pool into Vis. While it works very fast, it isn't very efficient!
    To help gather Experience faster, you can use the Wand Focus: Shadowbeam. It creates a beam of energy that damages everything in its path, and can bounce off blocks like mirrors.
    Infusing a Transvector Dislocator onto a Paving Stone of Travel with some Ichor allows you to create a powerful teleportation network via Celestial Gateways. You'll need to create Celestial Pearls, that can copy the locations you place Celestial Gateways. Shift + Right Click a Celestial Pearl onto a Gateway to bind it, then any other Gateway you place the Pearl into will be able to teleport you to it. To see locations a Gateway has, Sneak while standing on it.
    When out exploring, you can use the Wand Focus: Celestial Recall to recall to a Celestial Gateway, as long as you have a Celestial Pearl in your inventory bound to one.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Ichy Tools
betterquesting.desc:
Now, with all the research and testing of the capabilities of Ichor items, I feel we're ready to harness them in the power of tools. Given the sheer energy contained in these tools, simple Wood will not suffice. You'll have to use Silverwood Wand Rods for the handles. Each tool will also require a complex Infusion ritual to unlock the full potential of each one.
    OH, A VERY SERIOUS NOTE : At the end of this research is a new research, called The Worldshaper's Looking Glass... I highly suggest avoiding it right now. It seems to have rare but serious reality-breaking consequences. 
    [[There is a bug occasionally where Infusing and removing the Worldshaper's Looking Glass will crash and break your world. You have been warned!]]
    The Awakened Ichorium Pickaxe can carve through Stone like butter. It has multiple modes you can switch between by Sneak + Right Clicking. As a bonus, this is the only pickaxe that can pierce through the Bedrock of your world, by transforming one into a Portal that will lead you deeper into the world.
    Be careful! This is somewhat unstable, and may have odd aftereffects.  
    [[Upon returning from the Bedrock World, your game world may freeze. Wait a while, try placing blocks, and dropping items to unstick yourself. If all else fails, restart Minecraft]]
    The Awakened Ichorium Shovel gives you a powerful tool in clearing soft materials like Dirt and Sand. Like the Pickaxe, you can switch between various modes with Sneak + Right Click.
    The Awakened Ichorium Axe gives you a powerful cutting tool. You can switch between modes with Sneak + Right Click. Not only is the Awakened Ichorium Axe great at chopping through wood, its also good at cutting through foliage and plantlife.
    �lWIGGLES NOTE : �r�oThe Awakened Ichorium Axe infusion works...except for some reason it tries to make the Awakened Ichorium Sword instead! We haven't figured out why, but you can make it in the Arcane Workbench instead!�r
    The Awakened Ichorium Sword gives you a fantastic offensive weapon. Like the other Ichorium tools, it has multiple modes you can switch between with Sneak + Right Click. One of the modes is called Soul. Every hit will grant you a Soul Heart, which are consumed first if you are damaged.
    By Infusing Clay into Protoclay and keeping it in your inventory, it will automatically swap your Awakened Ichorium Tools around to the proper one when needed. If you are holding, say, the Pickaxe and start hitting Wood, it will automatically switch you to the Axe instead.
    The last tool to make is quite helpful when using the Awakened Ichorium Pickaxe or similar. By Right Clicking the Black Hole Ring onto any block, you set the Block type for it. Any of the material you gather above a single stack will automatically be stored in the Ring. It can store billions of a single block type. If you Right Click the Black Hole Ring onto an inventory, it will fill it as much as it can. You can also Right Click in the world normally to place the block. When it is empty, you can Right Click a different block to reset the type.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Forbidden Arts
betterquesting.desc:
Older Thaumaturges are kind of, well... stuck in the mud, if you get my drift. They don't want to accept any other types of magic as legitimate, even if its smacking their nose off with a Thorn Chakram or something. To them, I say fah! They can be back in the stone age of wizardry, while you and I and our assistants and familiars pursue every avenue of Thaumaturgy we can. In your Thaumonomicon, you shall find a tab marked Apocryphia, or Forbidden Magic, where all these researches can be found. 
    By mixing some Shards in when you refill your Scribing Tools, you can make a set of Crystal Scribing Tools that will absorb a little bit of knowledge as you use them. When empty, you can then hold them and Right Click for a little boost in Aspects for further research!
    Of all the creatures your world has, I'm surprised it's missing Squids. Perhaps they were overpopulated at one time? No matter, there are easier ways of getting black ink! The Umbral Bush can be planted, and it will spread like weeds. Harvesting the Roses, you can crush them to create more black ink.
     I personally don't approve of animal cruelty, but I've known Thaumaturges who work with animals a lot, and they say sometimes the only thing that will get an animal to pay attention is a slap with a piece of hard leather like a Riding Crop: not enough to seriously harm them, but enough to get their attention. Holding the Riding Crop while riding a Horse or other animal, you can Right Click to boost the speed of the animal a bit.
    By utilizing Taint carefully, we can Infuse a Thaumium Pickaxe and turn it into a Distortion Pickaxe. The harder the material you use it on, the easier it cuts through. Though the inverse is true: the softer the material, the harder it is to break with the Distortion Pickaxe.
    The Shovel of the Purifyer is specially Infused to dig through Tainted land. As it digs out the corrupted soil and fibres, it has a chance of crystallizing the Taint in a safe form : a Taint Shard. As well, if you Right Click with the Shovel, it will clear out Flux Gloo in an area around it, but will damage the Shovel faster.
    By mixing Tainted Goo with some Stone, you create Tainted Stone, which is resistant to Taint, that you can use to make paths and build in Tainted Lands.
    Most trees and plantlife cannot live and grow in Tainted Land, as the fiberous corruption saps their life. By working some Taint into an Oak Sapling, though, we can create a Tainted Sapling that can survive. The logs and planks you can make are resistant to Taint spread, and the Logs can be smelted into Hexcoal, which has some odd properties.
    The Tainted Rod, when used in a Wand, gives a decent amount of Vis storage. The Wand will also regenerate up to 10 percent of all Vis types if you hold it while in Tainted Lands. As well, when you are damaged by Flux Taint, it will regenerate more Vis.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Forbidden Tools of Sin
betterquesting.desc:
The Nether is quite a dangerous, evil place, but it also has some quite interesting, magical things going for it. There is a set of Crystal Shards there that only materialize when certain things happen while you are in the Nether. Some of them are easy, others are quite difficult! The Apocrypha tab has information on some of them, but it can be quite cryptic... so I will explain better for you!
      Wrath : Kill creatures with heavy damage.
      Envy : Some Zombie Pigmen carry this...
      Lust : That Riding Crop? Zombie Pigmen. That's all I'm saying...
      Sloth : Kill something through a proxy... like with spikes!
      Greed : Use Looting enhanced weapon to kill.
      Gluttony : Eat food.
      Pride : Kill a boss (like the Wither).
    Now, I know some of these might be quite... difficult. But thankfully, the Acrophya tab also has an Infusion Enchantment you can learn called Corrupting. Enchant a Pickaxe with it, and mining normal Crystal Ores will sometimes create these Nether based Shards.
    With Envy Shards, you can transform a Thaumium Pickaxe into a Chamelon Pickaxe. You can also do the same to a Thaumium Axe or Shovel. These tools are special : You can Sneak + Right Click to cycle between three different 'copies' of the weapon, each one can have a different set of Enchantments on it!
    With Wrath Shards, you can change a Thaumium Axe into a Skulltaker. It is exceptionally good at taking the skulls of Skeletons and Creepers, but kinda bad at chopping plantlife.
    The Diabolist Fork, on its own, is a pretty decent weapon. But when you've researched the Wrath Cage as well, it gains new abilities. If you are carrying a Blank Imprinting Crystal when you slay a compatable creature with the Fork, it will imprint itself. You can then take this crystal and put it in a Wrath Cage. The Wrath Cage is like a Monster Spawner, but reacts to Redstone Signals. It requires Essentia of the appropriate type to be piped into it, either related to the creature, Ira, or Desidia. You can switch which Essentia will fuel it by Right Clicking a Diabolist Fork on the Wrath Cage.
    When worn, the Ring of Nutrition will improve the Hunger and Satiaty of any food you eat. There may occasionally be side effects, though.
    The Infernal Rod is a very hellish Wand Core. It holds a decent amout of Vis, and will regenerate up to 25 percent of Ignis Vis. While in the Nether, it will also regenerate 10 percent of all other Vis.
    By using the Wand Focus: BLink, all you need to do is aim at the location you want to be and Right Click, and you will instantly teleport there!
    Thaumic Cake is delicious! By Infusing a bit of Gluttony into a normal Cake, you can create a self-regenerating, delicious confection. As long as a tiny sliver remains, Thaumic Cake will slowly regenerate back to a full cake. Wiggles has banned this from the tower, unfortunately... not because it might be evil, but because we were both putting on some weight...
    By warping an Amulet of Vis Storage with some Lust Shards, you can make a very uh... unique collar. It's good if you are in constant fights and get hit a lot, as each hit you take will also recharge a bit of Vis in it.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Botaniacal Soil
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lGardener Greg§r]
    It seems §3§lInventologist Irvine§r and §3§lBotonist Bitsy§r were talking, and they came up with some special §lsoil§r you might be interested in.
    They've replaced the §lRF Energy§r components to the §lsoil§r with §4§lBotania§r materials, so that you can grow these §lseeds§r with §lMana§r instead. Just aim a §lMana Spreader§r at the soil itself.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Fluxed Crystals 2
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lGardener Greg§r]   
    I got some fancy new §lseeds§r for you! They are fairly special, mind you, as they're a product of a few different labs here at §3§lThe Business§r. One of em used to be the §4§lMagical Crops§r one, but their §lseeds§r were mutatin' weirdly and needed to go back to the drawing board.            
    Now, these §lseeds§r are a mite different. Instead of growing §lvegetables§r and §lgrains§r, they'll grow goods for ya. Things like §lstone§r, §lsand§r, §lmetal§r, and even §lgemstones§r!
    First, you'll need some special §5§lPowered Soil§r, which that §3§lInvent'n§r guy §3§lIrvine§r says don't need no §lwater§r or §ldirt§r, just some §lRF Energy§r to grow the §lspecial seeds§r.
    These, known as §5§lUniversal Seeds§r, are like a blank piece o' paper. They don't do much on their own, but combined with a §5§lSeed Infuser§r, they become quite a useful little thing!
    All you need to do is take the §5§lUniversal Seed§r and an appropriate amount of §lmaterial§r, and it turns em' into a crystaline §lSeed§r. 
    §3§lIrvine§r said that §4§lNEI§r is quite  useful for findin' what ya can make.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Powered Production
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lGardener Greg§r]
    Now then, ya can keep making cheap §ltools§r with those §lRough Shards§r, or ya can actually make something useful out of them... like the actual resources!
    To do that, you'll have to clean up and refine those §lShards§r through a couple stages to turn them into useful material. These two machines I'll show ya will actually require §lRF Energy§r, unlike the §lInfuser§r. 
    The §5§lGem Cutter§r can take yer §lRough Shards§r, and with a bit of power, cut em down and polish em up into §5§lSmooth Shards§r, which you can then put into a §5§lGem Refiner§r, which'll further process them into the §lResource§r for that §lseed§r, which in yer case right now is §lSand§r!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Crystal Growth
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lGardener Greg§r]
    Now then, ya know how to make the §lPowered Soil§r and the §lInfuser§r and the blank §lUniversal Seed§r. Now we can actually make a §lSeed§r. I'll have you test it with something easy to find anywhere... §lSand§r!
    Take 32 §lSand§r and a §lUniversal Seed§r and put them into the §lInfuser§r and hit §l§nInfuse§r. You'll get a §5§lSand Seed§r in return. You can then plant this in §lPowered Soil§r, that is being powered with §lRF Energy§r of course, and eventually you can harvest it by §l§nRight Clicking§r it to get some §5§lRough Shards§r. 
    If ya want to get the most out of your harvest, yer gonna want to invest in a §5§lScythe§r (§omake sure its one from §4§l§o§oFluxed Crystals§r§o!§r) When you harvest using the §5§lScythe§r, you are more likely to get a bigger harvest.
    You can then take them §5§lRough Shards§r and shape em into some basic §ltools§r like §5§lpicks§r and§5 §lswords§r. 
    §3§lIrvine§r did mention that if ya want to make harvesting easier, you could make an §5§lAutomation Upgrade§r, and §l§nRight Click§r it onto a §lPowered Soil§r. When the crop is ready to harvest, it'll simply just pop the shards right out! You'll have to find a way to collect em yourself, though!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Kitchen Counter
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Hmmm, Candy has brought me up to date on the purpose of this... §4§lCooking for Blockheads§r? Kind of insulting, no?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    It's a hipper term with young chefs right now. Related to some really popular §lgame§r they all play. But they also have passion for §lcooking§r, so marketing...
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Oh, marketing. Explains everything, don't need to say any more. Always poking at our...
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Anyways, it isn't really a concern for §d§lBandit§r here. The proper concern is how to utilize this new kitchen line, right?
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Oh. Yes yes. So the main piece is the §5§lCooking Table§r?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Right. It works just like the §lCooking for Blockheads II§r book. It'll only §lshow recipes§r you can make with §lingredients in your inventory§r.
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Ah, only minorly useful if you can do the same with that book, no? What if you need to §lcook§r part of the dish?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    That's where the §5§lCooking Oven§r comes in! As long as it is §lplaced next to§r any other part of this kitchen line, recipes that utilize the §5§lOven§r will show up.
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Hmm, it takes a moment, but it is §lmuch faster§r cooking than with a normal §lFurnace§r. Inspecting it, the §5§lOven§r appears to cook up to §l9 pieces§r at a time? Marvelous.
    Ahh, I also see where the patented §3§lFerret Business§r teleportation shenanigans come into play. Do all the pieces work likewise?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Yep, any part of the §4§lCooking for Blockheads§r line, as long as they are §ltouching§r each other, §lconnect§r.
    You'll have to put §lfuel§r into the §5§lOven§r §lby hand§r, though. Safety reasons, according to mark...
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Yes yes always marketting. That is fine. I see there are §lfour storage spots§r on the §5§lOven§r. What are they for?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Oh, you can §lstore§r some §lpots and pans§r in those. Recipes that §lrequire§r them will see them and §lshow the appropriate recipes§r.
