[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Fantastic.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Upgrades? Upgrades!
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lGardener Greg§r]
    Along with all the designs and instructions §3§lInventologist Irvine§r gave me, he also had a box marked §lUpgrades§r with it. 
    Now, I'm not quite sure what some of these do. I've done testing and some are pretty simple to figure out, but §3§lIrvine§r sort of forgot to include instructions on how many of these work...
    The §lRefiner§r and the §lCutter§r can have four upgrades in each of them. 
    §lPowered Soil§r can have §lupgrades§r as well, just §l§nRight Click§r one onto the §lSoil§r. Each §lSoil§r can have up to three §lUpgrades§r, and you can remove them by §l§nShift + Right Clicking§r the soil with an empty hand.
    The §5§lSpeed Upgrade§r makes both §lmachines§r and §lPowered Soil§r work faster.
    The §5§lEfficiency Upgrade§r will lower the §lpower§r a §lmachine§r or §lsoil§r requires to function.
    The §5§lNocturnal Upgrade§r uh.... does... I'm not sure. §3§lIrvine§r didn't really explain it when he gave it to me.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: MineFactory Reloaded
betterquesting.desc:
You're here, great! Like I said, my name is Meeka. My twin brother and I are the head factory engineers here at The Ferret Business. While he focuses smaller, more powerful systems, I focus on getting things moving like clockwork.
    Now, I hear talk about how your world's materials are all infused with Magic, and I've been doing some tinkering on my own with samples and... I'm already loving what I've found! I think we can come up with a better, more efficient factory.
    First though, you'll need to gather some materials and the basic components...
    Bouncy Bouncy, who doesn't like rubber? Good cushion, good insulator, fun material! Scans show you have Rubber Trees around. Multiple types, in fact, but the one I know of has sort of an orangish bark and bright green leaves. Chop it down and you'll get some Raw Rubber, which you can Smelt down into Rubber Bars.
    Rubber is good for insulating cables, but what we'll be using it for is making plastic. Smelt Rubber Bars down to refine them into Raw Plastic, and then you can combine four bars worth into  Plastic Sheets.
    The Factory Machine Block is the heart of almost every MFR machine. Usually, a machine can only be powered with RF Energy. Likewise, these Pipes seem to be special. When you apply a Redstone Signal to them, they can pull liquid out of a machine or tank, but when they are made of material from your world, they don't seem to melt when pumping, say... Lava. Or Molten Metal. That is amazing!
    The Sledgehammer can be used to rotate MFR and other machines. A strange thing, when you are holding it, you can see the range of MFR machines... must be a magical link between all the Plastic used...

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Order and Control
betterquesting.desc:
Mutating plants is an excellent start for a young Witch or Warlock, but we can always improve upon things. You can make a more controlled tool out of Mutandis Extremis and Ent Twigs if we add them with some Netherwart in a Witches Cauldron.
    The resulting §5§lMutating Sprig§r can be used to turn Grass into Mycelleum and vice versa, and Dirt under water into Clay. 
    There are more things we can control than the chaotic nature of mutation. A bit of hair, a nail clipping, a little blood, any of these creates a symbolic link to its owner, enablng us to manipulate the connection. This, of course, can be for both good and bad. To start, we shall need to sharpen a Bone with some Flint in your Crafting Grid, which will give you a handful of sharp§5§l Bone Needles§r. Combine one with a Glass Bottle to create a §5§lTaglock Kit§r.
    Now, you can obtain a Taglock from another creature, such as an animal, an assistant, or other ferret, by Right Clicking the Taglock on them. This does let them know you collected a bit of them, which may be unwanted attention. Instead, you can also Right Click it onto a bed they have used recently. There are other ways of obtaining a Taglock, which I can show you.
    The first is to create a §5§lLeech Chest§r. You will need to dig a 3x3 hole, 2 deep. Cover the bottom layer with Water. Place a Trapped Chest directly above the center of the water, then place a Vine to the North, South, East, and West of the chest. Now, Right Click your §5§lMutating Sprig§r on the Trapped Chest to mutate it into a §5§lLeech Chest§r.
    The §5§lLeech Chest§r is much like a Trapped Chest, emitting a Redstone Signal when opened.  Unlike a Trapped Chest, the §5§lLeech Chest§r will collect a drop of blood from the last three beings to open it. It will not store more than one blood drop from a specific being, though. You can collect any blood drop BUT YOUR OWN from the chest by Right Clicking a §5§lTaglock Kit§r onto the chest.
    The chest is a little too... obvious as a way to obtain Taglock material. A more subtle way is to create a §5§lBlood Poppy§r. Dig a 1 deep hole in the Dirt and fill it with water. Place the §5§lLeech Chest§r right above the Water, then place Poppy flowers on the four sides of the chest. Right Click your §5§lMutating Sprig§r on the §5§lLeech Chest§r to consume it and mutate the four flowers into §5§lBlood Poppies§r.
    §5§lBlood Poppies§r will store a bit of blood of the last creature to walk over them. Like the §5§lLeech Chest§r, just Right Click a Taglock Kit on the §5§lBlood Poppy§r to collect the Taglock.
    It is important to note that you cannot pick up a §5§lBlood Poppy§r without using a §5§lBoline§r. You can also use a §5§lBoline§r to harvest Cobwebs without breaking them, as well as other magical plants such as the §5§lGrassper§r.
    The §5§lGrassper§r will be quite important soon, so it is a good idea to learn how to make it now. Dig a 3x3 hole 1 deep, then a hole in the center and fill it with Water. Place a Chest above the water, and Tall Grass to the four sides of the Chest (You can get Tall Grass by using Shears on it). Right Click your §5§lMutating Sprig§r on the Chest to turn it into a §5§lGrassper§r. 
    You can Right Click most objects onto the §5§lGrassper§r to get it to hold them. Right Click a §5§lGrassper§r to get it to drop the item later on.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Advanced Mixtures
betterquesting.desc:
Now that we have the basics down and know how to make a few interesting mixtures and brews, I can teach you how to make a few advanced ones.
    §5§lLuck§r, who doesn't need some now and then? Some things just need a little §5§lLuck§r to exist. You can make a §5§lDrop of Luck§r by tossing the following into your Witches Cauldron : Mandrake Root, Nether Wart, Tear of the Goddess, Refined Evil, and Mutandis Extremis.
    This next thing is a bit more... interesting. Throwing a Nether Wart, Tear of the Goddess, Vine, Spider Eye, and Compass into your Witches Cauldron gets you a §5§lPlayer Compass§r. By combining it with a Taglock of another ferret or creature, you can use this to track where they are... as long as they are in the same dimension. Great for making sure your assistants haven't gone joyriding in another reality... again.
    As for brews, an important one you'll need for later is §5§lRedstone Soup§r. You can drink it to boost your health for a little bit, but it is primarily used in Infusions and similar things.
    You can also also combine it with a §5§lChalice§r to fill it. This §5§lFilled Chalice§r will add twice the Base Power Rate instead of a single time. Remember though, you can only have either an empty or a filled §5§lChalice§r on your Altar, not both.
    Another important mixture you'll need is §5§lHappenstance Oil§r. Fill your Kettle with Redstone Soup, a Golden Carrot, a Potion of Night Vision (the eight minute version, Bandit), Spider Eye, Eye of Ender, and Mandrake Root. §5§lHappenstance Oil§r is important in one of the Rites of Infusion.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Advanced Mutations
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you know the basics of mutations with the Mutating Spring, its time to try some more advanced mutations.
    §5§lWild Bramble§r is a tricky little defensive plant you can create. It damages any creature walking through it, and breaking it will cause it to spread instead, unless you break it with a Golden Axe.
    To create it, first, dig a 3x3 pit in some dirt, then dig the center down one more and replace it with Sand. Dig out the North, South, East, and West blocks from the Sand, and then fill these holes with Water. On the Sand, place up to 4 Cactus vertically. Above the four pools of water, place Spanish Moss, and between each Spanish Moss place a Grassper (so four Grasspers, one in each corner), and have two Grasspers hold Blaze Powder, and the other two hold Bonemeal. Then Right Click your Mutating Sprig on the bottom Cactus Block to transform all of it into§5§l Wild Bramble§r.
    §5§lEnder Bramble§r is another good plant you can utilize. Any creature that touches it is teleported anywhere within 500 blocks away.
    To create it, first, dig a 3x3 pit in some Dirt and place a Sugar Cane on the center block. Dig out blocks to the North, South, East, and West of the Sugar Cane and fill them with Water. Above the four pools of water, place Spanish Moss, and between each Spanish Moss place a Grassper (so four Grasspers, one in each corner), and have each one hold an Ender Pearl. You can stack the Sugar Cane up to 16 high, and when you use your Mutating Sprig on the bottom most Sugar Cane, it will transform all of them into §5§lEnder Bramble§r.
    Lastly, the §5§lCritter Snare§r is an important tool you'll need later on to trap small creatures for more advanced Witchcraft.  
    To make, dig a 3x3 pit, and dig the center down one more and fill it with Water. Above that, place a Cobweb, then Alder Saplings directly North, South, East, and West of the Cobweb. Now, the tricky part is you need to get a Zombie stuck in the Cobweb, then Right Click your Mutating Sprig on the Cobweb to transform the Alder Saplings into §5§lCritter Snares§r.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Armor of the Wyvern
betterquesting.desc:
§4§o[You can purchase this multiple times in the TFB Corporate Catalog]§r
    Now that we have Wyvern Tools, its only logical that the next step we take is to make armor with Draconium and the various Cores. Just like the tools, Wyvern Armor needs to be charged with RF Energy to function. 
    It is a fantastic thing to note, though : By wearing a FULL Set of Wyvern Armor, you become completely immune to fire!

betterquesting.name: Master Mutations
betterquesting.desc:
§5§lVoid Bramble§r is a masterly crafted protection tool. It can nullify all Circle Magic within a 32 block radius of it, and can only be broken by the Witch or Warlock who placed it (or someone with Godlike power...). As well, it works like normal Ender Bramble, teleporting tresspassers up to 500 blocks away.
    It requires the powerful essence of a creature. Normally, I would teach you how to summon one like we use, but your world has such a creature of its own : the Wither. You can summon it by placing 4 Soul Sand in a standing T, as if you were standing with your arms out. Then place upon it 3 Wither Skulls to complete the summoning. Be sure to summon it well away from your home, child. The Wither, as I've heard tale from your local Villagers, is quite an angry, destructive spirit of death. 
    You will need not one, but two of the Nether Stars, the Wither's powerful soul. Combine them with an Ender Bramble, some Drops of Luck, and Mutandis Extremis. Take care with it, Bandit, lest you bring the ire of those higher up the corporate ladder.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Dream World
betterquesting.desc:
As a Witch or Warlock, you will need to learn how to walk between the worlds. The first, and quite important step, you must make is into the Spirit World. This is the world somewhere between awake and sleep.
    Our first steps will be to make some §5§lPurified Milk§r. You can drink bottles of this to try to cure your ailments, and an additional benefit is it is easier to hold many bottles of this §5§lPurified Milk§r than it is to carry a single Bucket of Milk.
    Now you can make a §5§lBrew of Sleeping§r, which will help you pass your consciousness to the Spirit World. In your Kettle, mix a Purified Milk, Whiff of Magic, a Cookie, a Brew of Love, an Icy Needle, and a Water Artichoke Globe. Bottle it in some Glass Bottles and prepare yourself.
    When you drink this, you will sleep. While your physical body slumbers, your mind shall travel to the Spirit World. Very few things can pass into the Spirit World with you, though. I find it good to store all that I carry on me in a chest or other container, just in case.
    The one thing I suggest you carry with you is a few §5§lIcy Needles§r.  It is one of the few things that can pass into the Spirit World with you, and one of the only ways to wake yourself up without resorting to your own death while in the Spirit World.
    The Spirit World is a reflection of the real world. Like when you dream normally, you can either have a good dream... or a bad one. Nightmares almost always come when you prepare only with a Brew of Sleep. Be wary, for if the skies are night when you are in the Spirit World, you are in a nightmare. You will be chased by nightmare creatures endlessly, no matter how many you manage to defeat.
    One of the manifestations is simply called a Nightmare, a ghostly figure that chases you. When you strike it, it becomes invulnerable for a few seconds, making it difficult to kill.
    You must abate your fear and run with purpose, Bandit. Search all around for green plants with white fluffy orbs hanging from them. They may resemble other cotton plants, but there is a variety that only grows in the Spirit World called §5§lWispy Cotton§r. When the Spirit World is under a Nightmare, §5§lWispy Cotton§r turns into §5§lDisturbed Cotton§r when harvested. This is okay, as we'll need a good amount to make Spirit World travel safer.
    When you return back to the awake world, bring your §5§lDisturbed Cotton§r to your Spinning Wheel, add Reek of Misfortune and String, and you'll get §5§lTormented Twine§r. 
    Take 3 §5§lTormented Twine§r, 2 Feathers, a Diamond Vapour, a Splash Potion of Poison, a Splash Potion of Night Vision (both long duration ones), and an Item Frame, and you can fashion yourself a §5§lDream Weaver of Nightmares§r.
    This §5§lDream Weaver§r will make you weak if you wake up near it. It will also make all other §5§lDream Weavers§r nearby do the opposite effect. Why do we have it, then? Because with it, when we enter the Spirit World, it will only be a Nightmare half the time, instead of most of the time. This allows you to explore it in a bit more safety, as well as collect §5§lWispy Cotton§r properly. 
    Now with an easier method of collecting §5§lWispy Cotton§r, you can take some and spin it in a Spinning Wheel with some String and an Odour of Purity to get §5§lFanciful Thread§r, which will be important later.
    You can place 2 §5§lWispy Cotton§r down in the same area as the §5§lDream Weaver of Nightmares§r to further lower the possibility of a Nightmare.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Hay to Gold
betterquesting.desc:
Ah, now we get deeper into Headology. A §5§lSpinning Wheel§r isn't inherently magical or witchy... unless you delve into the realm of stories. When you do, simple cooking vessels and §5§lSpinning Wheels§r become magical tools. Especially when an Attuned Stone comes into play, letting us weave Altar power into powerful threads.
    There are two things you can make with simple materials, the first being §5§lGolden Thread§r. You know how the story goes, a girl weaves straw into gold for an imp with a complex name. You can do similar with a Hay Bale, a Whiff of Magic and some Altar Power, spinning them together into §5§lGolden Thread§r. As a bonus, you can weave by hand 9 §5§lGolden Thread§r together... well, more like crush it into a ball, and get a Gold Nugget out of it.
    You can also spin 8 String into a sticky §5§lCobweb§r§r, for all your Headology decorating needs (what Witch House is not complete with corners chock full of Spider Webs, yet no signs of Spiders?). 
    You can take this spun §5§lCobweb§r and add more String to make a §5§lDense Web§r, something you'll find useful at a later time...

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Deeper Dreams
betterquesting.desc:
The Spirit World is a powerful place, full of magic and mystery. To utilize it properly, you'll need to make yourself at home in the Spirit World, building yourself a second base of operations, more or less.
    And I mean that almost literally, Bandit. You'll need to rebuild a small base from the ground up. This will help you get a good foothold in the Spirit World, as some things can only be made in this world of dreams and nightmares.
    To start, know that you can bring Mutandis with you when you drink a Brew of Sleeping. This should help you as well. Make a very Witchy base, including a Kettle.
    The first thing you'll need to make is a §5§lBrew of Flowing Spirit§r. In the Spirit World, throw Fanciful Thread, Spanish Moss, Water Artichoke Globe, Glint Weed, Mandrake Root, and Wool of Bat into a Kettle. When thrown, the §5§lBrew of Flowing Spirit§r creates §5§lFlowing Spirit§r liquid. Most creatures standing in it slowly regenerate, though Undead and Demonic creatures will instead be weakened. The Nightmare that chases you in the dark Spirit World will lose its invulnerability ability if it stands in the liquid.
    The §5§lBrew of Flowing Spirit§r is one of the few things you can bring back from the Spirit World when you wake. You can place up to 3 source blocks of it near your Dream Weaver of Nightmares to further keep the Nightmares at bay. If you place pools of it in The Spirit World, you can plant Wispy Cotton next to it, and it will spread.
    Now that you have a home and a way to weaken the walking Nightmares, I suggest gearing up in the Spirit World for a fight. You'll want to make some §5§lFanciful Thread§r on a Spinning Wheel. You'll need to make some in both the Overworld and the Spirit World, since you cannot carry it between them.
    With this thread, you can make a §5§lCharm of Fanciful Thinking§r. Nightmares can get into your head, make you feel naked and vulnerable. And in the nightmare world, that thought becomes real, as your armor means almost nothing.  Just having this in your pocket will push away this bad dream, helping you to survive against the Nightmare.
    Defeating the Nightmare will earn you a fume of §5§lMellifluous Hunger§r. Another will pop up immediately, so do not dawdle unless you are ready for another fight.
    If, instead, you are after dangerous dreams, you can make an §5§lApple of Sleeping§r. You will first need to make a §5§lWormy Apple§r, then combine it with a Brew of Sleeping, some Mutandis, and some Reek of Misfortune. The resultant §5§lApple§r looks (and is named) normal, but consuming it will send you to the Spirit World during a Nightmare. 
    §o((To see the proper recipe for the §5§l§oApple of Sleeping§r§o, hover your mouse over the §5§l§oWormy Apple§r §oand hit U))§r

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Awakened Tools
betterquesting.desc:
§4§o[You can purchase this multiple times in the TFB Corporate Catalog]§r
    Awakened Draconium is a very powerful material, harnessing so much power from the Heart of a Dragon combined with a ton of RF Energy.
    This means we can definitely use it to power up the designs of the Wyvern Tools we made before.

betterquesting.name: Better Brews
betterquesting.desc:
So far I've only taught you some basic brews and concoctions, Bandit. There are plenty of other Brews you can make in Kettles and Cauldrons. A much more comprehensive guide to this is the §5§lWitches' Brews§r book, invaluable to the bubble and toil of witchcraft, including how to make custom brews in your Cauldron.
    The §5§lBrew of Webs§r explodes into a mass of Cobwebs where it hits, making a great trap or landing pad. 
    The §5§lBrew of Ink§r will burst into a cloud of ink and blind most creatures near it. The closer to the center, the longer the blindness. Do remember that you need eyes to be affected by this brew....
    The §5§lBrew of Thorns§r will summon a four block high Cactus wherever it lands! If you hit another creature with it, it will spawn a 1 block high Cactus wall around them. If you hit a Cactus, it will cause it to grow!
    The §5§lBrew of Sprouting§r will create a great tree breanch, sprouting straight out from where the brew lands. 
    An interesting trick you can do with these four brews is create §5§lTrap Plants§r with them. Whenever a creature walks over them, they will set off the Brew they were crafted with. Take either a Poppy, a Dandelion, or a Dead Bush; combine one with a few Stone Pressure Plates and the Brew of your choice. 
    Why not create a §5§lPoppy of Webs§r, a §5§lDandelion of Ink§r, and a §5§lShrub of Sprouting§r for me, child?

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Pretty Poppets
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you know how to obtain Taglocks, I shall teach you how to make §5§lPoppets§r. These dolls create symbolic links to our physical selves, their magic able redirect specific dangers into themselves instead of us. Usually when a §5§lPoppet§r prevents a death, it will be destroyed in place of the creature it was bound to.
    All §5§lPoppets§r start with an empty §5§lPoppet§r. You then add in certain components to create a specific §5§lPoppet§r. Finally, you combine it with a Taglock of the ferret or creature you wish for it to protect, usually your own Taglock. 
    The first set of §5§lPoppets§r protect you from certain deaths : §5§lEarth Protection Poppet§r protects you from a falling death; §5§lFire Protection Poppet§r protects you from a burning death; §5§lWater Protection Poppet§r protects you from a drowning death; The §5§lHunger Protection Poppet§r protects you from a death from starvation.
    The next two §5§lPoppets§r protect not yourself, but your belongings: The §5§lTool Protection Poppet§r stops a tool you are carrying from breaking, while the §5§lArmor Protection Poppet§r stops armor you are wearing from doing likewise. When these §5§lPoppets§r prevent the break, they repair the items in the process.
    With so many §5§lPoppets§r, no wise Witch has that many pockets to store them. Well, they do, but that pocket space would be better used for something to prevent the death in the first place! So, instead, we can utilize the §5§lPoppet Shelf§r! Any properly crafted §5§lPoppet§r can be placed on a §5§lPoppet Shelf§r, and they will work just the same as if you were holding them. They work just as well across dimensions this way, too.
    Unfortunately, it seems that the Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet has some... issue... detecting the subtle, yet important, differences between each Poppet... Please learn how to make all of them, Bandit, as they will be important.
    A bonus of the §5§lPoppet Shelf§r, we have learned, is that it will keep the small area around it 'active'. I bring this up, as your location has some... strange rules associated with it. We aren't sure if they are magical at their core, or just part of the reality there. But it is what it is, and Witches and Warlocks are good at working with what they have.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Circle Magic
betterquesting.desc:
Now we get into some of the more complex aspects of Witchery, child: Circle Magic. Some things can only be done with a proper ritual, with an area specifically sset up to draw in and focus the magic, to create more fantastical things than simple brews and concoctions.
    Out of all the books I suggest you obtain, §5§lWitchcraft: Circle Magic§r is perhaps the most important one. It explains what and how to create each Circle and prepare each Ritual.
    You'll need §5§lChalk§r to draw the Glyph Circles. §5§lRitual Chalk§r is the base and the most commonly used, representing your Overworld. §5§lGolden Chalk§r is used to mark the center of the ritual, called the Heart Glyph. §5§lInfernal §rand §5§lOtherworldly Chalk§r are likewise needed, representing your Nether and End worlds, respectively.
    Chalk Circles are drawn in 3 sizes : 7x7, 11x11, and 15x15. While the smallest circle is large enough to fit an Altar with the Heart Glyph marking right in front of it, which is okay early on, but eventually you will want to construct your Altar just outside the largest circle. This is important as you will need Altar Power to charge your Rituals. Some Rites take 5,000 or more Altar Power, so be sure to fill the area with as wide a variety of nature as possible!
    The first Ritual I will guide you on is the Rite of Charging, which is on Page 14 of your Circle Magic book. Mark the center of the circle with a Heart Glyph (§5§lGold Chalk§r, remember!), then make a 7x7 and 11x11 Glyph Circle out of §5§lRitual Chalk§r. Then put an Attuned Stone, Glowstone Dust, Redstone, Wood Ash, and Quicklime inside the circle. You can either just drop the components of the Ritual, or place them in Grasspers, making them less likely to be picked up on accident.
    When you are ready and have all the Ritual components in place and your Altar has 2,000 power stored, simply Right Click the Heart Glyph with an empty hand to start the Ritual. If all goes well, you'll have §5§lCharged§r the §5§lAttuned Stone§r, which is quite necessary for later on. It can be used in place of Altar Power in some Rites, for example.
    The §5§lCircle Talisman§r is a fantastic Ritual tool for a crafty Witch. With it and the Rite of Binding(Page 2 of Circle Magic), it lets you store and deploy Circles when needed. After storing a set of Circles, you can easily set them back out by Right Clicking the §5§lTalisman§r at the center of where you want them.
    To bind Circles to the §5§lCircle Talisman§r, first draw the circles you want around a Heart Glyph. This means you can Bind a 7x7, 11x11, AND a 15x15 to a single §5§lCircle Talisman§r. The type of Chalk used does not matter, either, as long as the Circles are valid. When you have them drawn, drop the §5§lCircle Talisman§r and a Redstone Dust into the Circle and Right Click the Heart Glyph to Bind the Circles to the §5§lTalisman§r.

betterquesting.name: To Summon and Bind
betterquesting.desc:
There are quite a few things you can do with Circle Magic, such as teleporting yourself to specific locations, or teleporting other ferrets or creatures to your Circle! A lot of this type of Ritual requires the use of a §5§lWaystone§r, which is simple to make with Flint and a Bone Needle.
    Now, the first of these Rituals I'd like you to learn is the Rite of Transposition, which you can find on Page 19 of the Circle Magic book. While the book has pages for a few versions of Transposition, this specific one is for summoning a creature you have Taglocked.
    If your Altar is built inside the smallest Glyph Circle, you will need to move it outside the Circle area. You need a clear 7x7 area, and 4 blocks above the Circles, completely clear of everything but Chalk Glyphs and Grasspers.
    To do this Ritual, draw the Heart Glyph center, and then an 11x11 Otherworldly Chalk circle. Drop a §5§lWaystone§r, §5§lEnder Dew§r, §5§lIron Axe§r, and a §5§lTaglock§r that is bound to the creature you wish to summon. Right Click the Heart Glyph to start the Rite and summon the creature. This is good for bringing something like a Villager or a wayward ferret back to you, but if you have something more... dangerous... Taglocked, you'll want to create a way to imprison the creature in the Circle to protect yourself. 
    The fantastic thing about Circle Magic is that you can cast multiple Rituals, as long as they have compatible Circles. If one Ritual uses a 7x7 and another uses a 11x11 Ritual Chalk circle, or two Rituals use a 15x15 Infernal Circle, then you can cast both if you supply all the components and Altar Power! This means we can cast the Rite of Protection as well as Transposition, summoning and trapping the creature in the circle!
    The version of the Rite of Protection we want can be found on Page 25 of Circle Magic. It requires §5§lObsidian§r and a §5§lRedstone Dust§r, as well as a steady flow of Altar Power to keep the creature contained.
    When you cast multiple Rites, they usually occur in a certain order. The Circle Magic book was written to give a rough idea of said order: Rites earlier in the book will USUALLY be cast first. With this knowledge, I feel you are ready to know how to summon your next real challenge. 
    Nightmares from the Spirit World are one thing... Demons are entirely different. Their followers inhabit your Nether, yet they do not. To encounter one, you'll have to drag it kicking and screaming into your world. I warn you now. What you want from it you can get one of to ways : the easy way or the hard way. The easy way is to make a deal with it. The hard way? Kill it. And if you aren't careful with the Easy way, you are left with the Hard way.
    To prepare, you want your Altar and Circle area to be in a safe area, well away from your home. Blast protection is highly suggested for the area. You will also want things to trade to the Demon : Usually they ask for Magma Cream, Blaze Rods, Emeralds, Diamonds, and Gold Ingots. 
    And last, but not least, arm yourself. Don your best armor, drink your best potions. For your weapon, I suggest enchanting your Arthana, and use it to deal the final blow. If you can't trade for what you need, you'll have to carve it from them by force.
    Draw the Heart Glyph center and the two circles : a 7x7 of Ritual Chalk and a 15x15 of Infernal Chalk. Gather your components for both the Rite of Protection and the Rite of Summoning : §5§lObsidian§r, §5§lRedstone Dust§r, §5§lRefined Evil§r, §5§lBlaze Rod§r, §5§lEnder Pearl§r, §5§lAttuned Stone§r, and §5§lAttuned Stone (Charged)§r. Place them into the prepared Circle, ready your weapons, and Right Click the Golden Chalk mark.
    While the Rituals are casting, back up outside the Infernal chalk circle and wait. When the Demon has spawned, you cannot interact with him through the Barrier, unless you move partially into it. Right Click the Demon as soon as you can to initiate the trade. He may strike you, but you should be pushed back outside the barrier. Keep your resolve, he is still willing to trade with you.
    Demons offer a variety of items to mortals, magical or not. Be wary, Demons can trick you, searching for a way to destroy you for summoning them. Keep your wits and your weapons ready.
    What you are after is called a §5§lDemon Heart§r. Trade for as many as you can, and any §5§lDemonic Blood§r they offer as well. If you cannot trade for §5§lDemonic Blood§r, you can Distill a §5§lDemon Heart§r with a Diamond Vapour into some.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Awakened Weapons
betterquesting.desc:
§4§o[You can purchase this multiple times in the TFB Corporate Catalog]§r
    The sheer power of Awakened Draconium can be harnessed in many ways, but one that should definitely benefit you would be to have it forged into powerful weapons.

betterquesting.name: Plastic Tools
betterquesting.desc:
Now, remember how I said I was tinkering with your magical materials? Well, I decided to make some handy tools to see what would happen, and the results are quite interesting, I have to say! 
    I know it seems like an odd tool, but a Straw is perfect for sampling various liquids, sometimes getting interesting effecs! Normally if the liquid was too hot, it'd melt the Straw... but not if its made of your world's Rubber. Just...just try not to drink Lava, okay? That isn't very healthy...
    Plastic Bags are perfect for carrying groceries home, or anything really. You can carry up to 5 things in a Plastic Bag.
    Plastic Cups act like Buckets and can pick up various liquids. The bonus is that if you can drink the liquid with a Straw, you can drink it directly out of the Plastic Cup!
    The Spyglass is good for viewing things at long distances. It will tell you the distance something is up to 200 blocks away.
    Normally, a Ruler would only be able to tell you the distance accurately if it was under a foot... or a yard sometimes. This Ruler? Right Click it on one block, then you can go do the same on another block down the hall and it'll tell you the exact distance!

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Farming the Field
betterquesting.desc:
Now, unlike the factories you may be thinking of, here in The Business, we like to automate as many steps as we possibly can in the products we make. This includes planting crops and harvesting them for various uses. 
    Some of these machines will be your first introduction into real MFR Machines. Your basic MFR Machine usually has a front and a back. When you place the machine down, the front will be facing away from you. You can later rotate a machine with your Precision Sledgehammer or any machine Wrench. Keep in mind that most MFR Machines require Power as well.
    Place the planter one block below a 3x3 area of the appropriate soil. It will plant seeds and saplings in its inventory, and where you place it in the inventory is where it will plant it. If you place an Oak Sapling in the top center of the inventory, it will plant it on the North Center block.
    The Fertilizer will scan a 3x3 area in front of it for crops and saplings, applying Industrial Fertilizer to them. Normally, this would just speed up the plants' growth a little bit, it seems that your world's magical materials will quite regularly grow the crops or trees with very little time or Fertilizer required.
    The Planter can only plant crops. To harvest them, you will need a Harvester. This machine will scan a 3x3 area in front of it and harvest trees and crops. Each plant it harvests will generate a little Sludge, which will fill its internal tank. If the tank is full, the machine will work much slower.
    Many machines like the Harvest generate Sludge as they work. You can Pipe this waste material out and into a Sludge Boiler, which will reduce it into one of a number of different materials.
    Place the Fisher directly above a 3x3x1 or larger pool of water and it will automatically fish for you. Strangely, if it detects another Fisher close by, it will jam up and refuse to work properly until the other Fisher is removed.
    The Fruit Picker will scan a 3x3x21 area in front of it for fruit to pick off of trees, like hanging Apples or Cocoa Beans. It will not replant them, though, you will still need a Planter for that.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Farming the Barnyard
betterquesting.desc:
Simple plants aren't the only living things we deal with here, and I don't mean our clients and shoppers. Farm animals provide many things we need, whether its meat, fur, wool, milk, or other such things. These machines though... they seem to work strangely with your materials. Sometimes better, sometimes just in unexpected ways. I mean, animals from your world seem to be able to give birth to a baby in no time and all, and that baby grows up within days!
    When supplied with the appropriate food (wheat for cows, carrots for pigs, etc), the Breeder will scan a 5x5 area in front of it and breed appropriate animal pairs when possible.
    The Rancher scans a 5x5 area in front of it for animals it can harvest from. For example, it can milk cows, and either send the milk out a connected Pipe, or fill a bucket if you supply it. It will shear Sheep, gather Eggs from Chickens, and even get soup from those unique fungal creatures you call Mooshrooms if you give it some Bowls!
    If you've got a large barnyard full of animals giving birth at different times, it can be difficult to split off the young to a safer location. Using the Chronotyper, you can select either Adult or Young animals, and it will scan a 5x5 area in front of it for the appropriate aged animal, and then move it behind the machine.
    The Grinder seems like a dark task for something to undertake, but the truth is most of us eat meat. The Grinder quickly kills creatures in a 5x5 area in front of it, picking up any useable materials from it and stores them in its inventory. It also seems to collect this... mysterous glowing green liquid. For now, we're going to call it Essence, as it seems to be the Essence of the creatures it kills...

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Advanced Animal Farming
betterquesting.desc:
We can do a whole lot more with a farm full of animals than just breed and kill them. Utilizing them to help create more materials for plant farming is one way, but we can also utilize nearly the entire animal, wasting nothing, which I feel should be one of the goals of a fully functioning factory.
    The Sewer collects waste from animals that walk on the 1x1 area above it. Larger animals produce more Sewage. It will jam up if there is another Sewer close to it, unfortunately, but the upside is it seems to slowly generate Essence as well.
    Supplied with Sewage from a Sewer (or if you find a dumping ground of it...), the Composter will convert it into Industrial Fertilizer.
    The Slaughterhouse scans a 5x4x5 cube in front of it for creatures. It will kill them and process almost the entire thing into Liquid Meat and Pink Slime. Liquid Meat can be Piped out of any side of the machine, but Pink Slime will require special pipes, such as Fluiducts with Pneumtic Servos from Thermal Dynamics to extract. 
    The Meat Packer converts Liquid Meat into Raw Meat Ingots, and Pink Slime into Raw Meat Nuggets. These can then be cooked and consumed.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Liquid Factor
betterquesting.desc:
A factory needs to be able to work with liquid matter as well as solid objects. I mean, how else are you going to get soup into cans, soda into bottles, or jelly into jars? Most of these machines had some limited uses before, but I've found with your magical  materials, they are a bit more useful!
    Each Plastic Tank stores up to 4 buckets of liquid. When you place multiple of them next to each other horizontally, they will connect. Tanks will not connect vertically, allowing you to stack different liquids on top of each other.
    You can pipe almost any liquid into the Fountain, and it will pump it onto the top of the machine. This includes Lava. 
    The Weather Collector is able to catch large amounts of Water or Snow in any climate but a desert. When it Rains, it will generate Water, but if its snowing, it will generate Snowballs.
    Normally, the LiquiCrafter would be able to store a single liquid and create objects that required it... but your special materials enabled me to improve it! You can now store up to 9 different liquids and automatically craft items that require those liquids. You can pipe liquids into any side, objects INTO the machine on any side, and OUT of the machine via the top or bottom.
    If you are piping around a lot of different liquids, the Liquid Router might well be a big help. You can filter what liquids go through this, which side the exit out on when piped in.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Improved Farming
betterquesting.desc:
Growing plants and animals the traditional way has worked for thousands of years, but this is the age of technology. Well, and magic, in your current world. So, to move with the times, we need to improve on older practices!
    Fertile Soil is tilled farmland that is rich in nutrients and does not need to be watered.
    The Veterinary Station applies Syringes to a 5x5 area in front of it. There are many Syringes you can use, and they all start with an Empty Syringe : 
      Health Syringes will heal creatures
      Slime Embiggening Syringes do what it says on the tin, more or less : using one on a Slime will cause it to grow larger.
      Growth Syringes will instantly grow Baby animals into Adult animals. 
      Zombie Syringes can be used instead to do the same thing, but it DOES kind of have a... slight... chance of turning them into a Zombie instead.
      De-Zombification Syringes can turn your accident-prone Villager friends back to normal after they've been turned into a Zombie.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Colorful and Useful
betterquesting.desc:
Plastic, Metal, and Glass aren't the only things we tend to use in a factory. We use Ceramic as well, as it tends to hold color pigment very well and doesn't rub off. 
    If we juts used straight dye, it could easily wear down and rub off, and then it'd get into the stuff we're producing. That wouldn't be very good Quality Control, would it? Mix Clay and Dye to make Ceramic Dye.
    Can use Ceramic Dye to make Stained Glass in various colors, and make stained glass panes.
    Roads are useful for designating a safe walking path in or around a factory. They also enable those who travel on them to move around as if they were on Ice, moving faster even when jumping.
   Road Lights are modified Roads, adding a light to them that can be turned on with a Redstone Signal. You can also invert this function to keep them always lit.

display:10.Name:8: Any Color Ceramic Dye
Any Color Stained Glass
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Magically Pink and Slimy
betterquesting.desc:
You know the Slaughterhouse, and the Pink Slime it creates as a byproduct of making Liquid Meat? Yeah, well... we started doing a little testing with it, and it seems that its a concentrated bit of magic from your world. Fancy that! We got a real shock in our testing factory when an assistant accidently poured a bucket of Pink Slime onto the floor, and out popped a bouncing cube... with a face. It, unfortunately, bounced right into the Grinder pen...
    Slaughterhouses produce Pink Slime, which you can pipe out and fill Buckets with. By pouring a Pink Slime Bucket into the world, a Pink Slime will spawn.
    Killing a Pink Slime will sometimes net you a Pink Slimeball. If you have a way of growing a Slime and making it Bigger, you could probably get a lot more Pink Slimeballs from a single Slime.
    Combine a bunch of Pink Slimeballs and it forms into a Pink Slime Cube. It's not alive, thankfully, but you can then Smelt it into a Pink Slime Crystal. This should be useful for SOMETHING!

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Set and Smash
betterquesting.desc:
Sometimes a factory needs to break down materials as part of the process of making something. These machines will allow you to automatically place and break materials.
    Every 20 seconds, the Block Placer will scan the spot right in front of it. If it's empty, it will place a block from its inventory.
    The Block Breaker scans the area right in front of it, breaking any material it finds. It can break Obsidian, but not something like Bedrock.
    The Block Smasher things like Ores into their Mined products, like Redstone Ore into Redstone. Can simulate Fortune enchantment, but this requires Essence to be pumped into the machine.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Lasers? Lasers!
betterquesting.desc:
Okay, we've been doing some experiments with that Pink Slime, specifically the Crystals you can make. We've taken an old factory machine for drilling holes and.... upgraded it. We might have combined this cool laser thing we had in storage with it as well. What we've ended up with is a super powerful Laser Drill!
    This baby takes a lot of power and materials, but when it is made out of your crazy magical materials, it allows us to mine areas that, before, were beyond our reach. I am talking of the areas under the indestructable Bedrock. Below that is what we call Void, which can destroy anything, but we've scanned beyond the Void and found riches... riches that the Drill can grab.
    To power the Drill itself, you'll need Laser Prechargers, up to 4 of them to be exact. They need to be placed North, South, East, and West of the main Drill, with 1 block of space in-between. Each of these requires power.
    The Laser Drill needs to have empty air between it and Bedrock or the dark Void of a world. It also needs at least one Laser Precharger set up. When it is functioning, it will fire a concentrated beam of energy straight down. Note that we tried to calculate the immense energy of this beam... but we ran out of numbers. I think it can kill even Gods if they aren't careful...
    Laser Foci increases the chance of certain Ores spawning. The color of the Focus 'usually' corresponds with the color of the Ore, but not always. You'd figure Yellorium would be Yellow... but it isn't. Weird.

display:10.Name:8: Any Color Laser Focus
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Decorative Elements
betterquesting.desc:
Plastic is a wonderful material. Its cheap to make, sturdy, and easily repairable and replacable. This gives us a lot of options, not only for machines, but for design and decoration. I mean, who wants to work in a drab, lifeless factory? Theres lots of ways to make things look more interesting!
    A Block of Plastic is quite simple and a little elegant. It's also a great way to store lots of Plastic.
    Bricks give a really rustic feel to things, I feel, and making Large Bricks, or Large Paved Stone Bricks, look fantastic!
    Why stop at Stone and Clay? If you got factory workers who really like the cold (maybe you hired some penguins, dood!), you can make some Large Snow Bricks!
    For a little Yin and Yang to your factories, you can make Large Obsidian Bricks and Large Glowstone Bricks.
    Lapis is a pretty common gem, and Large Lapis Bricks is a pretty block!
    Plain Stone too... Gray? You can turn Stone and Gravel into a much lighter shade! Large Whitestone Bricks, Smooth Whitestone, and Whitestone Gravel are just some examples.
    If bright constructions aren't your thing, you can also make Stone and Gravel like the night! Large Blackstone Bricks, Smooth Blackstone, and Blackstone Gravel are the counter examples.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Upgraded Machines
betterquesting.desc:
Further testing into the magical nature of your materials has resulted in the creation of what I call Upgrades. Many of these factory machines can take them, and each one will increase the range of the machine a certain amount! That means you can increase the range of your Farmers, or Breeders, etc! 
    Keep in mind, though, that some machines cannot work properly if it detects another machine like it in its range.
    The Upgrades are as follows : 
      Cobble decreases radius by 1
      Lapis - +1 Radius
      Tin - +2 Radius
      Iron - +3 Radius
      Copper - +4 Radius
      Bronze - +5 Radius
      Silver - +6 Radius
      Gold - +7 Radius
      Quartz - +8 Radius
      Diamond - +9 Radius
      Platinum - +10 Radius
      Emerald - +11 Radius

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Factory Built
betterquesting.desc:
There are a lot of things you can automate the creation of in a factory. Some of these things you need to do other things, such as fix up worn down tools, or create fuel for engines. 
    We've also been experimenting more with your magical materials, and we've definitely improved on some of these designs! We've even found some uses for that magical Essence we discovered with the Grinder!
    Normally you'd take a broken down tool to an Anvil, apply some metal to it, and you'd get a mostly repaired tool back, but a little degraded, since you're really just patching it up. Not with the Auto Anvil. Supply it with some Essence, and it will automatically repair tools to pristine condition if you supply it with the proper repair material as well.
    Usually the Auto Brewer would be used to ferment alcoholic beverages... but we've upgraded the design a bit. Now you can use it to automatically brew magical Potions! Every row in the Auto Brewer represents a single ingredient step, starting from the top and working its way down. Usually you start with a Water Bottle, then go down the list.
    I'm not sure what the original design of this machine was for, but one of our Assistants came up with something that might help you. Giving this Lava Fabricator power will allow it to slowly generate... you guessed it, Lava!
    Lots of plant matter can be broken down into biological components via the BioReactor, into what we call BioFuel. The more of a single item you break down at a time, the more efficient the process is.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Power Generation
betterquesting.desc:
Up until now, you've probably been powering your factory machines with any ol' generator. Whatever works is fine, but you might be interested there are a few MFR specific generators you can take advantage of!
    Pipe Water and supply some solid Fuel (like Coal) into the Steam Boiler and it will generate super hot Steam for you.
    The Steam you generated can be Piped into the Steam Turbine to generate power.
    The BioFuel Generator consumes BioFuel Piped into it, converting it into power.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Auto Magika
betterquesting.desc:
The magical nature of your world gives everyone here at The Business amazing, wonderful ideas. We all have so much to research and experiment with! I have a few enchanting things that should be of great use, and will definitely broaden the types of factories we can make!
    Records from your world are... fairly mysterious. They are old school vinyl style, but have lots of potential. This Auto Jukebox can automatically play any Record piped into it. A Redstone Pulse will turn it on or off. If you supply it with a Blank Record as well, it can make a copy.
    The Auto-Disenchanter will extract a random Enchantment from any enchanted item you insert into it, placing it into a Book. It requires a Book and a bit of power to do this. Careful, as this can damage the original item.
    If you need more items to Disenchant, you can use the Auto-Enchanter. Supply it with some Essence and things to Enchant, it will automatically Enchant them up to level 30.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Automated Rails
betterquesting.desc:
Some of our factories are large enough that just piping things everywhere isn't as efficient or, frankly, fun! They employ various different methods of transporting finished goods around, and one of them is Minecarts. They use specialized tracks that enable them to move inventory and even creatures in and out of Minecarts!
    Cargo Pickup Rails will move cargo from an inventory next to the track into the minecart if it has an inventory. Cargo Dropoff Rails will move items from the minecart inventory into an adjacent chest.
    Passenger Pickup Rails place nearby creatures into a minecart when it passes over the rail, while the Passenger Dropoff Rail removes them from the minecart.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Loaded Factory
betterquesting.desc:
Factories tend to deal with thousands, if not millions, of a single material if it is efficient and large enough. Storing things efficiently is always difficult, but we've found a solution for you. By utilizing the extra-dimensional properties of Endermen Eyes, we can do wonders with four dimensional space in a three dimensional world! 
    How? By folding time upon itself in various ways, we can create larger pockets of space... but with some limitations, I have to say. We're still working on it...
    The Deep Storage Unit can store only a single type of item at a time... but it can store up to 2 BILLION of that item! When you dismantle or break the machine, all its contents stay with it as well!
    Your world's land and machines don't seem to keedp functioning if no one is nearby, they sort of... freeze in time. This Chunk Loader solves that. It can 'load' an area at the cost of either Liquid Fuel or RF Power, and that cost can be reduced by pumping in Liquid Ender or Essence into the machine.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Cabled
betterquesting.desc:
Redstone Dust is a fairly old way of transmitting an electrical signal. It has limitations, as it can only be placed on the floor, and a signal can only go 15 blocks before it is too weak and needs to be refreshed. This is normally known as the Redstone Signal Strength. 
    With RedNet cable, the Signal Strength that goes into the cable is kept, and can go as many blocks as you need. This also gives us the basis for transfering not only Redstone Signals, but RF Energy as well!
    Along with transmitting Redstone Signal any distance, it also can transmit strength up to 120, if any machine outputs a signal that high. Each cable has 16 Color Channels it can be on, which can be cycled by holding a Precision Sledgehammer or any machine wrench and Right Clicking on the colored ring.
    Like the Factory Blocks, your magical materials seem to improve RedNet Energy Cables. They convert some alternate power types into RF. It can also transmit RF at 1000 per tick.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Programming Your Factory
betterquesting.desc:
Automated conveyor belts and machines can only get you so far when you want to make a fully automated, efficient factory. To that end, you're going to need to bring a bit of computer logic into the mix. 
    This is the Programmable RedNet Controller. It allows you to create complex Redstone Circuits that can rely on Variables and Constants to function. This is a lot of power, and somewhat more complex than I can describe just through the tablet...
    Such a complex machine requires more in-depth instruction than I can provide. You can easily make the instruction manual yourself.

pages:9.8: We hope you enjoy your new Programmable RedNet Controller!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: RedNet Tools
betterquesting.desc:
RedNet Cables and the Programmable Rednet Controller vastly improve the types of circuits you can make... and also vastly increases the steps you can mess up! To that, I have a bunch of tools you may be interested in when dealing with RedNet Cables, as well as a bonus machine that can only be fully utilized by a Programmable RedNet Controller!
    The RedNet Meter displays information when used on RedNet Cables, like Signal Strength. The RedNet Multimeter, though, is used on RedNet Energy Cables, and can also display things like power.
    The RedNet Historian can be connected to RedNet Cables to display the strength of a Redstone Signal that passes through it as a function of time.
    Noteblocks made of your magic materials are very odd. They only make sounds depending on the material they are on... but we can control this function with a RedNote Block! What note it plays can be controlled by what Strength a Redstone Signal is that hits it. It is also the only machine I know of that can detect Signal Strength above 15, which can only be obtained via a Programmable RedNet Controller and RedNet Cables.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Controller Upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
A new RedNet Controller has limited circuits and variables it can hold. You can increase these by installing Logic Expansion Cards! There are three levels of Expansions, and each one can be stacked 3 times in a Controller.
    The PRC LX-100 Logic Expansion Card has 1 Circuit and 8 Variables.
    The PRC LX-300 Logic Expansion Card has 3 Circuits and 16 Variables.
    The PRC LX-500 Logic Expansion Card has 5 Circuits and 24 Variables.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Rockets!
betterquesting.desc:
Here's a little special thing for you we came up with. We know how dangerous your world is, so we wanted to help you defend yourself. The scanner says some of the things you face are quite big and dangerous, and we have an answer to them : The SPAMR Rocket Launcher! This is a very destructive weapon, so be careful! 
    Self-Propelled Anti-Material Rockets fire only in a straight line.
    If you aim it at a target for a short time, it'll lock on, and Tracking Self-Propelled Anti-Material Rockets will track the locked-on target when you fire them.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Little Fun
betterquesting.desc: Hey, did you ever make a Potato Cannon when you were a kid? You know, some PVC pipe, an end cap, an igniter, a bit of hairspray, and a properly sized spud? What, really?! Well, you can make one now as well! The bonus is you don't really need hairspray, with your magical materials. Or a lighter. And the potatos might hurt a little more than before...

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Question of Power
betterquesting.desc: §4§o[Text will be added in a future update!]§r

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Place for Things
betterquesting.desc:
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    A place to mix ingredients and place to cook ingredients. What about §lwashing§r ingredients? Or adding §lWater§r?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Ah, install a §5§lSink§r to the kitchen line and it'll §lautomatically§r provide §lWater§r to any recipe that calls for it. You can also §lRight Click§r an §lEmpty Bucket§r onto the §5§lSink§r to fill it with §lWater§r!
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    What about a place to §lstore§r ingredients and tools? With how many ingredients a recipe takes, one's pockets can get quite full, no?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    Well for that, use a §5§lFridge§r for food, and a §5§lTool Rack§r for §ltools§r! Just open the §5§lFridge§r with an §lempty hand§r, or §lRight Click§r a §ltool§r onto the §5§lTool Rack§r.
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Would not a §5§lFridge§r cool heated ingredients?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    It's actually a §lsmart§r §5§lFridge§r. It keeps foods hot or cold for you, no need to worry about §lsorting§r.
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    W... wait. It isn't connected to the §lInternet§r, is it?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    No.
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    Oh. I was slightly hoping it would be. The §lCooking with Blockheads I and II§r books are helpful, but only if you have the ingredients on hand. What if I §ldo not know§r the recipe?
[§3§lFood Critic Candy§r]
    We have a book just for that. It's called the §5§l#NoFilter§r edition, it shows §lall food recipes§r the §4§lCooking for Blockheads§r kitchen line can cook!
[§3§lHead Chef Charlie§r]
    A §lhashtag§r... I am now sorry I asked...

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: ADMIN GUIDE
betterquesting.desc:
[Message From Caigan]
    Previously, this section contained quests to regain reputation after a book reset. This is no longer necessary.
    For administrative commands, pleasure refer to the FTB Utilities Guide, accessable from your inventory : 
    Open your inventory, and to the left of your portrait should be a book icon. This will open a Guide that explains much about this modpack, including a section for Administrative commands.

betterquesting.name: Infusion Array
betterquesting.desc:
Rituals give us access to quite a variety of magical spells, allowing us to summon creatures, banish monsters, and infuse magic into things. The Rite of Infusion is used to create many powerful objects. 
    The first is another of a Witch's tools : the §5§lCrystal Ball§r. You'll need to make a Quartz Sphere first, then put it, a Gold Ingot, and Happenstance Oil in a 11x11 Ritual Chalk Circle. You will also have to perform this Ritual at night. The §5§lCrystal Ball§r is used to look into the present and the future, and requires a bit of power from your Altar, as well as being Infused yourself. By Right Clicking it with an empty hand, you will gaze into the future. The prediction has a good chance of coming true, though, so be careful! It also may attract the attention of creatures you do not want.
    By holding another ferret or creature's Taglock, you can look through their eyes if they are nearby. By holding your own or a Bound Waystone (See Page 5 of Circle Magic), you can get a birds eye view of the area.
    At this point, you may not understand what the §5§lCrystal Ball§r is showing you. I will teach you later how to Infuse magic into yourself, but that is quite dangerous and I feel you are not quite ready yet, Bandit.
    An infusion you may appreciate involves another ancient symbol for Witches, aside from the pointy hat. I'm talking about the flying§5§l Broom§r! A handy, and very Headology, way to travel around by air. You'll need to make some §5§lFlying Ointment§r in your Kettle, as well as a plain §5§lBroom§r.
    The §5§lBroom§r itself can be used to remove Chalk glyphs instantly. To prepare it for flight, you'll need a 7x7 and 11x11 Ritual Chalk Circle. When it is night, place the §5§lBroom§r and §5§lFlying Ointment§r into the prepared Circles and Right Click the Heart Glyph. 
    Right Click the §5§lEnchanted Broom§r onto the ground to set it out. You mount and dismount the §5§lBroom§r much like a Minecart : Right Click it to get on, Sneak to dismount. Look in the direction you wish to fly and hold W to move forward. Be careful getting off, the §5§lBroom§r will continue flying if it still has momentum, and may be hard to retrieve if you dismount too high above the ground. To retrieve the §5§lEnchanted Broom§r, just punch it a few times.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Familiar Faces
betterquesting.desc:
Witches and Warlocks tend to be only somewhat solitary creatures. I say somewhat, because we, of course, have Familiars to aid us, as well as Covens to call upon. They say a group of Witches is actually called an argument, but when things get dicey, Witches will step up for each other and help out.
    First, though, you must convince other Witches to form a Coven with you. The best way is to prove your skills by forming a bond with a Familiar.
    A Familiar is a helpful spirit that inhabits a creature's body, and they are somewhat picky. There are only three creatures the spirit will accept : Cats, Owls, and Toads. You'll need to choose one, but you can also choose a different one later.
    Cats are easy to find in your world. Just tame an Ocelot, which can be found in the jungle. Owls and Toads are a bit more difficult...
    I know you have Owls flying around your world, but they are distant, non-magical relatives to what we are looking for. Proper Owls must be Mutated from another animal. 
    Dig a 3x3 pit (preferably in an enclosed space!), then another hole in the center and fill it with Water. Above this, place a Cobweb,  and then place two to four Critter Snare'd Bats to the North, South, East, and West of the Cobweb. In the corners, place Grassper plants, and put a Charged Attuned Stone and 3 Mutandis Extremis into the Grasspers.
    Now the more difficult part : You need to trap a Wolf, wild or tamed, in the Cobweb. When that is done, Right Click your Mutating Sprig on the Cobweb. This will mutate all the snared Bats into Owls.
    You can tame an Owl by feeding it Raw Porkchops or Raw Beef, which can also be used to heal or breed tamed Owls. You can also kill them to obtain an §5§lOwlet's Wing§r (be sure to use your Arthana!), which is necessary for other Rituals and Brews I will teach you.
    Your tamed Owl can be used to deliver things to either another ferret or a location. You will need either a §5§lBound Waystone§r or a §5§lBloodied Waystone§r, which you can make by drawing a 3x3 circle with Otherworldly Chalk, and dropping a Waystone in the center. If another creature or ferret(other than yourself) is close enough to both the circle and an Altar, it will create a §5§lBloodied Waystone§r bound to them. If not, it will create a §5§lBound Waystone§r bound to that location. There are also Ritual versions of both of these methods.
    To get your Owl to transport an item, Right Click it on the Owl to get it to hold it, then Right Click the appropriate Waystone to it. If you give it a splash potion or throwing Brew, it will throw it at the target instead of just dropping it. The target has to be in an area that is actively 'loaded' in your world. With its magic, the Owl will teleport itself over longer distances to save time.
    The last creature you can have as a familiar is a Toad. You will need to set up a similar mutation area to the Owl, except using Critter Snares with Small Slimes and a wild or tamed Ocelot in the Cobweb.
    To tame a Toad, you need to feed it Rotten Flesh, which is also used to Heal or Breed tamed Toads. If killed, Toads drop §5§lToe of Frog§r, another ingredient we'll need later.
    When you have chosen your Familiar, you will need to perform the Rite of Binding(page 6 of Circle Magic). Prepare with a Heart Glyph and an 11x11 Ritual Chalk Circle. Have the animal you wish to become your familiar sit inside the Circle, and drop a Tear of the Goddess, Odour of Purity, Whiff of Magic, Diamond, and Demonic Blood. Your Altar will also need 8,000 Power to perform this Rite! When you are ready, Right Click the Heart Glyph with an empty hand.
    Familiars, being inhabited by a supernatural spirit, are much stronger than their mundane origin. The link between you two is sympathetic, and a portion of the damage you take will be transferred to the Familiar. Note, if your Familiar dies, so will you, and vice versa.
    If your Familiar dies, or dismiss it, or just somehow lose it, you will need to perform the Rite of Summoning on page 57 of the Circle Magic book. You'll need a Whiff of Magic, Hint of Rebirth, and Breath of the Goddess in an 11x11 Ritual Chalk Circle.
    Now that you have a Familiar, explore your world. Witchcraft is not confined to ferrets at all, I detect that there are a few Villagers who have taken up the art in your world. Not all of them are nice, though. Good Witches tend to live in modest little houses and have warts on their nose, while evil ones wander the lands, especially swamps, attacking any ferret they see.
    When you've found a good witch, Right Click them to talk to them. Many will ask a task of you before joining your Coven. You can have up to six other Witches in your Coven, and some Rituals require six Coven Witches to aid you in casting.
    To call upon the Coven, you will need a §5§lSeer Stone§r. Around Heart Glyph, draw a 7x7 Ritual Chalk Circle. Place down a Quartz Sphere, Obsidian, and Happenstance Oil. Activate the Heart Glyph at night, and it'll create a §5§lSeer Stone§r. By holding the §5§lSeer Stone§r and Sneak + Right Clicking, you can see a few things about yourself, including how many are in your Coven. Right Clicking on another ferret will show knowledge about them likewise. 
    Holding Right Click in the air will start to summon your Coven to you. They will gather around appropriately Witchy things to aid you, such as the Witches Cauldron.
    If you activate a Ritual's Heart Glyph with the §5§lSeer Stone§r instead of an empty hand, you will summon your Coven to cast the Ritual with you. Some Rituals become more powerful if your Coven aids you, while other Rituals can only be cast with a big enough Coven.

betterquesting.name: Initial Signal
betterquesting.desc:
§4§o[You can purchase this multiple times in the TFB Corporate Catalog]§r
    So we've been testing some things with Draconium, looking to further our research. We've found lots of great things already, but also come across some small, relatively cheap devices that could help you.
    These are some fairly cheap items to make, especially when you consider how much the rest of this research is.
    First up, a Potentiometer, which can emit a variable strength Redstone Signal between 0 and 15.
    Then we have the Rain Sensor, which will emit a Redstone Signal when its, well... raining of course.
    Last we have the Player Detector, which will emit a Redstone Signal when you or another assistant gets within about 10 blocks.

betterquesting.name: Storage Drawers
betterquesting.desc:
We like to employ various storage methods here in The Ferret Business, not just Industrial level ones. Workshops tend to use a lot of variety in their components, and prefer if each one is kept in its own storage container. This makes it easy to both catalog how much of an item you have left, but identify which container it is in with a simple picture label.
    To that end, we've devised a set of furniture that we simply label �4�lStorage Drawers�r, which come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and styles. To use, simply hold the item you want to store, and Right Click onto the front of the Drawer. It will add the items and put an icon on the front for easy identification. If you Double Right Click, you will add all of that item in your inventory.
    To remove items, Left Click the front of the Drawer to remove a single item. Sneak + Left Click will remove an entire stack.
    Drawers come in a variety of sizes. The basic Drawer is 1x1, and can hold 32 Stacks of a single item.
    You can make a drawer the same size, but partition it into either 1x2 (which holds 16 stacks per drawer), or 2x2 (which holds 8 stacks per drawer).

display:10.Name:8: Any 1x1 Drawer
Any 1x2 Drawer
Any 2x2 Drawer

Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Basic Storage Upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
Storage Drawers are able to be upgraded in various ways. The simplest set of upgrades deal with how many and how items stored are dealt with.
    All Upgrades start with the Upgrade Template. All actual Upgrades are simply to install : Simply Right Click it onto a Storage Drawer.
    Storage Upgrades come in multiple tiers, and each one multiplies the Max Stack amount. You don't need to start at the lowest tier of Storage Upgrade when applying them.
    The Void Upgrade will allow you to continue putting items into a Storage Drawer beyond its capacity, but any extra items will be destroyed.

display:10.Name:8: Any Drawer Storage Upgrade
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Lock and Key
betterquesting.desc:
Controlling and organizing Storage Drawers in a lab environment is important. Securing personal storage, moving storage around, and more are important.
    Moving workshops is a common occurance in The Ferret Business. Whether you are moving departments, getting a bigger workshop, or just reorganizing things, it's easy to move Storage Drawers around. Packing Tape can be Right Clicked onto any Storage Drawer to 'seal' it. You can then break the Drawer without the contents spilling everywhere. You can then place the Drawers back down and they will automatically unseal.
    Locking drawers is important in a busy environment. A Drawer Key will 'lock' in the item in a drawer, so that even if you pull out every item, it will only accept that one again. The Concealment Key will show and hide the visual labels on drawers. Good if you want a more uniform looking workspace.
    Personal Keys will lock drawers from being able to be used by anyone but yourself. There are two types of Personal Key.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Redstone Upgrades
betterquesting.desc:
Another level of upgrades that Storage Drawers can take deal with Redstone in various ways. 
    Status Upgrades will display an indicator on the front of the Drawer. Level I indicator will light up when the Drawer is full, while a Level II indicator will have an indicator bar that fills up as the Drawer fills up.
    Redstone Upgrades will make the Storage Drawers emit a Redstone Signal depending on the type. The basic Redstone Upgrade will emit a Redstone Signal depending on how full the Drawer is. The fuller it is, the higher the Redstone Signal Strength.
    Redstone Min Upgrade and Redstone Max Upgrade will emit a Redstone Signal when the Storage Drawer slot is either least full or most full.

betterquesting.name: Drawer Framing
betterquesting.desc:
Storage Drawers can be visually customized in a variety of ways. This helps with organization and sorting methods at a glance, but also to help fit into a given setting better. 
    The first is the ability to make Trim, which are decorative blocks that look like Storage Drawers. You can, also, Sneak + Right Click it onto the Side or Back of any Storage Drawer to change it's wood type to the Trim's.
    For proper customization, you can make a Framing Table. This allows you to put any Framed Storage Drawer into it, along with most any solid block into its various slots to customize the Framed Storage Drawer. There are slots for Face, Edges, and Sides.

Any Framed Drawer

betterquesting.name: Technological Drawers
betterquesting.desc:
Large banks of Storage Drawers are excellent when you have items sorted and ready to pull out when you need them, but restocking them can eat up valuable Research and Crafting time. 
    Thus we've come up with the Storage Controller. It will connect to all Storage Drawers within 12 blocks that are connected. Drawers are considered 'connected' if they are touching other drawers that are touching the Storage Controller.
    You can pipe items into the Storage Controller and it will automatically place them into Drawers, either in existing storage spots, or filling empty ones. You can also hold an item and Right Click it on the front of the Storage Controller to deposit it into the network. Sneak + Right Click will attempt to put all items in your inventory into the network, but ONLY if a drawer already contains that item. (This is so you don't dump your entire inventory into a large network.
    The Controller Slave connects like other Storage Drawers in a Network, and enable you to have more sides to pipe items into it.
    The Compacting Drawer is a special drawer. Technically, it only holds item, but in up to three states. For example, if you put a stack of Iron Ingots into one, it will allow you to take out or put in Iron Nuggets or Blocks of Iron as well.
