betterquesting.name: Reputation and Favors
betterquesting.desc:
I believe by now you've received some Job Chips, or even some Shop Tokens or Trader Chits, correct? In a normal corporation, we'd track an employee's accomplishments digitally in a Permanent Record. Here in The Ferret Business, though, we like having a... physical component to things. Thus, the three tokens.
    For assistanting in various Research, you earn Job Chips. For buying goods from the TFB Corporate Catalog, you earn Shop Tokens. And for crating and shipping items, you earn Trader Chits. You can combine two of the same value token to get the next value up, or you can craft a token on its own to break it down.
    Having a physical item to represent your accomplishments enables you to trade and barter them with other employees. Unfortunately, your situation makes it difficult to barter with other employees effectively, so I've come up with something else : 
    Collect and combine these tokens, and you can turn them in to bolster your Reputation, which will advance you along the three Career tracks. 
    Alternatively, you can use the tokens as Favors instead, forgoing the Reputation boost and instead getting Silver Coins and Blind Bags in return.

betterquesting.name: Large Order - Giant RF Amount (3 of 3)
betterquesting.desc:
The Ferret Business is always in need of RF Energy, both to power our own network of shops, labs, factories, and more, but also to supply it to others.
    This Large Order is for 1,000,000,000 RF.
    You will earn 1,000 Silver Coins and 200 Trader Chits.

betterquesting.name: A Witch's Toolbox
betterquesting.desc:
A Witch or Warlock has plenty of tools at their disposal, from minorly magical plants to mundane yet magical seeming constructions.
    The first isn't really magical in any way, but a minor demonstration of Headology. Why not form §5§lSnow§r into §5§lStairs§r, §5§lSlabs§r,§5§l Pressure Plates§r, etc? Snow tends to blend in easily, and a nice hidden snow fort could be easily overlooked if you are crafty.
    §5§lLeaping Lillies§r can be placed on most surfaces. Any creature that walks on it gets a very short, but quite intense, boost to their ability to jump, as well as their movement speed.
   §5§l Stockades§r are useful for protecting Villages or your own base, as they are fairly hard to break. Any creature that falls on the spiked top takes damage, making them excellent for pit traps as well.
    Binding many Saplings together can create a §5§lWicker Bundle§r.  You sometimes see tall human shaped strawman effigys when traveling around, constructed by unknown creatures. I would mark down on a map where you find them, they will be important to you later. 
    Many nature-based magical (and nonmagical!) arts require growing plants in darkness. By combining Stained Glass with Redstone Dust, you can make §5§lShaded Glass§r. When you apply a Redstone Signal to the glass, it will stop allowing light to pass through it. This can make excellent darkened greenhouses (or other rooms if you have, lets say, 'sensitive skin'...).

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Stronger Toolbox
betterquesting.desc:
With all the new ingredients and abilities you have gained thus far child, you are ready to make even better tools for yourself. I warn you, Bandit, that these are more dangerous tools, that can have dangerous consequences.
    Mixing Tormented Twine with a few other ingredients into either §5§lDirt§r or §5§lGrass§r turns them into special versions. At first glance, they are exactly like the normal block, until you or any creature steps on them. They are "§5§lpit§r" versions, allowing creatures to pass through from any side. Great for making pitfall traps OR just hiding your home from prying eyes.
    To more dangerous things... you can annoint Wicker Bundles with Demon's Blood to make §5§lBloodied Wicker Bundles§r. You can build a Wicker Man effigy, in the same shape as the Strawman ones. Be warned though : setting fire to one can call upon hunters involved in the mystical Wild Hunt. They are dangerous and powerful, so do not do so lightly, unless you are well prepared for battle.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Of Dark and Light
betterquesting.desc:
It is said that Witches are those who stand on both sides of life and death. This life, the next life, the previous life; a Witch steps between them as if walking through rooms of a house.
    What few understand is that we must build the house with our own hands, and keep it from falling apart the moment we look away. We turn the scythe of Death away with our words... and a cuppa tea, sometimes. Occasionally a biscuit.
    Many things we do along this darker path can be seen as evil. And they most certainly can be used for such. Remember the difference between the tool and the intent, child. The demon we bind to our own whims is no longer free to hurt others.
    The first thing we will need is some §5§lSpectral Dust§r. You may have already collected some if you killed undead with your Arthana, but that is a slim chance. The easier way to obtain this is by summoning a Spectral Familiar. Page 56 of your Circle Magic book has the circle and Ritual ingredients. 
    This Spectral Familiar can be given a metal ingot or a gemstone and it may sniff out the area to find more of the Ore. If it finds it, it will sit down and make a noise above where it is. You can try having the Spirit search multiple times, but each time increases the risk of the Spirit disappearing. To get the §5§lSpectral Dust§r, the Spirit Familiar must die. It is a tough spirit, but not very strong.
    You can now use this §5§lSpectral Dust§r in the Rite of Necromancy (page 69 of Circle Magic), to turn an Attuned Stone into a §5§lNecromantic Stone§r. This §5§lStone§r will give you some power over the Undead.
    Another ingredient you will need to employ is §5§lGraveyard Dust§r : a mix of Mutandis, Spectral Powder, and Bonemeal.
    Employing your Distillery and distilling a Brew of Flowing Spirits and a Oil of Vitriol, you will get §5§lFocused Will§r, §5§lCondensed Fears§r, and §5§lBrew of Hollow Tears§r (which, when thrown, spills §5§lHollow Tears§r, making monsters stronger and you weaker if you stand in it).
    Now that you have the knowledge on how to make a §5§lNecromantic Stone§r, you can make some §5§lNecromancer Robes§r, a counterpoint to the Witch's Robes. Wearing them will make undead more likely to ignore you, and give you a better chance of extra Necromantic Brews, unlike normal Witch's Robes.

Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: To the Meteors!
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.........§r power §k.......§rtus Quartz§k...........§r antastic Meteorite Compass §k.....................§r locate §k.........§r Sky Stone Meteors§k................§r plates §k.....................§r collect all four Inscription Plates§k............§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Bandit, we've deciphered a bit more of the transmission. There are these Meteorites scattered around the world, which apparently contain Inscription Plates we'll need to continue our research.
    Linguist Lenny : Given some of the trasnmission context, we were able to use a Charged Certus Quartz to fashion ourselves what is called a Meteorite Compass. Fascinating!
    Dataologist Dante : Proprieter Penny gave us some Certus Quartz samples she found, as well as some of this black stone that gave off a similar signature. The Meteorite Compass always pointed towards the nearest chunk of it unless it was in a box or bag!
    Linguist Lenny : She also gave us a couple of the Inscription Plates the transmission talks about. They were found inside the black stone, and she says she had a bunch more, as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Too bad she refused to just send you a set. Sorry, Bandit, she runs the shop with an iron power glove. She'll happily sell you the plates though, if you don't want to go Meteor Hunting!
    Linguist Lenny : She also grinned when she said she had a lot of that stone. Sky Stone, we're calling it, since it looks to be part of those meteors.
    Dataologist Dante : Well, either way, collect all four plates, some Sky Stone, and a Sky Stone Chest when you can.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Crystals!
betterquesting.desc:
--------
   §k......§r al Certus Quartz §k..................§r artz §k........§r find §k.....§r over §k.....§r world! §k......§r amaz§k............§r confi§k...........§r  product§k.............§r r Certus Quartz! §k................§r lines §k..................§r your order!
    §k..........§r act §k.............§r get §k...........§r Charged Certus Quartz §k..........§r energizes §k.........§r devices we're §k.............§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Interesting, it seems the transmission is bouncing off of these Certus Quartz deposits in your world. That might be why they are being distorted?
    Linguist Larry : Possibly, but the original source may be corrupted as well. I'm finding more references to this Certus Quartz in the transmissions as well.
    Dataologist Dante : I'd say it's time to gather some of this Certus Quartz for more research. Bandit, the QUEST Tablet scanner shows Certus Quartz is scattered underground, slightly uncommon. The Charged Certus Quartz is a bit rarer, but should be around the same depths.
    Linguist Larry : These Certus Quartz Crystals... I'd check with Penny in the TFB Corporate Catalog. She might be selling any extra the Business has collected from other dimensional mining operations.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Fluix Crystals
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k...§r know §k.....§r Charged Certus Quartz §k.....§r put §k.....§r Redstone §k.........§r Nether Quartz into §k....§r Water §k.....§r creating Fluix Crystals§k....§r what §k....§r with them? §k...§r glad §k....§r ask§k...§r
    §k......§r hard §k.....§r Sky Stone §k.......§r patented §k......§r fantastic §k.....§r Stick§k......§ry §k.......§r Pistons §k...§r Fluix Crystal§k...§r make §k....§r Inscriber§k...§r press §k....§r hardest of materials with §k....§r Plates!
--------

    Linguist Lenny : I think I'm starting to get a better handle on this strange language, even with the distortion and corruption. 
    Dataologist Dante : And I'm starting to work out this technology it's talking about. Watch, if we drop a Charged Certus Quartz, a Redstone Dust, and a Nether Quartz a pool of water....
    Linguist Lenny : Hey, that's kind of pretty. What'd the transmission call it... a Fluix Crystal? Looks like it'll be useful.
    Dataologist Dante : I agree. The other part of the transmission mentioned a few things...and I figured out a device that should be close to what it was describing. The Inscriber should be a useful device when we figure out how to power it.
    Linguist Lenny : Wait, it doesn't take RF Energy?
    Dataologist Dante : It does, but it seems to be one of the few test machines I've made that does so far. Let's keep listening to the transmissions, maybe we can figure something out for the other machines...

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Form Before Function
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k...§r you know?§k......§r these Crystals §k......§r useful §k........§r offer§k...§r fantastic decorative §k........§r
    §k.......§r strong §k..§r support §k....§r Stairs §k..§rSlabs §k...§r fantastic as Pillars§k......§r Bricks §k..........§r
--------

    Linguist Larry : Not much new stuff in this transmission, at least when it comes to figuring out these devices and other things.
    Dataologist Dante : Hmm, looks to be talking about turning these materials into building materials. StairS? I guess if they are pretty, some architect can make use of them.
    Linguist Larry : Bandit, I wouldn't ask you to waste too many materials on these, but theres a bunch more things you can make than just these three things.

betterquesting.name: Charged Up
betterquesting.desc:
--------
   §k.....§r power tools §k......§r charged§k............§r special Charger! §k........§r charge §k......§r Quartz §k..............§r
--------

    Linguist Larry : What a short transmission.
    Dataologist Dante : True, but it sounds like we can charge Certus Quartz ourselves. But the prototype charger I have here doesn't work.
    Linguist Larry : Try using Fluix Crystals as components. I get the feeling that's the only way it would work.
    Dataologist Dante : Hm, possibly. Still not working... no wait, there we go. I had to set the Charger on top of the energy source. Some sort of proprietary system? Weird for just a bunch of Crystals...
    Linguist Larry : But not really out of place. But hey, it looks like it'll charge RF Energy tools as well as Certus Quartz. That should definitely help you out, Bandit.

betterquesting.name: Growing Supply
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k......§r know §k......§rur Certus Quartz §k........§r so incred§k.....§r can §k....§r grow §k.......§r special §k......§r sand§k.....§r Certus Dust§k.....§r Water§k....§r crystaliza§k.....§r takes §k......§r hours §k.....§ratented for§k......§r not decay §k......§r inexhaustable §k....§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Interesting, this communication seems to suggest that we can grow more Certus Quartz.
    Linguist Larry : Not surprised, you never grew rock candy as a little kit?
    Dataologist Dante : You can do that? Dang, glad I didn't know that, I would probably have fake teeth by now if I did.
    Linguist Larry : Yeah, should be pretty simple. So, it says to combine Certus Dust and Sand... the Quartz Grindstone should get us the Dust easily. Now mix and... yeah, that worked pretty well. One Certus Quartz Seed.
    Dataologist Dante : Then you just put it in some water, yeah? Here, I had maintenance install a small pond in the corner, since it seems we're working with some unique technology.
    Linguist Larry : Not the weirdest thing I've seen in the labs here. Okay, the seed is in the water. Got the scanner going?
    Dataologist Dante : Sure. And looks like it works. Scanner is showing a very slow but steady increase in size. Estimation says a couple hours.
    Linguist Larry : Hm, the data says the structure is more Pure. Should be usable in most of the same applications. Hey, Bandit, I bet you can do the same with Fluix Crystals. And maybe even Nether Quartz. That should help you out with limited materials.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The ME Network
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.......§r shown §k..........§r tip §k......§r iceberg§k.......§r comes together §k..........§r thing §k.......§r call §k.....§r Mat§k..§r E§k....§r Network!
    §k.......§r ME Network §k.......§r simple§k...........§r Quartz Fiber §k....§r hook §k........§r devices together§k...........§r supply power §k.......§r connected devices §k.......§r Energy Acceptor§k.....§r converts RF §k.....§r into AE §k.....§r efficient§k.....§r
    §k.....§r store extra AE §k.......§r Energy Cell §k.........§r. You can easily generate energy with the Vibration Chamber, which can burn any solid fuel!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : I've requested some schematics from the other tech branches of The Ferret Business. These transmissions aren't getting any easier to translate unfortunately.
    Linguist Larry : Dishearteningly so. What I can figure from this one is that you can use Fluix crystals and Certus Quartz to create... a network?
    Dataologist Dante : M. E. Network. Massive Energy? No... Matter Energy?
    Linguist Larry : What? But Matter and Energy are two different things...
    Dataologist Dante : There's theories about that. But, deciphering this transmission, it sounds like theres a few devices that can be used in an ME Network, and it has its own power type. AE Energy. Let me put some of this together...
    Linguist Larry : Another power type? What's that make, five now? We really need to make a solid standard....
    Dataologist Dante : And then we would have six types. At least they are easy to convert between... except this AE. Looks like I can put RF Energy into the ME Network, but I can't pull it out. The Quartz Fiber transfers energy over the entire network, but only power our Applied Energistics devices it looks like.
    Linguist Larry : That's slightly annoying. So, RF Energy goes into the Energy Acceptor here, which turns it into AE Energy, which can be stored in the Energy Cell?
    Dataologist Dante : Correct.
    Linguist Larry : At least theres a power generator schematic, the Vibration Chamber. Uses solid fuel like wood or charcoal.
    Dataologist Dante : Good thing we got plenty of both.
    Linguist Larry : Correct.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Better Inscribing
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k..§r wait! §k........§r Inscriber too simple §k...............§r get §k.......§rAdvanced Inscriber!
    §k...§r hooking §k....§r ME Network, §k.......§r import and export §k..§r any side §k.......§r multiple Speed upgrades §k....§r work faster!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : A short transmission. Looks like we can upgrade the Inscriber?
    Linguist Larry : Sounds like it. What was wrong with the normal one?
    Dataologist Dante : Well, I tried hooking it up to some of our standard automation conduits and stuff. It was very picky about which side had which input or output. This Advanced Inscriber sounds like it solves that issue.
    Linguist Larry : What are Speed upgrades?
    Dataologist Dante : Not sure. None of the transmissions we've deciphered mention them... do they?

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Acceleration
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k....§r know §k......§r going to say§k..........§r Crystal Seeds §k.....§r hours to grow§k...........§r free§k....§r not be §k.........§r slow §k............§r
    §k......§r power §k...........§r ME Network§k....§r speed §k..........§r growth rate§k......§r upgrade §k....§r Quartz Fiber§k......§r Glass Cables §k..........§r Fluix Crystals§k.....§r incredible §k....§r Crystal Growth Accelerator!
    Hook §k.....§r top or bottom§k....§r water it touches §k....§r supercharged, speeding §k......§r Crystal Seeds §k.........§r
    Not fast §k......§r multiple §k.........§r Act §k...§r we'll §k.....§r three for §k.....§r two! §k....§r throw §k....§r extra §k...........§r Crystal Seeds for you!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : The more we understand on these transmissions, the more confused I get.
    Linguist Larry : Hopefully we can get an uncorrupted transmission at some point. 
    Dataologist Dante : Well, for now, we have another one to decipher. Hmm, it looks like this one is talking about those Crystal Seeds.
    Linguist Larry : The ones that take hours to grow.
    Dataologist Dante : Yep, but it looks like we can speed it up. Hmm... yeah, looks like we can use the Fluix Crystals to upgrade Quartz Fiber into ME Glass Cables.
    Linguist Larry : To what benefit?
    Dataologist Dante : Not sure yet. But looks like I can dye the cables. I don't like them being... bare like that though.
    Linguist Larry : Why not wrap them in some Wool?
    Dataologist Dante : ME Covered Cable? Why not. That'd be a great way to run two different cable lines next to each other without connecting them, as well.
    Linguist Larry : Good. What about this Crystal Growth Accelerator? Sounds like something especially helpful for Bandit here. Time is money, and time is survival as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Let me try a few things with this new cable... oh, turning the Fluix Crystals into a Fluix Block gives us a solid base... some Iron... ah, there we go!
    Linguist Larry : Wow, the scans say those Crystal Seeds ARE growing a good deal faster!
    Dataologist Dante : And the transmission sounds like the effect stacks. Bandit, do note that the ME Cable has to connect to the top or bottom of these. The water that's charged is directly adjacent to the Accelerator too. I bet you can come up with a pretty compact design to really speed up the growth.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Data Storage Basics
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.....§rnted ME Cable §k......§r more than §k...§r data and power §k...........§r 8 channels of da§k....§r complex machines §k...§r part of the ME Network §k.....§rsee this data flow§k...§r Smart Cables§k......§r visualize the data §k....§r
   §k....§r overloading your ME network §k.........§r special ME Toggle Bus to disconnect §k....§r Redstone Signal!
    §k.....§r more than §k.....§r data and information §k.....§r store items DIGITAL§k..§r need an ME Chest §k.........§r connect §k...§r ME Network to power §k.......§r special Storage Cells§k......§rles, components§k...§r stored §k.......§r into the ME Chest §k......§r it!
    §k.....§r multiple §k...§r Storage Cells§k....§r access them all§k........§r with the ME Terminal §k.......§rnect it to §k.......§r cable§k....§r all storage on that network will be availa§k.....§r
   §k......§rur Storage Cells §k........§r variety of sizes!
--------

    Linguist Larry : Wow, things are getting much more complex. Here, the notes from this message I was able to work out.
    Dataologist Dante : A lot here. Starting from the top... it sounds like these ME Cables have 8 channels... so it's like 8 cables in one?
    Linguist Larry : Right, but only for 'complex' machines. Probably things that require more than simple power.
    Dataologist Dante : Don't have anything like that yet I think, so let's move on. Smart Cable... ah, a way to visualize each channel being used? Hard to test without machines that use channels yet.
    Linguist Larry : Same thing with this Toggle Bus it talks about. Pretty standard electronics piece, just need to rework it to fit on ME Cables. 
    Dataologist Dante : And using a Redstone Signal on it closes the cable. Pretty useful for cutting off side networks from overloading the system.
    Linguist Larry : Mhmm. Hey, reading the next section, I think we found something that'll use those channels! I think I can decipher part of an image... There. Looks like part of some schematics and some text.
    Dataologist Dante : ME... Chest? Storage Cells? Terminal? Hmmm. There's a number there too. "Call (80....". Strange
    Linguist Larry : Oh wait, these look like part data sheets. Maybe that's a reference number for whatever alien database these came from.
    Dataologist Dante : Possibly. We can dig into that later. Lets scan the schematics with our equipment and see what we can come up with...
    Linguist Larry : That didn't take long. Looks like the basic storage medium is the Storage Cell, and the basic device is the ME Chest.
    Dataologist Dante : Oh nice. Hooked it up to the network. The ME Chest just holds a single Storage Cell, which you can put in by Right Clicking the side of the chest. To open it up, Right Click the top of the Chest.
    Linguist Larry : Oh wow, a digital display? With sorting and search functions. That... is a lot better than what I was thinking. Here, let me toss a bunch of stuff in there and see how much fits.
    Dataologist Dante : Hmm... Aha. The Storage Cell has a panel on it showing some information. It looks like each cell can hold 64 different items, but each item takes... digital space. 500 stones only take 1 item slot, but more data than 20 bricks.
    Linguist Larry : Okay, that makes the ME Terminal way more useful, then. A bunch of chests and Storage Cells on a single network can be accessed on the Terminal when it is placed on a cable.
    Dataologist Dante : And that's where channels come in I'm guessing. It transfers the data to the Terminal to regenerate the items for you. Amazing...
    Linguist Larry : That just means one thing then...
    Dataologist Dante : Yeah, we'll need bigger Storage Cells...

betterquesting.name: Ore Doubling
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k...........§r useful §k............§r crafty §k..........§r running out §k........§rrite metals §k..........§r going §k..........§r gold mines §k............§r grind §k............§r invention§k...................§r Quartz§k..........§r Grindstone! §k............§r no electricity §k...........§r simple §k.........§r Wooden Crank §k........§r
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Well that's interesting.
    Linguist Lenny : What?
    Dataologist Dante : One of the Deep miners popped in, hearing that we finally found a use for this Certus Quartz. 
    Linguist Lenny : The ones who wear heavy armor and weapons to go mining?
    Dataologist Dante : Yep! He looked at our research, grabbed a handful of Certus Quartz, stuffed it into a wood and stone box with a Gear, slapped a a Wooden Crank onto it, and...
    Linguist Lenny : They're always very strange. What the hell was he making?
    Dataologist Dante : Let me finish, okay? He stuffed an Iron Ore into it and started turning the crank, like a Jack n the Box. Just kept Right Clicking the crank. Suddenly, a bunch of Iron Dust popped out. He popped out a pocket Smelter...
    Linguist Lenny : They just keep those in their pocket? Weird.
    Dataologist Dante : Right? Well, he smelted it on the spot, and got two normal sized Iron Ingots out of one Iron Ore!
    Linguist Lenny : Now that's useful.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Applied Energistics
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    Hello §k....§re §k ...§r Josh§k ..........§r and new§k .......§r invention f§k ........§r storage §k ......§r Crystal §k ...............§r items §k ....§r pure§k .........§r data §k .....................§r crystals §k ...........§r grow §k ............................§r space §k ............§r room §k ......§r boxes!
--------

    Linguist Larry : Welcome to the Applied Energistics lab, Bandit. As you can see, this is about the average amount I'm able to translate from these strange transmissions we've been getting.
    Dataologist Dante : They started as soon as you arrived in that location and repeat every night around 1 AM.
    Linguist Larry : They don't seem to be a distress beacon, but it's a little hard to tell as the transmissions seem to be... corrupted and distorted. 
    Dataologist Danta : Well, there should be enough to work with at least... it's talking about Crystals as data storage, right? Well... Bandit, could you grab some Nether Quartz and a Diamond while we try to translate more?

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Better Growth
betterquesting.desc:
--------
   §k.......§r probably asking "But §k...§rstill §k.......§r drop §k.....§r Seeds §k......§r water§k...§r risky§k.......§r accidently pick §k...§r up!"
    §k......§r newest prod§k...§r help§k...........§r Crystal Growth Chamber §k........§r enclosed §k.......§r Crystal Seed growing §k.....§r can §k....§r mix Fluix Crystals §k..........§r input §k.....§r ingredients!
    §k.......§rzing new machine §k....§raccept §k......§rSpeed upgrades!
--------

    Dataologist Dante : Another short one. Not much new for the lexicon I take it?
    Linguist Larry : A little new, a little changed, a little marked 'probably wrong' unfortunately. But thats how translating unknown languages goes some times.
    Dataologist Dante : Test, retest, retest, confirm. I hear ya. Let's see... this sounds like theres an upgraded version of the Crystal Growth Accelerator? A Chamber instead.
    Linguist Larry : Right, safer than just leaving the seeds sitting in the water. Easier to control.
    Dataologist Dante : Right! Looks like we can pipe in the ingredients to make Fluix Crystals too. That's helpful. But another mention of Speed Upgrades. I should probably figure those out.

Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

    §k..§r Gas Storage Bus available§k..§rMore §k..§r coming §k..§r from §k..§roration!
--------
    Linguist Larry : Well that's short.
    Dataologist Dante : Reinforces the idea its a business huh...
    Linguist Larry : No kidding. Yeah, same as the item and fluid versions... except use a Gas Tank to set instead...
    Dataologist Dante : There isn't even a block version of this one? Weird.

betterquesting.name: Fluidic Access
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k......§r like item data §k.....§r also provide Fluid Interfaces§k....§r in block or panel §k...§r
    §k.......§r ME Fluid Interface Bus works on tanks §k...§r liquid carrying §k....§r adding §k...§r to your network.
    The ME Fluid Formation Plane §k...rcreate §k...§r using stored liquids, while the Annihilation Plane§k...§r digitize liquids touching §k.....§r add it to your storag§k......§r
--------
    Dataologist Dante : More fluid versions of ME devices. 
    Linguist Larry : Is there any more to this transmission?
    Dataologist Dante : Nah, short and to the point. Guess just reminder, Bandit, that you use a bucket of the liquid in the interface to register it.
    Linguist Larry : Hm, the Storage Bus is a little finicky in what liquid tanks it likes interfacing with. Just keep that in mind as well.

Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Intermediate Storage
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.......§rchest§k....§r not enough space? §k.....§r compact? §k....§rst in an ME Drive§k......§r hold 10 Storage Cell§k.....§r
    "But what §k....§r and other storage §k....§r?" §k.....§r Well, w§k........§r the §k....§r
    §k....§r ask §k.....§r. "Is there a§k.......§r crafting table §k.....§r?"  §k....§r the ME Crafting Terminal! 
    §k....§r important materials are stocked §k........§r use an ME Level Emitter §k.......§r emit a Redstone Signal §k.....§r isn't enough §k....§r in stock§k.........§r next step with an ME Storage Monitor§k.....§r see an item§k....§r in your ME system §k.....§r display!
    "But the item §k....§r can I pull §k.....§r Terminal?" Good §k....§r an even §k......§r is the ME Conversion Monitor! Special Formation§k.......§r Annihilation Cores §k.......§rallow Deposit or withdraw §k....§r items from your network§k.....§r
--------
    Linguist Larry : Interesting, sounds like this communication is actually a private one between two individuals. The tone of the quotes there is different from the rest of it.
    Dataologist Dante : Looks like it. A Drive... wonder if they are talking about a network server bay? Let me get an assistant to drag one of our empty bays up from storage...
    Linguist Larry : What's that?
    Dataologist Dante : One minute, I'll show you. Swapping the cables here and there and... perfect! 10 Storage Cell slots, just like advertised.
    Linguist Larry : Oh nice. Much better than having a chest for every Storage Cell, or worse, swapping them constantly.
    Dataologist Dante : Looks like we can upgrade the ME Terminal with a crafting grid. Should especially be handy for you, Bandit.
    Linguist Larry : Definitely. We can use that now as well since we're building up new machines a lot while researching these messages. This Level Emitter... I'm not sure how useful it'd be normally. You just choose an item and select how much you want to want to track, and whether it should emit a Redstone Signal if its above or below that value. 
    Dataologist Dante : Actually that sounds good for automation. Not really my field though.
    Linguist Larry : Kit Scouts didn't teach that?
    Dataologist Dante : Well, maybe if people regularly got stuck in the predicament Bandit did, well...
    Linguist Larry : Right right, sorry. Back on topic! Looks like you can go further with a Storage Monitor? Sounds way more useful than a Level Emitter for normal use.
    Dataologist Dante : Hm, a little testing and... oh, a wrench right... okay, I get how it works now. You can Right Click an item onto it to display how many you have in your Network. Right Click with a Wrench to 'lock' or 'unlock' your choice, or Right Click with an empty hand to clear it.
    Linguist Larry : Oh good, sounds like there's an even better one than that as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Hm, Conversion Monitor? Terminal... Ahh, looks like components that can convert Matter on the fly. Shouldn't be hard to whip up a design based on some of the other concepts we've learned.
    Linguist Larry : Hm, then you can make sort of a combination Terminal and Storage Monitor? Oh, I see what you are doing... try connecting that there. 
    Dataologist Dante : Yep, there we go. ME Conversion Monitor. Select and lock an item like the Storage Monitor, then you can Right Click to try to pull a stack of that item out, or Sneak + Right Click to put your held item back into the network.
    Linguist Larry : Oh, uh. Don't Sneak + Right Click while carrying a wrench. It'll just pop the panel back off...

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Compatable Access
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.....§r other §k...§rs machines? §k....§r with the ME Interface§k......§r acts as a container, drawing items from §k...§r ME Network and importing items §k.....§r interface! Comes in §k....§r Block and Flat!
    §k...§r other containers§k.....§r part of your ME Network§k...§rexport specific items §k....§r ME Storage Bus! Point it at your containers §k......§r to import items §k....§r export items into the container.
    Want §k...§r placing and harvesting materials §k......§r ME Formation Plane will place Blocks §k....§r while the ME Annihilation Plane will break §k.....§r down items, §k......§r Redstone Ore into §k....§r Dust§k...§r combining it §k....§rented Fluix Pearl§k.....§r preserve the original §k...§r block!
    §k......§r available §k....§r ME IO Port§k...§r for transfering items §k.....§r multiple Storage Cells!
    §k.....§r slim §k...§r Energy Cell and ME Drive §k.......§r Fixtures. §k....§r less capacity §k........§r easier to fit §k.....§r easy to remove §k...§r the Network Tool.
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Hey, I looked over the translation of the last transmission here. Already came up with some of the ideas it brings up. Nothing too different with what we've already got.
    Linguist Larry : Hm, an Interface? Should be useful hooking up non ME machines to your Network. And two styles, thats new. Both full block and a flat panel? Nice.
    Dataologist Dante : Yeah. You can select items to export from your Network into the Interface for other machines to grab. If a machine or pipe pulls into the Interface and its not full, it'll put the items into the ME Network instead. Not sure what the rest of the interface components do yet, though. Probably something in another transmission. 
    Linguist Larry : Well, lets come back to that then. This is more immediately useful by the looks of it though. ME Storage Bus? Means we don't have to replace our storage stuff already in place.
    Dataologist Dante : Exactly! Can configure it to pull items in the inventory into the ME Network, or export specific items into the inventory.
    Linguist Larry : Useful. The heck are these things though? A some blocks of wood keep appearing and dissappearing.
    Dataologist Dante : That panel there is the ME Formation Plane, can be configured to grab a specific block from your ME network and materialize it in front of it. The ME Annihilation Plane there does the opposite, it dematerializes a block in front of it and throws it back into your system.
    Linguist Larry : And that one?
    Dataologist Dante : The ME Identity Annihilation Plane. I'm not sure what it does, but it works similar to the normal one.
    Linguist Larry : Hmm, let me look at the translation... Ah, right, it keeps the original form of the material. So say if some Salt Ore were dematerialized by the normal Annihilation Plane, it'd break into piles of salt, but the Identity one keeps it as a Salt Ore.
    Dataologist Dante : Identity is just a weird tag to add onto it... but they ARE aliens I guess? Oh, right, this here is the ME IO Port. Pretty handy if you ask me.
    Linguist Larry : And it does...?
    Dataologist Dante : Basically you can choose to draw items from, or dump items into, your ME Network, from Storage Cells placed into the IO Port. Great if you make bigger Storage Cells and need to clean up your Drives.
    Linguist Larry : Like hard drives. Get a new, much bigger drive, and transfer four tiny hard drive's worth of data onto one giant one. 
    Dataologist Dante : Bingo. Speaking of of condensing things, these transmissions clued me in on making Panel versions of the Energy Cell and ME Drive. Helps keep things compact. Not as much space on them though... 
    Linguist Larry : Hey, looks like they have a special tool to remove stuff like the panels too. Network Tool is...not what I expect to call it though. 
    Dataologist Dante : Looks like it has some card slots. Wonder what those are for...

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Better, Faster, Stronger
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.......§r our machines §k....§r upgradable §k....§r products: Upgrade Cards! Each upgrade §k...§r marked §k......§r valid machines §k....§r slot §k....§r interface! Some upgrades§k....§r Storage Cells as well!
   §k.......§r two tiers §k...§r first tier §k...§rBasic Cards :
    - Capacity §k.....§r configuration slots.
    - Redstone §k...§r controlled by a Redstone §k......§r
    - Crafting §k....§r request §k..§r Auto Crafting §k....§r
    §k...§r second §k.......§r Advanced Cards : 
    - Acceleration§k.....§r speed §k...§r transfered§k....§r idle drain by 1 §k..§r
    - Fuzzy§k.......§r 'fuzzy behavior' §k....§r set the range of damage an §k...§r
    - Invert§k.....§rreverse §k..§r item §k....§r to Rejected.
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Hey, check out these blueprints. I can't figure out this or this...
    Linguist Larry : Let me cross reference with my translation... ah, here and here. And here, see?
    Dataologist Dante : There we go. Ah, expansion boards? No, Upgrade Cards, I see. That explains the slots on some of the machines. And some Storage Cells it seems?
    Linguist Larry : Okay, blueprints installed in the fabricator. Here we go. Each one is labeled with the machine it works in, nice.
    Dataologist Dante : Good. Okay, lets go back and forth and explain them to Bandit.
    Linguist Larry : Basic cards first. Capacity is for stuff like the Storage Bus, increasing how many Config slots it has.
    Dataologist Dante : Redstone lets the machine be controlled by... well, Redstone, obviously.
    Linguist Larry : Crafting lets the machine tap into your autocrafting system, if you have one set up.
    Dataologist Dante : Next are the Advanced Cards. Acceleration makes the machines faster, but consume more energy when idle.
    Linguist Larry : Fuzzy adds fuzzy behavior. So, lets you filter out certain levels of damage on a weapon, for example.
    Dataologist Dante : Last is the Invert Card. It just flips how it handles settings. So if you have a Storage Cell set to Cobblestone, Inverting it would 'Reject' cobblestone from being added to it.
    Linguist Larry : That's pretty handy. Okay I think thats all of them.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Crafting CPU
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k....§rastic ME System §k......§r more §k....§r store §k......§r data§k.....§r can §k........§r automate §k....§r crafting §k...§r heart of this system §k.....§r Crafting CPU§k...§r  component blocks§k.......§r highly configurable §k...§r
    §k....§r basic block §k...§r Crafting Unit§k..§r provides structure and connect§k......§r all components of §k....§r CPU!
    §k.....§r need §k......§r data storage for crafting §k...§r handled by §k......§r Crafting Storage §k....§r in 1k, 4k, §k...§r bigger§k...§re for complex tasks!
    To speed up §k...§r multi-tasking §k........§r Crafting Co-Processor Unit§k...§r crafting order §k......§r multiple §k...§r parts §k..§r Unit will parallelize tasks §k........§r
    §k.....§r Crafting CPU §k...§r parts§k......§r put them together §k...§r cuboid §k....§r faces of the machine turn into plusses§k...§r formed!
    §k.....§r can start setting up your automated craft§k...§r core §k.....§r is §k...§r Pattern system. These Blank Patterns §k......§r imprinted with a crafting task§k...§r can be reused as well §k.......§r hold them §k...§r Sneak + Right Clicking.
    §k.....§r imprint §k...§r to hook up a ME Pattern Terminal §k...§r ME Network§k...§r middle §k......§r Pattern creation area§k...§r slot at the right §k.......§r Blank Patterns§k...§r crafting recipe §k...§r down arrow §k.......§r imprint the pattern §k...§r toggle between Crafting and Processing§k........§r button to the right §k..§r patterns§k...§r such as smelting recipes§k.....§r simpler machine we §k...§r Pattern Encoder§k...§r only §k...§r crafting tasks.
    §k......§r utilize §k........§r Encoded pattern§k....§r use our ama§k...§r the Molecular Assembler. Hook§k.....§r ME Network and place the Encoded §k......§r can request the item §k....§r from any Interface§k...§r most §k.....§r take §k...§r ME Interfaces §k...§rcan provide multiple Molelcular Assemblers §k.......§r don't contain one§k..........§r
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Another transmission where it's a lot clearer in parts. Is that making it easier to translate?
    Linguist Larry : Sort of. The more I dig into the language, the more confusing it gets. Rules that contradict each other, words that mean the same thing or different things...
    Dataologist Dante : Sounds like our language.
    Linguist Larry : Yeah. Oh well, there's enough here to work on some more ME Network things. Looks like an... automated crafting thing this time?
    Dataologist Dante : I agree. Let's see, trying to decode the blueprints. And... there. Looks like this Crafting CPU is the brain of this.
    Linguist Larry : Crafting CPU? Definitely. Looks like you put it together with Crafting Units...
    Dataologist Dante : Which are basic structure blocks.
    Linguist Larry : Crafting Storage...
    Dataologist Dante :  Providing processing power.
    Linguist Larry : Yep, and the Crafting Co-Processor Unit.
    Dataologist Dante : Hm... Ah I see, its like multi-core processing. Enables the system to do more tasks at once.
    Linguist Larry : Right, so we toss all these together into a sort of cube shape and... oh hey, the faces of the machien blocks changed. 
    Dataologist Dante : Looks like it's formed the Crafting CPU? As long as it doesn't form a head or arms or anything...
    Linguist Larry : No lion robots here, though that'd be cool. Alright, it's wired into the ME Network. What's next, something about Patterns?
    Dataologist Dante : Looks like blueprints, in a way. Yeah, data blueprints. Take this Blank Pattern, and place it into either the ME Pattern Terminal or the Pattern Encoder, show it a recipe, and it can imprint it as a blueprint. Neat.
    Linguist Larry : Oops, I encoded the recipe wrong. What's it say here... here, you can clear it by holding it and Shift + Right Clicking to turn an Encoded Pattern back into a Blank one.
    Dataologist Dante : Good cause those Patterns aren't as cheap as paper. Here, I set up a Molecular Assembler on the network. Hand me the pattern and... there, slotted in. Let me look at the Terminal here and... oh, I see it. Bread, cheese, meat, mayo... and a button for a sandwich. Cute... and good thinking, I'm hungry. 
    Linguist Larry : Yep, this way we can keep working and have a snack at the same time. Feels kind of odd to be rematerializing food.
    Dataologist Dante : It's like Star Trek. I'm okay with that. Okay, it's bringing up ME Interfaces again. We still have one from earlier hooked up, let me move the Assembler over and mess with it a bit...
    Linguist Larry : Mhmhmm... sorry, should have stocked drink too. Looks like the ME Interface holds a bunch of patterns itself, and any Molecular Assemblers touching it can access the patterns.
    Dataologist Dante : Oh, combined with Co-Processing units and stuff, it cuts down on the amount of channels used. Good, very good. Let's go get a drink...

betterquesting.name: Circuit and Processor
betterquesting.desc:
--------
   �k......�r deeper �k............�r power �k.....�r Inscriber, Plates�k...�r ingredients�k..........�r imprint �k......�r circuitry patterns �k.........�r digitally conductive �k........�r Pure Certus Quartz, Diamonds, and Gold�k.....�r
    �k....�r press together �k.........�r Printed Silicon, Circuit�k....�r Redstone�k.........�r make �k....�r Processors�k.....�r
--------

    Linguist Larry : Every time I think we've got a handle on the language in these transmissions, it gets stranger.
    Dataologist Dante : I wonder if the corruption in the transmissions is a big part of that.
    Linguist Larry : It could also be local slang. Or even worse, abbreviations.
    Dataologist Dante : I D K, don't you like talking about your B F...
    Linguist Larry : No no no. Sorry about that Bandit, the QUEST Tablet doesn't quite transcribe the sounds of my brain shutting off.
    Dataologist Dante : Right, sorry, not su... wait, what's that phrase there? "digitally conductive"? I get the feeling its not talking about internet stuff like data transfer rate. 
    Linguist Larry : Me either. It sounds like we can use the Inscriber and those Plates to make Circuits, which we can then make Processors out of.
    Dataologist Dante : Huh, well I guess 3D printing is already making its way to homes, why not powerful processor presses?

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Dust to Silicone
betterquesting.desc:
--------
   §k.....§r Quartz Grindstone §k...........§r break down §k.........§r you to break §k.....§r patented Certus Quartz§k.....§r other fantastic §k............§r Fluix Crystals, Nether Qua§k...............§r
    §k.....§r can use §k...........§r Inscriber §k..§rlicon Press Plate, §k..........§r turn Silicon §k.....§r Printed Circuit!
    §k.....§r Quartz Dust be used for? §k.........§r mixing §k.....§r Glass §k.......§r better Quartz Glass§k............§r get it to Glow§k............§r quite Vibrant!
--------

    Linguist Larry : Hrm. This transmission was easier to decode. Lots of repeated words. That helps the lexicon at least.
    Dataologist Dante : Great! This one is easier to figure out at least. Looks like grinding Certus Quartz and other things will get us Dust. And we can use that dust to make things like Quartz Glass.
    Linguist Larry : Vibrant... hey, try adding some Glowstone Dust to the Quartz Glass too. 
    Dataologist Dante : More dust eh? Not a bad idea.
    Linguist Larry : Well, Bandit, might as well grind down some Nether Quartz and Sky Stone as well. Maybe you can find a use for it soon. In the meantime, what about the Inscriber it's talking about, Dante?
    Dataologist Dante : That's the only part of the transmission that's not clear. You don't grind Sand into Silicone, you Smelt it.
    Linguist Larry : Translation error? Well, the next part is clearer then. Looks like we can turn the Silicone into a Printed Circuit with the Inscriber.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: More, More, More
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.....§r our patent§k..§rstorage system §k.......§r customizable ways§k....§r our Fluid and Gas systems!
    The Fluid Import Bus and Fluid Export Bus§k.......§r Gas Import Bus and Gas Export Bus§k........§r variety §k......§r have at your disposal!
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Another short transmission. Straightforward as well.
    Linguist Larry : Good, trying to decipher the longer ones back to back gets tiring. 
    Dataologist Dante : When we have to do some research outside our fields especially. Not used to programming in blueprints into our systems and tweaking them.
    Linguist Larry : Well, at least it'll help us in the long run after this. 
    Dataologist Dante : Right and... oh, sorry Bandit, we're rambling. The transmission is primarily just talking about Fluid and Gas versions of the Import and Export busses.
    Linguist Larry : Works mostly the same way too, just with the right inventories. Liquid or Gas tanks, etc.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: More Crafting, More Storage
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k......§rcrafting system §k......§rmore customizable §k...§r than §k....§r competitors§k......§r
    §k....§rexample§k.......§r ME Interface Terminal§k....§r you can see §k...§r crafting systems and§k.......§r patterns§k....§r installed in your network §k.......§r
    §k.......§r a Crafting Monitor§k....§r will show §k...§r current crafting task §k......§r
    §k..........§r finer inventory control§k.....§r utilize the ME Import and Export busses§k....§r Import Bus will pull §k...§r from the inventory you point §k.......§rinto your ME Storage system, while the Export bus will pull items from your system that you set in its interface.
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Huh, the end of this transmission was very easy to decipher. I think the interference cleared up for a moment?
    Linguist Larry :  Or our translation lexicon is getting better. 
    Dataologist Dante : Probably a little of both with some luck thrown in. 
    Linguist Larry : No kidding. Hm, looks like the Interface Terminal could be useful. See? Shows all the connected crafting systems, and the patterns each has.
    Dataologist Dante : Handy. Hm, that's... kind of annoying. It's showing all the interfaces with the same name. What if... hey, yep, that worked. Look at the Interface Terminal again.
    Linguist Larry : Oh, you can name the ME Interfaces. That'll help with organization.
    Dataologist Dante : This Crafting Monitor should be helpful too. Displays what the Crafting CPU is currently working on.
    Linguist Larry : Nice. Oh, check these blueprints here. Import and Export busses? Isn't that more for just storage side of things?
    Dataologist Dante : Possibly, but I bet we can find some interesting combination of of these various tools to do something interesting.
    Linguist Larry : I'll leave that to the storage system experts. So the Import Bus will grab all the items from whatever you point it at.
    Dataologist Dante : Unless you set specific items in the interface.
    Linguist Larry : Right. And you HAVE to do that for the Export Bus for it to work, otherwise it'd dump your entire digitized storage into it. Or as much as it could.
    Dataologist Dante : Yep, exactly.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Gaseous ME Systems
betterquesting.desc:
"--------
    §k.....§rtented ME System §k...§r more than §k........§r object data§k.....§r gasses as well! 
    §k......§r access the stored gasses §k.  .§r ME Gas Terminal§k..§r spots for containers §k..§r adding or removing §k..§r 
    §k..§r store gasses§k....§r special drives§k....§r Gas Storage Housing and some Storage Component§k......§r drives §k....§r sizes!
    §k...§r the ME Gas Level Emitter §k....§r Redstone Signal depending on gas levels§k......§r
    The Gas Storage Mon§k....§rdisplay the amount §k...§r set§k....§r Right Click a Gas Tank containing some gas §k......§r then a Wrench §k.....§r
    §k....§r the Gas Conversion Monitor§k......§r coming soon!
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Well, thats weird.
    Linguist Larry : What?
    Dataologist Dante : I figured this was just a repeat transmission, since the blueprints and words I could decipher were nearly the same as the last one.
    Linguist Larry : Nearly? Let me get a look...  yeah, you are right. Very slight changes in wording and materials. So... Gas storage?
    Dataologist Dante : Right. We don't have much that uses gas here come to think of it. Mekanism labs do, but most everyone else condenses things down to liquid form. Easier to store.
    Linguist Larry : Less worrying about pressure and gas leaks. So, Bandit, by the looks of it its the same as the regular item and Fluid ME components. Terminal for access, Gas Storage Drives for storage...
    Dataologist Dante : Level Emitter, Storage Monitor... you'll need to Right Click a Gas Tank with the Gas instead of a Bucket onto the monitor before locking. What else... oh... looks like the Gas Conversion Monitor blueprint is just... is that a "Coming Soon!" advertisement?
    Linguist Larry : Yeah, kinda reminds me of some of marketting's earlier magazine inserts. Maybe these guys were some sort of business like us?
    Dataologist Dante : Hey gotta pay for things somehow right?

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Charged Energistic Tools
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k..§r the Charger can§k....§r power §k..§r variety of tools and instru§k.......§r
    §k.....§r Charged Staff §k...§r powered melee §k....§r smashing coconuts §k.......§r giant enemy crabs §k....§r way!
    The Entropy Manipulator s§k.....§r can both heat up and cool things §k....§r hit a creature§k...§r giant enemy crab...§k........§r lights on fire!
    The Matter Condensor §k....§r recycles useless materials §k...§r can make a Matter Ball§k......§r surround the Matter Ball in dye to make a Paint Ball§k....§r
    Take a Matter Ball §k.....§r into a Matter Cannon§k..§r railgun §k....§r variety of ammo§k...§r Iron and Gold Nuggets§k....§r store one type of ammo at a time§k..§r can be refilled in an ME Chest or ME IO Port.
    §k......§r Color Applicator §k...§r Paint Balls or any Dye, and paint certain materials §k..§r like wool, glass panes, and ME Cables. Paint Balls §k..§rmore efficient §k.§r can Sneak + Right Click  in the air to change the chosen color§k.....§r Snowballs in the Color Applicator to clean blocks!
--------
    Linguist Larry : ...Why is it talking about Giant Enemy Crabs?
    Dataologist Dante : Maybe its a joke?
    Linguist Larry : I hope so. I swear if we get any sort of blueprint for a creature, sea based or not....
    Dataologist Dante : Eh I wouldn't worry about it too much. It looks like schematics for a variety of tools this time.
    Linguist Larry : Yeah. A powered smashing tool and a railgun. What the heck...
    Dataologist Dante : Mmm. All of them can be charged in the Charger. At least that gives it more use. 
    Linguist Larry : The Charged Staff is pretty simple looking. It just applies an energy punch when you strike with it. The Entropy Manipulator looks a lot more useful though. Freeze water or melt it, or cool lava? Sounds pretty useful when exploring.
    Dataologist Dante : Definitely. Right Click something to heat it up, or Sneak + Right Click to cool it down. Strike a creature to light it on fire.
    Linguist Larry : Like a giant crab.
    Dataologist Dante : ......the Matter Condensor looks useful too. Great way to recycle and compress trash. Eventually makes a Matter Ball. See? 
    Linguist Larry : Wow, that's kind of heavy. I see you turned one Purple...
    Dataologist Dante : Yeah, looks like it can absorb dye as well, making it a Paint Ball.
    Linguist Larry : Geez, I'd hate to get hit with one of these on the paintball field...
    Dataologist Dante : Nah, you'd need to use this Matter Cannon they talk about to fire it. It's literally a railgun, so...
    Linguist Larry : More than enough to kill anything that moves...like...
    Dataologist Dante : Don't say it. Matter Cannon can fire other things too it looks like. Not as deadly as Matter Balls though. Needs an ME Chest or IO Port to reload by the looks of it.
    Linguist Larry : What about this paint brush looking thing?
    Dataologist Dante : The Color Applicator, let me read over the data and test it...Okay, it can use Dye or Paint Balls. Color stuff like wool. Pretty useful if you don't want to juggle sixteen colors of a material when you are building something fancy I guess.
    Linguist Larry : Can also clean paint by using Snowballs. Useful!

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Fluid Processing
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k..§r manipulate fluids §k...§r turning on the tap §k..§r devices!
    The Fluid Vibration Chamber §k....§r burn liquid §k..§r power §k....§r you have excess rocket fuel!
    The ME Fluid Auto Filler §k....§r fills buckets §k...§r when requested§k..§r when your Crafting CPU requests§k..§r
    The ME Fluid Assembler §k....§r ability §k..§r recipes §k.....§r buckets of fluid, without §k....§r buckets!
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Short transmission and only a few blueprints.
    Linguist Larry : Hmm, some new words to add to the translator lexicon at least. Looks like some more Fluid machines. 
    Dataologist Dante : Oh, excellent, a fluid version of the Vibration Chamber. Means we can use stuff like Lava as well.
    Linguist Larry : I still find it amusing how many worlds we encounter that are just covered in Lava...
    Dataologist Dante : No kidding. Well, more use for it I guess. Next we have the ME Fluid Auto Filler. It...automatically fills buckets.
    Linguist Larry : So it does what it says on the tin.
    Dataologist Dante : Yep. Last is the ME Fluid Assembler. It...
    Linguist Larry : Let me guess. Assembles things with fluid?
    Dataologist Dante : Sort of. Its like the Molecular Assembler, but if something needs a bucket of fluid, you only need the fluid itself in the ME System.
    Linguist Larry : Ah, cutting out the middleman. Middle bucket?
    Dataologist Dante : I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that...

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Advanced ME Networks
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k......§r get §k...§r your ME Netwo§k......§r install §k...§r ME Controller! This fa§k....§r machine is a routing hub for §k.......§r more complex ME netwoks! Each connection §k.....§r emit §k..§r channels. 
    §k.......§r modular and expandable§k........§r place ME Controller Blocks together, power §k.....§r cycles colors§k...§r running!
    T§k......§r can emit up to thirty-two channels§k........§r ME Cables cannot handle §k....§r use our heavy duty ME Dense Cables§k...§r panels §k......§r not compat§k.....§r Dense Cable§k......§r connect a regular cable §k.......§r
    §k......§r growing §k.....§r Energy Storage §k....§r Dense Energy Cell §k......§r eight times more §k..§r
   §k....§r your network §k..§r disasterous locations? The Blast Resistant ME Drive §k.......§r holds 3 storag§k.....§r can withstand §k...§r explosions!
    §k....§r customiz§k......§r Storage Cells? The ME Storage Housing §k.......§r new Storage Cells, §k...§r make most normal Storage Cells §k..§r such as the View Cell or ME Block Container! The View Cell §k......§r can install in an ME Terminal to filter w§k.....§r ME Block Container only holds a single item§k....§r
    These Storage C§k.....§r configured in §k.§rdandy Cell Workbench. §k.....§r can configure what items it holds§k...§r install Upgrades§k.....§r
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Putting this message through the translator...there. It's getting faster!
    Linguist Larry : And understanding more words. Not good on the nuances and slang though...though most computer translators aren't.
    Dataologist Dante : You'd be out of a job then.
    Linguist Larry : Don't remind me...anyways, it looks like this transmission is about some advanced machines. The ME Controller, huh?
    Dataologist Dante : Sounds like a network router, but for ME Channels. A big enough ME Network would definitely require it, unless you broke it up into lots of small networks. 
    Linguist Larry : Sounds like a hassle either way, but the ME Controller is the better route. Okay, I have some ME Controller Blocks fabricated, testing...huh, interesting, okay.
    Dataologist Dante : Yeah, looks like you can't expand it beyond 7x7x7 area. It just errors out. Good to know. These ME Dense Cables help a lot too. Four times more channels on a line, fantastic. And no need for an adapter to step down to regular cables.
    Linguist Larry : Dang, I can't attach this ME Terminal to it. I wonder...oh, yeah it says right here. "panels...not compat...". 
    Dataologist Dante : Slightly annoying. Oh well. We can condense the stack of Energy Cells down to a Dense Energy Cell at least. Should save space, the lab here is starting to get cramped...
    Linguist Larry : Well, at least we don't need this Blast Resistant ME Drive. I don't know why we'd make one of these in an explosion proof zone but...
    Dataologist Dante : Remember Vinny?
    Linguist Larry : ...Right, this might be useful later. So will these other Storage Cells. A View Cell for filtering an ME Terminal...ME Block Container to store a lot of one item...and a ME Storage Housing to craft them all.
    Dataologist Dante : Wish they transmitted about the Cell Workbench earlier. Would have been useful to configure and upgrade the cells from the start.
    Linguist Larry : No kidding...

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Stored in the Cube Dimension
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k...§r products that §k..§r digitally store §k.....§r physical spaces §k..§r Our Spatial Storage System §k....§r storing and deploying §k....§r work areas, entertainment setups, and entire storefronts§k.§r
    §k....§r build a Spatial Containment Structure, or SCS. Frame an area with Spatial Pylons §k...§r placing them in straight lines. Small areas §k.....§r3 lines to form a corner. Bigger structures §k...§r more Spatial Pylon lines along the sides §k..§r lowering the power requir§k....§r connect every §k...§r line to both your ME Network and power. §k...§r glows purple§k......§r is ready!
   §k..§r need a Spatial Storage Cell§k....§r smallest §k..§r is the 2 Cubed Spatial Storage Cell§k...§r digitize up to a 2x2x2 area§k...§r connect a Spatial IO Port to the SCS, insert the Spatial Storage Cell, and attach a Button §k.....§r to the Spatial IO Port. §k...§r hit the button§k.§r capture the area in the SCS, or deploy the stored area. 
    §k..§r larger the area §k...§r more power §k.§r Adding more Spatial Pylon lines §k......§r makes it more efficient§k...§r space between each line of Pylons. Don't connect corners §k..........§r invalidates the SCS!
    §k.....§r can digitize §k.....§r creatures as well, including yourself! §k.....§r own dimensional pocket§k...§r bring a way out, or have a friend on the outside!
    §k....§r offer bigger Spatial Storage Cell sizes §k....§r the 16 Cubed Spatial Storage Cell.
--------
    Linguist Larry : Wow, big message for only a few blueprints.
    Dataologist Dante : These are pretty complex blueprints, to be fair.
    Linguist Larry : Digitizing entire areas? Yeah, I'd say its pretty complex. It sounds pretty useful. Would make mobile labs more interesting for sure.
    Dataologist Dante : Let me test this a bit...it's a little more finicky than the other machines so far. Now...hm...
    Linguist Larry : You okay?
    Dataologist Dante : Yeah. Like I said. Finicky. Oh, there, okay. So, we need to designate a containment area with Spatial Pylons in straight lines. We only need 3 lines. Vertical, Horizontal, and Depth in other words. See?
    Linguist Larry : Why isn't there a Pylon block in the corner connecting all three?
    Dataologist Dante : Then its not 3 separate lines, at least according to the system. So we use ME Cable there instead, and connect it to the ME Network.
    Linguist Larry : Given that its glowing that nice purple, it needs power as well of course. How much?
    Dataologist Dante : Depends on how big an area we want to contain. Now, we take a 2 Cubed Spatial Storage Cell, insert it in this Spatial IO Port, slap this button on it, and its ready.
    Linguist Larry : No built in button? That seems like an oversight.
    Dataologist Dante : Agreed. Maybe this is an early revision blueprint?
    Linguist Larry : Weird thing to transmit with all these completed blueprints. Oh well, we have the Spatial IO Port and Storage Cell hooked up. We just hit the button then?
    Dataologist Dante : Yep. As long as there is enough power in the network for the size of the area, when you hit the button, it should digitize it and store it. See? It even digitized and stored our assistant...who really shouldn't be napping on the job...
    Linguist Larry : Whoa, thats neat. Wait, why didn't that machine there get stored?
    Dataologist Dante : Not everything can be stored, it looks like. I'm not sure what criteria there is.
    Linguist Larry : Okay...so our assistant is safe right? 
    Dataologist Dante : Perfectly, he's just stuck in...I guess you could call it another dimension? Data dimension. He's actually alive inside the drive here. We just deploy the same way we stored it and...pop, there he is. Still sleeping.
    Linguist Larry : Not for long. Hand me that bucket of water...

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Fluidic ME Systems
betterquesting.desc:
--------
    §k.....§rtented ME System §k...§r more than §k........§r object data§k.....§r fluids as well! 
    §k......§r access the stored fluids §k.  .§r ME Fluid Terminal§k..§r spots for containers §k..§r adding or removing §k..§r 
    §k..§r store fluids§k....§r special drives§k....§r Fluid Storage Housing and some Storage Component§k......§r drives §k....§r sizes!
    §k...§r the ME Fluid Level Emitter §k....§r Redstone Signal depending on fluid levels§k......§r
    The Fluid Storage Mon§k....§rdisplay the amount §k...§r set§k....§r Right Click a bucket of the fluid §k......§r then a Wrench §k.....§r
    §k....§r the Fluid Conversion Monitor§k......§r set and lock in a liquid§k....§r use an empty bucket §k.....§r from storage!
--------
    Dataologist Dante : Here, some blueprints from this transmission. This one is looking really good.
    Linguist Larry : Oh? Let me check... oh, this ME system can also do Fluids? That's... big. Really big.
    Dataologist Dante : Definitely. No separate tanks for each liquid. No separate pipes either. Nice and compact.
    Linguist Larry : So liquids have a their own storage drives and interfaces. Keeps them from getting too cluttered I guess.
    Dataologist Dante : Yep, they match up to the normal item data ones. ME Terminal to ME Fluid Terminal, ME Drives to ME Fluid Drives, etc. Looks like the fluid terminal has slots to input and output liquid in its interface. Handy.
    Linguist Larry : Look, ME Fluid Level Emitter too. And the Storage and Conversion Monitors as well.
    Dataologist Dante : Just like the normal ones, except you Right Click with a bucket of the liquid you want to track and THEN lock it with a wrench.
    Linguist Larry : So for the Conversion Monitor, just Right Click an empty Bucket on it and... hey, look, water. Neat.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Supernatural Fetish
betterquesting.desc:
Like the Spectral Familiar, we can call upon the spirits of the dead to aid us in various ways. To best be prepared, please obtain the §5§lWitchcraft: Conjuration and Fetishes§r book, as well as craft yourself a §5§lBrazier§r, which we will need.
    A key ingredient we shall need is §5§lWormwood§r. Much like Grasspers and other plants we work with, they are not natural to our worlds. You will need to Mutate up an initial batch to obtain some seeds. Dig a 3x3 hole in some Dirt, and till the center block with a hoe. Plant wheat Seeds and allow it to grow to full size (or speed it along with some Bonemeal!). To the North, South, East, and West of the Wheat, place down some Wispy Cotton.  Dig each corner down and place Water in them. Now, §l§nSneak + Right Click§r your Mutating Sprig on the fully grown Wheat to turn it into §5§lWormwood§r. When you break it, you should get some §5§lWormwood Seeds§r, which you can grow normally like other crops. Be sure to let the initial crop grow to full size again or you'll have to do the Mutation again!
    While that grows, you will need to take another trip into the Spirit World. You have perhaps noticed some glowing golden orbs floating around in previous trips here. These are Spirits that you will need to subdue with force. §5§lSubdued Spirits§r will travel back with you when you awaken from the Spirit World.
    The final thing (other than the various spirits themselves...) you'll need is some sort of fetish. Only three things will work in your world, unfortunately: the §5§lTrent Effigy§r, the §5§lWitch's Ladder§r, and the §5§lScarecrow§r. With these, you can follow the guides in the §5§lConjuration and Fetish§r book. Many witches have no need for such devices, so I will not require you to bind spirits to a Fetish. I will, however, give you some tips.
    To use the §5§lBrazier§r, you place the ingredients listed in the book, and then Right Click a Flint and Steel onto it. It takes up to a minute before a chosen spirit will manifest.
    §5§lSpirits§r wander freely. A barrier ritual as part of a larger ritual will not help, as §5§lBraziers§r do not instantly manifest Spirits, and you cannot pause a ritual in the middle. §5§lSubdued Spirits§r as well are very flighty. You will need to construct an actual physical barrier, or contain your ritual area in some fashion. Do remember that summoning creatures physically, especially large ones such as Demons require a 7x7 area around the Heart Glyph to be free of anything but Grasspers, and this area must extend around 4 blocks high of empty space as well.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Grim Poppets
betterquesting.desc:
There are a few more §5§lPoppets§r I have yet to teach you to make. They deal with some darker aspects of Witchcraft, so it is only proper that you know how to both protect yourself from, and utilize, these tools. Alas, I have not been able to get your Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet to see each individual one... I am not a computer witch like Caigan's sister is, and who knows what strange adventure that child is up to right now...
    Ahem... where was I? Ah, yes...
    The first §5§lPoppet §ris the §5§lDeath Protection Poppet§r. Unlike the other §5§lPoppets§r, this §5§lPoppet§r will protect you from any death a single time, as long as you carry it with you or place it upon a Poppet Shelf.
    Delving deeper into the darker §5§lPoppet§r arts, we have the §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r. It gives you some control over the linked being, usually nefarious in nature. If you hold it and swing it around, it can transfer this movement to the target. Holding Right Click can charge this effect for bigger movements.
    If you have Bone Needles in your inventory and Sneak + Right Click with the §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r, you will stick one into the §5§lPoppet§r and cause damage to the target. If you hold the Voodoo Poppet under water, the target may start drowning. If you Right Click the §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r on Lava§r, it will ignite the target on fire and destroy the §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r.
    To protect yourself from the §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r, you will need a §5§lVoodoo Protection Poppet§r. This§5§l Poppet§r will take damage each time it prevents a §5§lVoodoo Poppet§r from working on you, as well as redirect damage back to the source as a lightning bolt.
    Another dark §5§lPoppet§r is one that can skirt the line between good and bad. The §5§lVampiric Poppet§r allows you to redirect the damage from one linked being to another. When you bind Taglocks to the §5§lVampiric Poppet§r, you bind two of them. The position you place the Taglocks in the crafting table is important : it goes in order left to right, top to bottom. The first Taglock it finds is the protected being, while the second Taglock is who or what will receive the damage instead. Each time it redirects damage, the §5§lVampiric Poppet§r will take damage. If the target being dies, you will need to bind a new target Taglock to the §5§lPoppet§r.
    The last §5§lPoppet§r is specifically to guard you against a malicious Witch or Warlock's attempts to destroy your §5§lProtection Poppets§r with the Curse of Corrupt Poppet ritual, which can destroy up to TEN of your §5§lProtection Poppets§r! The §5§lPoppet Protection Poppet§r will intercept the curse ritual, taking damage instead. Be sure to bind it to yourself first!

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Enhanced Witchiness
betterquesting.desc:
A Witch or Warlock always has the means and tools to improve both themselves, their tools, and their abilities. 
    First, we will focus on improving ourselves and our abilities. We can do this buy employing the use of special §5§lDream Weavers§r. Each one will help you after a good night's rest, but be wary that a Dream Weaver of Nightmares nearby will cause the opposite of the intended effect.
    The §5§lDream Weaver of Fleet Foot§r will increase your movement speed.
    The §5§lDream Weaver of Iron Arm§r will increase your digging speed.
    The §5§lDream Weaver of Fasting§r will lessen the speed at which you become hungry.
    All of these §5§lDream Weavers§r can be made more potent with the final one : The §5§lDream Weaver of Intensity§r. This will also make the Dream Weaver of Nightmares and all negative effects more intense, however, so be wary, child.
    Let us now enhance our tools a bit. The §5§lFume Funnel§r is placed on either side of a Witches' Oven to improve both its speed and its ability to produce usefull byproducts.
    You can make a §5§lFume Filter§r and combine it with a §5§lFume Funnel§r to make a §5§lFiltered Fume Filter§r, which further increases the byproduct chance.
    Either way, each Witches' Oven can only support two §5§lFume Funnels§r, whther they are §5§lFiltered§r or not. You can place another on top of the Oven for the look of it, but it will only slightly increase the speed.
    One more thing to show you is the §5§lSilver Vat§r. This can be placed next to a Furnace, and when you smelt Gold Ore, there is a chance that some §5§lSilver Deposits§r will fill a §5§lVat§r. You can craft 9 of these§5§l Deposits§r together to get some Pulverized Silver, enough to smelt into a Silver Ingot.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Thoughtful Witch
betterquesting.desc:
A Witch or Warlock has to keep their wits about them at all times. Not only must we be wary of the magical world, we must also be wary of the physical world, from both threat of monster, as well as keeping up our outward appearance (remember your Headology, child).
    To take care of skulking monsters (or unfriendly Witches or assistants), employ the use of the §5§lBeartrap§r. It will snap shut should they walk over it, hurting and immobilizing them for a few moments. Not all creatures can be caught with a §5§lBeatrap§r, but that is for another lesson...
    Rowan and Alder trees make a pair of special doors. When placed, they look like normal wooden doors. Only when they are in your hand can you tell they are special.
    §5§lRowan Wood Doors§r can only be opened with a Rowan Key, which is magically created when you place the door down. To get another key, break down and place the door in the same exact spot as before. Do take note that Redstone Signals can only CLOSE a §5§lRowan Wood Door§r, never open it. 
    §5§lAlder Wood Doors§r, however, will not open nor close to a Redstone Signal. Instead, it emits one when opened, enabling it to trigger traps or other surprises.
    Ah, one thing I should have taught you before is how to make §5§lEarmuffs§r, special ones that mute those shrill Mandrakes and their nauseating cries... alas, better late than never, no? Ahem...
    A crafty witch has ways to find water. A §5§lWater Diviner§r can be Right Click and held on a block. The §5§lDiviner§r will search directly downward for water, and will sound either a positive or a negative note when it is done. You also turn your §5§lWater Diviner§r into a §5§lLava Diviner§r, which can be used the same way to search for Lava.
    A thoughtful witch also knows that talking to animals can be of immense value, not only in the Headology department, but also in resources. The §5§lPolynesia Charm§r can be Right Clicked onto almost any adult animal, and you can trade items with them. Sometimes an animal will have a special item for trade you would not usually find on a Villager trader, let alone an animal.
    And finally, something I know you've been waiting for, Bandit. I will teach you how to make the §5§lWitches' Hat§r and §5§lRobes§r. First, you will need to make some §5§lImpregnated Leather§r, which is not difficult in of itself, but requires a few distilled items.
    Using this and some Golden Thread (and a Creepers' Heart, don't ask...), you can make the garments. When you wear either piece of §5§lWitches' clothing§r, you increase the chance of creating extra brews when Brewing! Wearing both §5§lHat§r and §5§lRobes §rgives you the best chance at extra brews. Oh, and wearing the Robes makes Creepers ignore you, apparently.  A useful side effect of the use of the Creeper Heart, I'd say.
    Note that this extra brew bonus does not count for every brew. Brews of a Necromantic nature do not count, you will need a... different set of clothing for that.
    Finally, you can take §5§lImpregnated Leather§r and fashion it into a §5§lBrew Bag§r. You can place multiple stacks of Brews in this by Sneak + Right Clicking while holding it. Then hold and Right Click the bag to see what Brews you have. Move your cursor over the Brew you wish to throw, then release Right Click! Handy and saves space in your pockets.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Brews of Fauna
betterquesting.desc:
Brews can be used to alter creatures, great or small. From drinking them to bolster yourself, or throwing them at monsters to impact them in various ways, you have no shortage of options, child.
    Drinking a §5§lBrew of the Depths§r allows you to breath underwater. In exchange, though, you cannot breath normal air until the effect wears off.
    Drinking a §5§lBrew of the Grotesque§r will prevent creatures from wandering too close, as your visage becomes horrible to them.
    If you want creatures closer instead, employ use of the §5§lBrew of Frogs Tongue§r. All creatures hit by the splash will be pulled towards you.
    Not the direction you wish them to take? Throw a §5§lBrew of Cursed Leaping§r to send them (and you, if you get splashed!) flying upward. It gives a small boost to jump and fall height, but not enough to cushion the fall from the initial leap.
    Next, why do all the work yourself? Make yourself a §5§lConcentrated Bat Ball§r with some bats caught in a Critter Snare. (Careful, if you are hit when carrying the §5§lConcentrated Bat Ball§r, you will drop it!).
