You can then create a §5§lBrew of Bats§r with it; throw it at a creature and it will explode into a swarm of bats that stuns everything in range. 
    For a bit more offensive attack, use the §5§lBrew of Bodega§r. Instead of bats, a parliament of Owls will descend and attack your enemy. Hm? Yes, a group of Owls is amusingly called a parliament. Ahem...
    Lastly, for hostile creatures and Witches that employ the use of invisibility, the §5§lBrew of Revealing§r is your friend, as it does exactly what it says on the bottle.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Brews of Flora
betterquesting.desc:
Brews can be used to alter the land around you in a variety of ways.  Be wary using these, child, as one slip of the paw could end up with half your house turned to ice.
    First things I will show you are the elements of Water and Fire. The §5§lBrew of Endless Water§r is... mistakenly named, but it can be used to provide about a hundred buckets worth of Water from the a single, small glass bottle. The §5§lBrew of Combustion§r, on the other hand, can be used as a fuel source, a decent amount better than plain Charcoal.
    Moving on to more destructive brews, we have the §5§lBrew of Wasting§r and §5§lBrew of Erosion§r. §5§lWasting§r will destroy all plants and leaves it splashes on, while §5§lErosion§r will destroy the landscape itself. §5§lErosion§r will not make any materials collectable, however, unless it is Obsidian.
    If destruction is not reasonable, then creation may help instead. The §5§lBrew of Frost§r will encase creatures in ice and construct ice walls as a barrier.
    A much more practical brew, however, is the §5§lBrew of Substitution§r. It will replace constructed materials with ones you drop on the ground. For example, if you dropped a stack of Wood Planks down (not place, but dropped with Q, for example), and then threw a §5§lBrew of Subsitution§r on a pile of Dirt, it would replace the Dirt with Wood Planks.
    Finally, §5§lSolidifying Brews§r come in a few varieties. To use them, you will need Brew of Hollow Tears, or at least a bucket of the Hollow Tears you can dump out. Solidfying Brews will replace all of the liquid from the Brew of Hollow Tears with the specified type of material : Dirt, Stone, Sand, or Sandstone. As well, there is an§5§l Erosion§r type, which will instead destroy the Hollow Tears liquid and the blocks below it.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Infused With Purpose
betterquesting.desc:
There is a wide variety of things you can do with Infusion, and all of them are listed in the Witchcraft: Circle Magic book. Many of them take special Infusion ingredients which must be brewed. Let me explain them to you, Bandit.
    Some infusions require the power of a focus. A focus is a must, and in your case it is unfortunately a §5§lWitches Hand§r. For you, the dark practitioner Witches found in Swamp biomes can drop this grim tool. As always with Witchy ingredients obtained via bloodletting, using an Arthana gives a greater chance of obtaining it.
    One last thing before I explain these infusions : they are dangerous. Infusing yourself with so much power can kill you when the Ritual is done. I highly suggest keeping a supply of Death Protection Poppets at the ready. Now then...
    The first Infusion brew is the §5§lGhost of the Light§r. This is used in the Infusion of Light, which enables you to harness the power of Light and bend it to your will.
    The second Infusion brew is the §5§lSoul of the World§r. It is used in the Infusion of the Overworld, granting you abilities to manipulate the earth and metal.
    The third Infusion brew is the §5§lSpirit of Otherwhere§r. Used in the Infusion of Otherwhere, which infuses you with the power of your End dimension, enabling you to teleport around.
    The final Infusion brew I'll explain right now is the §5§lInfernal Animus§r. It is used in the Infernal Infusion, which infuses the power of your Nether into you, enabling you to enthral creatures and command them.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Infused with Life and Death
betterquesting.desc:
Continuing our Infusions, we delve deeper into the balance between Good and Evil, Life and Death. As before, some things you utilize are inherently 'evil', but can be used for good. So too can good be used for evil, child, never forget that.
    So, the first thing is making a §5§lCongealed Spirit§r. You will need this to make a §5§lSpectral Stone§r using the Rite of Necromancy (page 71 of Circle magic). The §5§lSpectral Stone§r can be used to trap specific undead : Spectres, Banshees, and Poltergeists. A §5§lSpectral Stone§r must be used in a Rite of Binding (page 7 of Circle Magic) with up to 3 of one of these types of undead to trap them.
    To release the stored undead, hold the §5§lSpectral Stone§r, and hold Right Click until a sound is heard, then release. They will be bound to you, and you can control them with a Necromantic Stone.
    To further increase your power over the undead, you can make an §5§lInfused Brew of the Grave§r. To start, you will need an §5§lInfused Brew Base§r, and then use it with the other components in the proper Rite of Infusion found on page 67. Drinking this will give you control over normal undead, not just ones you have summoned yourself. 
    A good way to attract undead to your area to control is to use an §5§lAlluring Skull§r. Craft and place it down, then Right Click a Necromantic Stone on it to activate it. While active, the only thing that can destroy or deactivate the §5§lAlluring Skull§r is by Right Clicking a Necromantic Stone on it again.
    If these are a bit too... dark... for your liking to utilize, let us balance the scales with something more light hearted : The §5§lInfused Brew of Soaring§r found on page 66 of Circle Magic. Drinking this will give you much better control over your Enchanted Broom, making it faster and easier to turn.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Goblin of the Hob
betterquesting.desc:
Bandit, perhaps you have noticed these small, green creatures wandering the forests of your world. I speak not of Creepers, but of Hobgoblins. Some stories say that they were originally created by experimentation in magical mutation. Whether they are or not, they are attracted to areas where Witchcraft and Warlockery are afoot.
    Hobgoblins are not very brave creatures, but if they settle down in a hut or shack, they may be willing to trade with you. Sometimes they find special items they would be willing the part with, but usually they only have one thing to offer you:§5§l Koboldite§r.
    Hobgoblins are the only creatures that know how to mine §5§lKoboldite§r. To get them to mine it, though, you will need to put a §5§lLead§r on them and... well... lead them to some Stone. As well, you will need to give the Hobgoblin a pickaxe: an §5§lIron Pickaxe§r should suffice. They will then dig through Stone and occasionally find you some §5§lKobaldite Dust§r.
    Unfortunatley, Hobgoblins also are the only ones who know how to smelt §5§lKobaldite§r. They will happily trade you some §5§lKobaldite Nuggets§r for some §5§lKobaldite Dust§r and a few Gold Nuggets as payment. If you keep trading with the Hobgoblin (be sure to close the trade window every few trades!), the Hobgoblin will eventually feel safer about you, and offer bigger trades. Eventually, the Hobgoblin will offer to trade Emeralds and §5§lKobaldite Nuggets§r together in exchange for a§5§lKobaldite Ingot§r.
    Interestingly, Hobgoblins worship their own pair of dieties : Mog and Gulg. Stories say that Hobgoblins can instead worship a crafty Witch or Warlock, but that it can draw the ire of their original dieties.
    Here at The Ferret Business, we have a community of Hobgoblins living here happily. Some have agreed to be teleported to your world to assist you, and explore a strange new world. They understand it is a one way trip for now, and wish their community to be compensated appropriately. 
    You can find those willing to aid you in your Shop Catalogue.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Just Swish and Flick
betterquesting.desc:
Wizards are far from the only magic practitioners who use a wand, just they are the most famous for it. We Witches and Warlocks, too, utilize wands. Ours are just a little less... manufactured in looks.
    To create your wand, what we call a §5§lMystic Branch§r, you will need to start with an §5§lEnt Twig§r. You will also need to make some §5§lMystic Unguent§r in a Kettle. Then, follow the Ritual on page 63 of your Circle Magic book.
    You cast various bits of magic by making Gestures with your §5§lMystic Branch§r. The book §5§lWitchcraft: Symbology§r lists all the spells the §5§lMystic Branch§r recognizes (though some of them you cannot handle yet...) and what Gestures to make. 
    Lastly, ensure you are Infused. Any of the infusions should do, unless you are attempting to cast a Forbidden Art, which requires you to be Infused with the Infernal Infusion.
    Now, choose a Gesture. For example, we will cast Defodio on page 9 of §5§lSymbology§r. With your §5§lMystic Branch§r in hand, hold Right Click, move your §5§lMystic Branch§r Upward a short distance until an Up arrow appears. Move it Up again, then Left, then Down. If the spell is valid, you will see it when the last gesture direction is put in. Now, aim your §5§lMystic Branch§r at some dirt, and release Right Click.
    Now, there is a way for a smart Witch or Warlock to not only recharge Infusion power, but to increase the potency of their §5§lMystic Branch§r spells, and it involves the Hobgoblins you befriended earlier. 
    Make yourself a §5§lStatue of Hobgoblin Patron§r, then do the Binding Ritual on page 11 of Circle Magic. Now, place it in the area where Hobgoblins are. They will start to worship it instead of their gods Mog and Gulg. This worship becomes power for you.
    A few Hobgoblin worshippers will recharge your Infusion power when you are close to the Statue. Some more followers, and you'll be able to make larger Gestures for spells : Take the Defodio dig spell earlier. If you Gesture Up Up Up, Left Left, Down Down, Right Right, you will dig a larger area.
    Be warned, though. Shifting the worship of too many Hobgoblins to yourself may attract the attention of Mog and Gulg, who will send their Avatars down to rectify the problem.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Devil is in the Contract
betterquesting.desc:
So far, you've had a small taste of summoning a Demon and trading with it. This path is much deeper, and much riskier, than that. I think you are quite capable of it now, but I warn you, child, you will need to have weapons, armor, and more up to snuff to face these challenges.
    I speak of summoning Demons for more than just a little chat. I speak of creating a contract with a Demon, to aid you in facing other Demons. Demons whose blood can grant you more power with your Mystic Branch.
    To start, though, you will need to be prepared. Your Polynesia Charm is helpful for talking to animals, and we can use it as a base to create a §5§lDevil's Tongue Charm§r. This will make Demonic creatures less likely to attack you (and I emphasise LESS likely, as they are Demons and play by their own rules). 
    Next, you will need to create a §5§lDemonic Contract§r, and sign it with your blood by combining it with your own Taglock. This signed contract will allow you to take a Flame Imp into service. The final thing you need will be a payment for your side of the §5§lContract§r, which should be around 25 levels of Experience. Now, you are ready to summon a Flame Imp. Page 51 of Circle Magic details the components of the Ritual. You will need a Coven for this as well, to note!
    Be careful, when summoned, the Flame Imp may immediately attack. Give it the signed Demonic Contract, and it will only attack creatures intent on hurting you. Now that you have a contract with a Flame Imp, treat it nicely. They like shiny gifts, specifically Gold, Emeralds, and Diamonds. Ply them with these gifts, and they will eventually give you gifts in return : the blood and soul of powerful Demons. Consume them to obtain their power. Each Imp can only provide one of each blood; if you require more, you will need to make a new §5§lDemonic Contract§r with a different Flame Imp.
    §5§lSoul of Hunger Demon§r will enable you to use the Fleshy Feast gesture, consuming your own life to boost your infusion power.
    §5§lSoul of Fear Demon§r enables you to use the Dark Mark gesture, sending a giant skull into the sky to spread fear amongst creatures.
    §5§lSoul of Anguish Demon§r enables you to use the Soulfire gesture, an attack spell that causes more damage the lower your health is.
    And finally, the last Demon blood is not one a Flame Imp can provide directly, due to the power of the Demon that owns it. Instead, if you are lucky (or unlucky enough) the Imp will hand over a §5§lTorment§r scroll. This scroll will enable you to face the Lord of Torment, a strong Demon lord.
    This is where my warnings earlier come in, Bandit. You will need very good armor, a very good weapon (or multiple), and some way to defend and heal yourself. The Lord of Torment is a dangerous foe, and I highly suggest you bring only the equipment you need.
    To summon the Lord of Torment, you will need to find a stone circle. They can be found almost anywhere, and look like a circle of stones, with a circle of Chiseled Stone Bricks in the center, surrounding a pool of water. Witches can usually be found amongst them.
    If you are having trouble finding such a circle, a crafty Witch is always prepared : look in your Guide ((in your Inventory screen, at the left side is a book icon. This is your Guide)). I have added instructions in making your own Stone Circle. Do not make this near your base, as the fight with the Lord of Torment will be quite destructive.
    When you have a stone circle, stand in the pool of water. Hold the §5§lTorment§r scroll in your hand, and then Right Click and hold to begin summoning him. You will know of his arrival with an explosive entrance and an immediate fight.
    Fight as hard as you can, but be warned : If the Lord of Torment feels he is losing, he will drag you to his own domain : Torment. It is a dark, twisted dimension, and it is there you will have to defeat him to get his blood. Afterwards, there should be a portal you can locate to return home.
    Drinking the §5§lSoul of Torment Demon§r will give you the ability to use the Torment gesture. Creatures hit with this spell will be banished to the shadowy realm of Torment.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: The Most Dangerous Hunt
betterquesting.desc:
As I have mentioned prior, Bandit, the path of Witchery can be both light and helpful, while also being dark and deadly. There is a line that we skirt, occasionally dipping over but never too far, as balance must be maintained.
    Unfortunately, some Witches and Warlocks cross the line and almost never return. These are the ones you hear of in dark legends, corrupting and destroying everything they come across. These Witches and Warlocks are part of the universal balance we must deal with, and we have a variety of tools for this. In essence, the Witch shall become the §5§lWitch Hunter§r. Let us begin.
    Fighting Witches, Warlocks, and other magical practitioners is not like fighting Demons or Spirits. They are craftier and have more at their disposal to fight back with. They can be smarter... as well as illogical, which is just as difficult to fight against. To that, we need something that helps nullify a Witch's power a bit.
    Enter the §5§lNull Catalyst§r. It is created with the power of a Nether Star, a powerful component held by the dangerous monster called a Wither in your world. The traditional way to summon it is to make a T out of 5 Soul Sand, and place three Wither Skeleton Skulls, one on each top Soul Sand block. The other way is to use the Rite of Summoning on Page 52 of Circle Magic, enabling you to cast another Ritual at the same time. Either way, the Wither is a destructive beast, so be careful where you summon it.
    Thankfully, you only need to have a little bit of §5§lNull Catalyst§r to create more. You can use it to turn Magma Cream and Blaze Powder into more §5§lNull Catalyst§r.  Be sure to always have at least one pile of it handy so you never run out.
    The first thing to make with it is §5§lUniversal Antidote§r. It is a potion you can drink to remove both Poison and Wither effects.
    Now you need to protect your body. To do so, we'll need special armor made out of Leather treated with the §5§lNull Catalyst§r called §5§lNullified Leather§r. Armor made from it is decently magic resistant, but only if you wear the full set (§5§lWitch Hunter Hat§r, §5§lCoat§r, §5§lTrousers§r, and §5§lBoots§r). Wearing the full set will prevent your Protection Poppets from working, however.
    A Witch Hunter is not complete without a weapon. The §5§lWitch Hunter Pistol Crossbow§r is a handy weapon to fight a Witch at range, and small enough that you can carry a score of them, all loaded and ready to fire. They can use a variety of Bolts : 
    §5§lWooden Bolt§r is the basic bolt.
    §5§lSplitting Bolt§r separates into 3 bolts, each one doing half damage.
    §5§lBone Bolt§r does more damage against Demons and Undead.
    §5§lSilver Bolts§r do double damage to Werewolves, cutting through their natural defenses.
    §5§lNullifying Bolts§r are special, and can only be used when wearing the full §5§lWitch Hunter§r armor set. It will drain 1/3rd of a witch's magical power.
    To reload a bolt, hold Sneak + Right Click for a few seconds. To switch Bolt Types, reload when a Bolt is already loaded.
    Witches and Warlocks who have broke bad and turned to Lycanthropy or Vampirism are especially tough to deal with. Sometimes, the best way to handle them is using the Remove Curse rituals on page 88 and 89 of Circle Magic, which will turn them back to normal. 
    Otherwise, you have some other tools at your disposal. The §5§lSilver Bolts§r are good for fighting Werewolves, as is a special §5§lSilver Sword§r (a Gold Sword surrounded by Silver Deposits in your crafting table). For Vampires, you can place a§5§l Garlic Garland§r to keep them at bay, as it will keep Vampiric creatures away, and Vampiric beings cannot touch or break it, instead it will burn them.
    The riskiest way to get rid of a Vampire is by using a §5§lWooden Stake§r on them when they are sleeping. This is quite difficult to do, so only do it if you are able to get every bit of luck to align right.
    If you become unlucky and need to flee, you can prepare yourself with some §5§lSunlight Grenades§r. Build a §5§lSunlight Collector§r and place it next to a Daylight Sensor outside. Place a Quartz Sphere on the §5§lSunlight Collector§r. As long as the §5§lCollector§r sees unobstructed sunlight from dawn to midday, it will fill the Quartz Sphere with sunlight and turn it into a §5§lSunlight Grenade§r.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Starting a Howl
betterquesting.desc:
Ah yes, I see the interest in your eyes, child. I mentioned Werewolves. Traditionally, Lycanthropy comes in a few forms, from just being a little fuzzier and angrier, to becoming a full grown beast under the full moon.
    This latter one is what we, as Witches, usually deal with. But becoming a Werewolf does not mean you are evil, only that you must work harder to fight your animal instincts. Choosing this path makes this much more difficult.
    There are two ways to become a Werewolf, one easy, and one difficult (at least, comparatively). The easiest way is to perform the Curse of the Wolf ritual on page 81 of Circle Magic. This will require components such as §5§lHellhound Heads§r (Hellhounds are infernal wolves found in your Nether) and §5§lWolfsbane§r, a rare plant whose §5§lSeeds§r you can find by breaking Tall Grass. You will also require the assitance of a full Coven, as well as a Cat familiar. 
    The more difficult way is to locate a creature already under the Lycanthropy curse.  You can use the §5§lWolfsbane§r flower on Villagers to attempt to locate one, though this is quite rare as Werewolves are more apt to hide, whether it is a full moon or not.
    Once you know where a Werewolf is, you can lure them into a §5§lWolftrap§r by leaving bait near it (living bait, such as a Sheep). A §5§lWolftrap§r is a specially upgraded Beartrap (Werewolves just laugh at normal Beartraps. Apparently it is an amusing inside joke among the Lycanthrope community...). 
    You will need to trap the Werewolf directly in front of a §5§lWolf Altar§r on the night of a Full Moon. The deity that controls the Lycanthropy curse will bless the Werewolf with the ability to spread Lycanthropy when it attacks. With this, you need merely ALMOST die to a Werewolf attack to become a Werewolf yourself.
    See which one is easier?
    Now, when you are inflicted with the Werewolf curse, you can commune with the curse's deity by talking to the §5§lWolf Altar§r. They will set before you tasks to complete, and doing so will deepen the curse and grant you more powers, and the ability to use magical objects such as the §5§lMoon Charm§r. 
    The Wolf Altar will bestow upon you the §5§lMoon Charm§r after a few tasks have been accomplished. It will prevent you from transforming against your will (such as during a Full Moon), as well as allow you transform when you want. If you lose it, present the Wolf Altar three Gold Ingots to receive a new one.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Out for a Bite
betterquesting.desc:
Ah, the allure of the charming Vampire. Dressed to the nines and following protocol fitting their status, who wouldn't be a little interested in becoming one? Alas, nowadays vampires are not really Vampires, forgetting who they are and the particulars of their position.
    Not all of the changes are bad, mind you. Today, some Vampires feed strictly on animal blood, and carry with them a little ribbon, go to meetings, etc etc. Modern living changes us all, good or bad...
    But I digress, child. You wished to know how to become a Vampire, yes? Then you will do well to search your local Villages for a book titled §5§lObservations of an Immortal§r. It is the notes and musings of a scholar who fell to the vampirism curse. The path to becoming a Vampire is not easy, and it would be best for you to get strong armor, strong weapons, and plenty of Fire Resist potions ready.
    Unfortunately, very few copies of the book are ever complete. To complete it, you will need to find §5§lTorn Pages§r and combine them with the §5§lObservations of an Immortal§r to fill out the information. Here in The Ferret Business, we have a few Vampires, some who are Ribbon carriers, others who have friends and followers who all share a little blood with them. They have agreed to share the various copies of the §5§lObservations of an Immortal§r and the §5§lTorn Pages§r for a price. You can find them in your Shop Catalogue.
    Reading the §5§lObservations§r book, it will describe to you a small ritual you perform, similar to your Circle Magic rituals.  Follow the picture in the book, making the circles with Redstone Dust and String, Torches and a Skeleton Skull. Carry a §5§lGlass Goblet§r, and slaughter a Chicken atop the Skeleton Skull using a Boline. It's blood will catch in the §5§lGlass Goblet§r, which you Right Click onto the Skeleton Skull to annoint it.
    This will draw the attention of the original vampire, Lilith. She will send a daughter to you, and task you with leading her to the lava lakes of the underworld: for you, this is The Nether. 
    The daughter will test your patience. You will need to push her into a Nether Portal to get her to travel through it, she regularly does not follow your jumps between worlds. You will then need to lead her to the natural lava lakes and push her in. If you Right Click her and hearts appear while she is in Lava, you are doing well.
    It may take some time, but she will then ask if you are worthy. Prepare for battle immediately, child, as Lilith will swap places with her daughter, and challenge you herself. The is, as they say, the Real OV, and the fight is quite difficult. If you defeat her, she will shrink to a normal size, and give you a choice, magic or death. Right Click the §5§lGlass Goblet§r on her, and she will give you her blood. Drink it, and you shall become a Vampire. 
    I warn you, Bandit. As a young Vampire, you do not have the skills or powers elder Vampires have. Sunlight will instantly kill you. Many Poppets, fire protection potions, etc will not work for you. Normal food will be as ash in your mouth, causing insane hunger.  You can only feed upon Blood, be it animal or... other. Your Blood Pool is shown on the left side of your vision. As you fill this Blood Pool, the drops turn Red.
    To feed, you must find creatures to feed upon. You eventually be able to see just how much Blood they have available, if you grow your powers enough. Select your Bite power by hitting 1 on the keyboard, which will swap between your normal inventory, and your Vampire abilities. With Bite selected, move next to the creature, and hold Right Click on your target to begin feeding.
    As long as you do not drink a victim below 50% blood, you will not hurt them. Villagers, if you choose to drink from them, will alert the guards if you drink from them while they are awake, or if they take damage from your feeding when they are asleep.
    To grow as a Vampire, you will need to collect §5§lTorn Pages§r and add them to the §5§lObservations of an Immortal§r. These are missing pages, and each one tells of the writer's rise from the lower vampire ranks.
    Remember though : One can get by by consuming blood from animals, but you cannot become a stronger Vampire that way. You can, though, by carefully 'sipping', as they have come to call the term, from a wide variety of Villagers, or even assistants if they are willing to aid you.
    As the sun will instantly kill you as a young Vampire, and severely hinder you as you grow, your best bet is to sleep during the day. Normal beds will not work, instead the stylish Vampire uses a §5§lCoffin§r to rest during the day. To sleep in it, you need to Sneak + Right Click to open the lid, then Right Click to sleep as normal. 
    As you grow in power, you will be able to 'curse' Villagers with Vampirism, with you as their leader. I do not know how, for I never went this far in my personal Vampiric journey, but I do know those you bring into the Vampire fold are referred to as 'children', and they can gift you blood if you set out a §5§lBlood Crucible§r near them.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Dressed to Kill
betterquesting.desc:
Vampires tend to live for hundreds of years, and those who live so long tend to learn the ins and outs of surviving, amassing influence and power along the way. As such, they have developed their own... interesting style. A style that was once 'in' as rich fashion, but today mostly Vampires (and, apparently, some fandoms...) alone can pull off wearing these with no issue.
    Vampires, as class dictates, cannot just wear a normal dresscoat. It must be woven of a special material. To make it, you will need to be at least a fourth level Vampire with a good amount of Blood in their Blood Pool. Place some white Wool out, then take a Bone Needle and Right Click it on the Wool to stain it with your Blood. You can break the §5§lBlood-stained Wool§r to collect it, then put it into a Furnace to cook it down into §5§lWoven Crour§r, a material woven with your Blood, giving it a bit of your Vampiric power.
    You can now take §5§lWoven Cruor§r and turn it into, as the younger witches here like to say, some sharp threads. A §5§lVampire Top Hat§r,§5§l Dress Coat§r, §5§lTrousers§r, and §5§lOxford Boots§r complete the set. As a bonus, when you wear more than one piece of this outfit, your Blood grants bonus power to it, including Fire Resistance (Fire, of course, being one of the only things that can kill you...).
    Sadly, many people forget that men are not the only ones who become Vampires. Thusly, there are alternate versions of a few clothing pieces : the §5§lDress Jacket§r comes in a '§5§lLadies§r' version, and you can make §5§lSkirted Trousers§r instead of normal §5§lTrousers§r.
    If you are after something a little more... protective, you can reinforce a few pieces of dress with some chainmail. The §5§lDress Coat§r can be turned into a §5§lChain Coat§r (including the '§5§lLadies§r' version), and the §5§lTop Hat§r can be turned into a §5§lHelmet§r. You don't quite get the same level of bonuses as the snazzy ensemble, but sometimes a little fashion sacrifice is needed.
    Finally, what elegant suit would be without a regal, yet sneaky, cane? The §5§lCane Sword§r is a simple looking cane with a hidden blade.  You can sheathe or unsheathe the blade by Sneak + Right Clicking while holding it. When you kill with the §5§lCane Sword§r, it siphons Blood into an internal reservoire for later. Right Click while holding the sheathed §5§lCane Sword§r to extract the Blood.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Contractual Magic
betterquesting.desc:
Flame Imps, when treated well, can do much more than just offer you another Demon's blood. By taking a fresh Demonic Contract and combining it with some reagents, you create a spell contract. Then, you just need to combine it with the Taglock of your target (either yourself or another creature) and then give it to the Flame Imp you have a contract with.
    §5§lFiery Touch§r will cause random fires to spring up around the target when they interact with things.
    §5§lLiving Flame§r will cause a Blaze to appear and attack the target.
    §5§lEvaporation§r will cause water to disappear around the target.
    §5§lMelting Touch§r will cause blocks the target harvests to instantly smelt (and possibly cause ores to double!).
    §5§lFiery Tolerance§r imbues with target with Fire Resistance.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Helpful Bits and Bobs
betterquesting.desc:
Witches and Warlocks are quite busy in the day to day, and there is always some little thing that can make life easier.
    Mixing up some vegetables and raw meat in a bowl is a great start to a §5§lRaw Meaty Stew§r, and cooking it in a Furnace or similar nets you a filling §5§lMeaty Stew§r.
    Shifting a bit more to the occult side of aid, Treefyds are mutated plants Witches use to defend their home occasionally. To grow a Treefyd, one must mutate some plant material together to get a§5§l Treefyd Seed§r, then plant it. Once planted, the Treefyd will rapidly grow.
    The Treefyd will remember you, and attack all other creatures it sees. You Right Click a Taglock of another creature to make the Treefyd ignore them(or an entire species if it is of, say, a farm animal like a Sheep). You can feed a Treefyd the heart from a Creeper or a Demon to boost their health and damage. Using a Boline on a Treefyd will stop it from wandering around randomly.
    The §5§lBook of Biomes§r is a helpful tool to a Witch or Warlock, especially when one upgrades it to the §5§lExtended Edition§r. They list information on every biome of the land, and the§5§l Extended Edition§r enables you to copy one out to a Biome Page, which is used in a few different Rituals.
    To copy out a Biome Page, search for the page in the §5§lBook of Biomes (Extended Edition)§r, then combine it with Paper in your crafting grid. This will copy the last page you looked at onto a Biome Page.

display:10.Name:8: Good Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: A Huntsman's Gear
betterquesting.desc:
With Werewolves and Vampires and all manner of other monsters roaming about, those who hunt Witches have to be prepared.
    The basic Witch Hunter outfit can be upgraded by applying Silver to it, making it better for fighting against Werewolves. §5§lSilvered Witch Hunter Gear§r will even cause damage in return if a Werewolf strikes you.
    §5§lSilvered Witch Hunter§r gear can further be upgraded by lacing it with Garlic, creating §5§lDawn Witch Hunter§r gear. It provides better defence against both Werewolves and Vampires.
    If not facing either of those, there is a variety of footwear you can utilize for different situations.
    §5§lSeeping Shoes§r are good for combating creatures that poison you constantly, such as Cave Spiders. By standing on ground, the poison will seep out of you and Bonemeal the area instead.
    §5§lSeeping Shoes§r can be used as a base to creaty §5§lRuby Slippers§r. You must be Infused to utilize the magical properties of the §5§lRuby Slippers§r. By saying (into chat) "there's no place like home", the §5§lRuby Slippers§r will teleport you back to your spawn point, consuming some of your Infusion power. If you drop a Bound Waystone to a location and use the same chant, it will consume the Waystone and teleport you there. 
    The last piece of footwear you can use requires the creation of a §5§lFrozen Heart§r, which is then used to make §5§lIcy Slippers§r. When stepping on Water, it will instantly freeze it into Ice, enabling you to walk across water. Perhaps more useful is walking over Lava turns it into Obsidian, though this slowly damages the §5§lIcy Slippers§r.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tools and Tribulations
betterquesting.desc:
With the variety of materials and knowledge you have at your disposal now, Bandit, there are some new things you can whip up to aid you.
    A §5§lKoboldite Pickaxe§r is a fairly good pickaxe in your own paws, but place it into a Hobgoblin's and watch them carve through material like a holiday turkey. Their latent magic is also boosted as Ores they mine automatically smelt, sometimes creating extra goods.
    A §5§lPentacle§r is made out of Koboldite and placed on your Altar to double the Power recharge rate.
    For Witch Hunters tracking down evil Witches, Protection Poppets can be the bane of the hunt. To combat this, you can employ the use of a§5§l Poppet Shelf Compass§r. The crystals on the face of the §5§lPoppet Shelf Compass§r light up more the closer you get to a Poppet Shelf.
    For the Witch or Warlock who is being hunted by over zealous Hunters or other dangerous foes, the use of a §5§lTwisting Band§r can be the difference between life and death. This piece of headware causes all who look at you to become nauseous, weakening creatures and twisting their vision until they look away.
    For some alternate protection, you can create a §5§lParasytic Louse§r. To make one, you'll first need to capture some Silverfish in a Critter Snare. Silverfish can be somewhat difficult to find, but you can infect stone with them by making a §5§lBrew of Infection§r in your Kettle and throwing it at the Stone. 
    To obtain a §5§lParasytic Louse§r, it must be mutated. First, dig a 3x3, one block deep pit. Place the Silverfish Critter Snare in the center, then dig down the North, South, East, and West blocks, fill them with water, and place a Lilypad in each one. Place Grassper plants in the corners, and have them hold a Charged Attuned Stone, a Tongue of Dog, and two Mutandis. Finally, Right Click your Mutating Sprig on the Critter Trap to mutate the Silverfish into a §5§lParasytic Louse§r.
    To pick up the §5§lLouse§r, you can Right Click it. Craft the §5§lLouse§r with any potion in your crafting grid to feed it, and if you are attacked, the §5§lParasytic Louse§r will inject the potion. If the fed §5§lLouse§r is on your hotbar when you are attacked, it will inject beneficial potions into you, or harmful potions into the attacker.
    You can turn the §5§lParasytic Louse§r into a useful piece of armor with some §5§lImpregnated Leather§r. §5§lThe Biting Belt§r can be fed with two potions the same way you feed a §5§lLouse§r. When you are hit, one of the potions will be injected. 
    The §5§lBiting Belt§r can be further upgraded into a §5§lBark Belt§r. Standing on Grass or Mycellium will enable the §5§lBark Belt§r to grow two pieces of protective Bark around you. As well, each piece of armor you wear made from §5§lImpregnated Leather§r will let another two Bark grow, up to eight pieces.
    Whenever you are hit by anything other than a Wood weapon, Bark will absorb the hit, breaking as they negate most, if not all, of the damage.
    The last thing here is probably one of the most fiddly mutations you can do, as the creatures involved are quite... tricky... to wrangle. First, dig a 3x3, one block deep pit. Dig the center down and fill it with water, then place a Cobweb above it. To the North, South, East, and West must be planted and fully grown Mandrake plants. Place Grasspers in the corners, and have them hold a Charged Attuned Stone, a Focused Will, and two Mutandis Extremis.
    Now the trickiest part : You need to trap an awakened Mandrake in the Cobweb, AS WELL as a Creeper. When both are trapped in the web, Right Click your Mutating Sprig on it to transform them into a §5§lMinedrake§r.
    The §5§lMinedrake§r is a defensive trap plant. When dropped, it awakens a few seconds later and runs towards whoever awakened it, Exploding when it gets close enough (the explosion does not damage terrain, thankfully!). If the §5§lMinedrake§r is harvested and not picked up, it will awaken and head towards the nearest player instead.
    You can grow more §5§lMinedrakes§r by planting a §5§lMinedrake Bulb§r. It grows much slower than Mandrake, and requires much more Bonemeal to fertilize.

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: It Belongs in a Museum!
betterquesting.desc:
There are many dangerous beings in this universe. Villagers in your world speak of the Wither, for example, and no doubt you may have encountered it at least once already. As a Witch, you have the ability to summon many of them through various means, and they all carry magical artifacts coveted by many a practitioner(and museum curator!).
    Before you embark on a quest for these artifacts, be sure you are prepared. As usual, Armor, Weapons, Potions, the entire works are important as every being you will face is dangerous and deadly.
    The first you can encounter is actually a pair I have mentioned before: Mog and Gulg. By having many Hobgoblins worshipping you instead of them, they will take notice and send their Avatars to deal with you. You can also attract their immediate attention by using a Nether Star on the Statue of Hobgoblin Patron. This duo is quite dangerous together, as their magical equipment bolsters each other if they are close. To fight them effectively, you will need to separate them somehow and defeat them one by one. 
    §5§lGulg's Gurdle§r is a piece of leg armor that powers up your bare handed attacks. You will do decent damage and launch the target into the air.
    §5§lMog's Quiver§r is actually armor you wear on your chest. It supplies infinite arrows to your bows, causing them to fire faster, and cause greater damage to anything in the air when its hit, whether its flying or just jumping.
    By having both of these Hobgoblin artifacts worn close together, both wearers will become much more resistant to damage.
    The next artifact requires you to make a special brew from the Witches' Brews book. It is shown under the last entry for Brew Effects: Summon Leonard, the demonic being rumored to have taught some of the first Witches.
    The full instructions will not appear until your skill at Brewing is quite high. Sneak + Right Click while holding a Seer Stone to reveal your Brewing level. To Summon Leonard, you will need to be level 12, have 10,000 Altar Power, and understand how to brew the potion with the most capacity.
    This last part I will help you with (Getting to level 12 you have to do on your own, child). When you are ready to summon the Shade of Leonard, add to your Witches' Cauldron, in this order : Mandrake Root, Nether Wart, Tear of the Goddess, Diamond Vapour, Diamond, Nether Star, Witches Hat, and finally Gunpowder.
    Leonard will not be hostile. In fact, he will assist your Cauldron rituals (while increasing the chance of...side effects). He will, however, never leave unless you force him out. By force. Leonard is ancient and powerful, but once defeated he can leave behind his Urn. §5§lLeonard's Urn§r can be filled with a Brew of your choice, and then cast repeatedly with your Mystic Branch.
    Rumor has it that you can collect and combine up to 4 of §5§lLeonard's Urns§r.
    The Wild Hunt is a legend passed down through many cultures. The Horned Huntsman, created by the Horned God, is known to lead the Hunt across dimensions, in search of worthy hunting. There are a few ways one can summon the Horned Huntsman. The Horn of the Hunt, for example, cannot be crafted, only given by the diety of Werewolves if you are lucky.
    Easier, though, is to create a Bloodied Wicker Bundle effigy and burn it. Taking Bloody Wicker Bundles, model the effigy after the Straw Men effigies you can find all over the world. Then, light the effigy on fire to summon the Horned Huntsman.
    The Horned Huntsman is a powerful entity that will put up a difficult fight. When defeated, it may leave behind a §5§lSpear of the Huntsman§r, which can summon a wolf (a hound of the hunt) when you block an attack.
    The final artifact is perhaps the most difficult, as it is left to the whims of fate on whether you even face the owner of it : Baba Yaga (and her sisters, sometimes). Baba Yaga rides around in a giant Mortar, wielding a Pestle as weapon and wand. Her magical strength and clairvoyance makes her and her sisters a difficult battle.
    Sometimes, can be found deep in a forest, in her stilted hut surrounded by skulls on a wooden fence. Most of the time, though, she must be enticed to appear before you. While you are Infused, peer into a Crystal Ball. Make sure each prediction comes true as soon as possible. The more predictions, the more likely her attention will be grabbed.
    Sometimes when she appears, it is only to test your mettle, and she will vanish back to where she came from before the battle is half over. Do not give up! Continue to utilize your Crystal Ball and get her attention again for the real fight.
    When defeated, Baba Yaga will usually leave her hat as a reward. §5§lBaba Yaga's Hat§r is infused with the power of her legendary brewing abilities, giving you better second AND third chances at extra brews. It will also provide clairvoyance, teleporting you out of harms way at the cost of some Infusion power. As well, it counts as a Witches Hat, for what it is worth.

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Mirror, rorriM
betterquesting.desc:
§5§lMirrors§r are a dangerous tool, child. At least, some §5§lMirrors§r are. Fairy tales have been built around §5§lMirror§r magic for centuries, and with good reason: to warn you that not all that the §5§lMirror§r shows is what you want. This is a dark path I will describe to you, Bandit. But, it is your choice to follow it. 
    You can create a §5§lMagic Mirror§r and trap a Demon inside with the proper Ritual. Page 68 of Circle Magic lists the components, which includes the necessary Demon you want to trap in the §5§lMirror§r. After you successfully create the §5§lMirror§r, place the §5§lMirror§r on a wall (within range of your Altar, as the Demon will need a bit of power...).
    Right Clicking the §5§lMirror§r will ask the Demon the question : Who is the fairest of them all? (Now you know where the fairy tale originated...). It may answer with you... and it may not. If you are not the fairest, the Demon will tell you the direction that the Fairest resides.
    The Fairest of Them All always has a §5§lHeart of Gold§r. To obtain it, you will need to take some... deadly measures. The§5§l Heart of Gold§r is used in some special Brews. Remember, the fairest may or may not be a good person. If you are squeamish about going down the dark path, I have allowed Proprieter Penny to sell some of our Restricted Stock of §5§lHearts of Gold§r. Check your Shop Catalogue, she will explain whence they came from.
    If you Right Click a Quartz Sphere onto the §5§lMirror§r, the Demon will turn it into a §5§lDuplication Grenade§r. If you are being attacked by creatures, throwing it will create a duplicate of yourself, and cause the creatures to change to the double. Do note that Witches or other powerful beings may not be tricked so easily.
    If you Right Click a Taglock of another assistant on the §5§lMirror§r, if there is enough Altar power available, it will turn you into a mirror image of them.
    Be careful, though, of stepping too close to the §5§lMirror§r. You may fall in (or be dragged in) to the §5§lMirror World§r. This is where the Demon you have bound to the §5§lMirror§r resides, and he will become a Reflection of you : he will look like you, use your weapons and armor, and try to kill you.
    If you kill the Demon, the §5§lMirror§r will no longer be inhabited, and there will be no Demon to ask questions or fulfill tasks. The §5§lMirror§r will be hollow, still allowing travel to the §5§lMirror§r world.
    Be wary about using and placing multiple §5§lMirrors§r. You can get stuck in a strange loop, outside of time and space. To get back, use /chant mirror mirror send me home

display:10.Name:8: Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Great Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Don't Fear the Reaper
betterquesting.desc:
Death, not the occurrence but the actual entity, is well known amongst Witches and Warlocks. We help shepherd souls to him, to lead to the next world. When we die for the final time, we shall walk hand in hand with him. In the end, when there is nothing and no one left, Death with reap his own soul as the final action of all existance. 
    Death cannot actually killed until that final moment, and only by his own scythe. To keep things interesting over the millenia, he welcomes challenges. To face Death, you must prove yourself worthy by attempting to bind five of each Spectral Undead to a Fetish. Defeat him in combat, and he will reward you with a piece of his accoutrement, each imbued with a bit of his Reaper power.
    The only non-accoutrement Death may drop is the skull of his horse. §5§lBinky's Skull§r can be placed on the ground to summon Death's horse. If Binky dies, he will return to the skull to be summoned again later.
    §5§lDeath's Hood§r allows you to stare at a creature, pinning it with your gaze. They will find it difficult to move under the piercing vision. As well, you will be able to see better in darkness.
    §5§lDeath's Robes§r make you immune to Lava and Fire. 
    §5§lDeath's Footwear§r allows you to walk on Water and other liquids. Be careful, as this requires concentration (you are not Death himself, remember!), so being hit may cause you to fall into the liquid.
    The §5§lHand of Death§r is a powerful weapon. Striking a creature with it causes Chill Touch, ignoring armor. If you Right Click while holding the §5§lHand of Death§r, and you are wearing the §5§lHood§r, §5§lRobes§r, and §5§lFootwear§r of Death, you will summon his Scythe. Every second the Scythe is summoned, the hungrier you will get. Each swing of the Scythe will hit multiple creatures with Chill Touch, and cause more damage the hungrier you are. Succesfully hitting creatures with the Scythe can replenish your Health and Hunger, allowing you to continue Reaping with the deadly blade. Right Click again to dismiss the Scythe.
    If you wear all of §5§lDeath's clothing§r and wield his §5§lHand§r, you will never take massive amounts of damage from a single hit. You may, though, be summoned in Death's place whenever he is called (whether a case of mistaken identity, or payment for wearing Death's clothing, is questionable).

display:10.Name:8: Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Belief and Grace
betterquesting.desc:
Many Witches, Warlocks, and practitioners of magical arts worship and believe in a diety simply called the Goddess (as well as many mundane folk!)
    Whether they originally were real or not does not matter. Many Gods and Goddesses only exist as long as they have enough believers (thus is why Mog and Gulg do not appreciate your pulling Hobgoblins away from them). 
    You may not believe, but the Goddess is worshipped enough to bestow her grace upon everyone who asks, whether they believe in her or not. Craft and place the §5§lStatue of the Goddess§r. When Right Clicked, it will cleanse you of almost all curses. The statue will not cleanse you of Vampirism or Lycanthropy, as those are outside of her domain (being Curses bestowed by other dieties). Those most be removed by the proper Ritual.

display:10.Name:8: Epic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Lgndry Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Witchery
betterquesting.desc:
Ah yes, welcome §c§lBandit§r. As I said, my name is §3§lWitch Weatherwand§r.
    §4§lWitchery§r is more than just witchcraft. §lMixing§r magical ingredients, §lchanting§r spells,§l stiring§r cauldrons is only half of it. The other half is §lheadology§r: knowing how to manipulate not only the world, but yourself and those around you.
    Don't give me that look, I know what you are thinking. How do you get a stubborn young kit to eat his vitamins without realizing it? How do you get the old ferret to take his medicine while he's being stubborn? How do you get the bully to stop without ever hurting them or tattling on them?
    §lHeadology§r. 
    See my §lpointed hat§r? That says §lwitch§r to you, does it not? Immediately you think it and act accordingly. I could be just a frail, old woman who likes §lconical headware§r, without a speck of magic or knowledge.
    That's §lheadology§r too.
    That is neither here nor there for now, §c§lchild§r. We need to start with the §lfundamentals§r. Go search the §lTall Grass§r. You should find §5§lfive seeds§r that you'll need to start gardens for : 
    §5§lBelladona§r and §5§lSnowbell Seeds§r can be grown in normal §lfarmland§r. The former will grow into§5§l Belladonna Flowers§r, while the latter will give you §lSnowballs§r...and occasionally an §5§lIcy Needle§r.
    §5§lWater Artichoke§r must be grown atop §lwater§r, and will give you §5§lWater Artichoke Globes§r.
    §5§lMandrake§r is the the special one of the bunch. §5§lMandrake Root§r is often shaped like a §lhuman§r, and you will find that they can be §ljust as lively§r. Carry a§l sword§r or§l shovel§r,§c§l child§r, their voices can be§l nauseating§r to hear. Harvest§l plenty§r of seeds and the fully grown components, for you will need a good amount of them. 
    Take §lone§r of each of these §lseeds§r, for example. Combine them into what we call §5§lAnnointing Paste§r. Place down a plain§l Cauldron§r, and §l§nRight Click §rthe §5§lPaste§r onto it to turn it into your first tool : The §5§lWitches Cauldron§r. Break it with a §lpickaxe§r and let me§l examine§r it, Bandit, before we continue.
    The use of a §5§lWitches Cauldron§r is much like a normal cauldron : §lLight a fire§r beneath it, and fill it with§l water§r. §l Add ingredients§r to the§l brew§r or concoction you seek to make when the water§l boils§r. If all goes well, after a few moments the recipe will complete.
    Hm? Ah yes, I did say §l5 seeds§r. I did not include the §lfifth seed §rearlier, as it is not used for §5§lAnnointing Paste§r. I speak of§5§l Garlic§r. Unlike the others, it does not have a separate seed; the §lgarlic bulb§r itself is basically a §lseed pod§r, each clove able to produce more §5§lGarlic§r!
    §lHands on§r experience is the best way to learn §lWitchcraft§r and §lHeadology§r... but I admit some are better at learning from§l books§r. You can craft the first of the books called§l Witchcraft : Herbology§r, which will detail these and many other§l plants§r we shall deal with, §c§lBandit§r.

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Tools. Components. The Basics.
betterquesting.desc:
So, most of my machines work off some basic components. Makes them easily replacable if they ever break, yah?

    First things first, Gears. Gears of all major metals. Each machine is a music of motion and movement as they do their tasks, and gears are the muscle.

    Next is a home for the components. A Basic Machine Frame made from Iron, Glass, and a Tin Gearshould be sufficient to start with.

    Then ya will need a way to store and transmit RF Energy in and out of the machine. This is usually handled by either a Redstone Transmission Coil or a Redstone Reception Cell. 

    And finally, many a machine needs some extra 'push' power, and a Pneumatic Servo is more than enough.

    Ah, now that ya have the basic components, ya will need a tool for some...precision adjustments of these machines. The Crescent Hammer enables you to rotate machines by Right Clicking it on them, or outright dismantle them by Sneak + Right Clicking.

   And hey, it also makes a decent tool for percussive maintenance on the nearest evil creature, yeah?

display:10.Name:8: Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags
Basic Blind Bag of Blind Bags

betterquesting.name: Introduction to the Thermals
betterquesting.desc:
Hullo? Hullo! Thought this thing broke on ya'll. No worries no worries, yer here now and that's what matters!

    Like I said, I'm Teris, and I'll be helping ya to learn the ins n' outs of my Thermal machines. My machines cover a whole range o' useful things! 

    Let's get right to it. I'll need ya to start collecting a buncha the resources ya will need for my creations.

    Tin and Copper are pretty easy ta find, just minecloser to the surface.

    Lead is a bit deeper down and a bit rarer.

    Silver ya can regularly find alongside Lead, be sure to get both! Nickel, on the other paw, tends to be deeper down and much rarer. It's also called Ferrous, so keep a look out for either one.

    Shiny, or Platinum, is quite a rare metal compared to the rest of these. Consider it the diamonds of metal ore, usually found around that height.

    But hey, in yer mining trips ya might be hurting for backpack space, so be sure to make yerself a Satchel ta carry things in!

betterquesting.name: Handy Tools on Hand
betterquesting.desc:
There's much more to all these metals I had you collect than making machines with them, ya know? Tools, for one thing!

    You can make a bunch o' tools like Shears, Bows, and heck even Fishing Rods out of the different metals. Ya can also make some of the regular things, like Pickaxes and Armor and whatnot.

betterquesting.name: Initial Research
betterquesting.desc: §lAssistant Bandit§r, we need to scan the planet, asteroid, dimension, and/or reality that you arrived at. Provide samples to §3§lBiologist Bitsy§r and in return she'll get you in contact with more staff here, as well as open the §3§lCorporate Shop§r for you.

betterquesting.name: [FRD] Ferret Resources Dept
betterquesting.desc: Greetings, §d§lBandit§r. I am §3§lRecruiter Rodney§r from the §3§lFR Department§r. That's §3§lFerret Resources Department§r. I handle §lhiring§r and §lfiring§r new employees, and more importantly to you, I oversee many aspects of employee life, including §lbenefits§r and more within §3§lThe Ferret Business.§r  I will also handle exchanging §3§lSilver Coins§r into §3§lShop Vouchers§r for §3§lProprieter Penny§r.

betterquesting.name: [FRD] Large Scale Orders
betterquesting.desc:
§3§lRecruiter Rodney§r here. Raw materials are not the only thing we sell in the §5§lFerret Business§r, we also sell a wide variety of merchandise. You've probably seen the§l Supply and Demand§r system in place from §3§lProprieter Penny§r, which is good for supplying us with a small variety of items.
    I, instead, handle the large volume purchases. The ones that handle thousands upon thousands of a single item. These are distributed among our many chains of stores, and I coordinate the logistics of this.
    If you are in need of even more coins than just providing small crates of goods, then please look at what I am in need of currently.
    You can complete any order BUT RF Energy orders multiple times.

betterquesting.name: [FRD] Researchology
betterquesting.desc:
INITIALIZING INTERFACE. SCANNING IDENTIFICATION
...
> GREETINGS §d§lBANDIT§r
    I AM §3§lM-A8301-X819§r, OR §3§lM.A.X.§r FOR SHORT. I AM PART OF A NEW SYSTEM FOR THE FERRET RESOURCES DEPARTMENT.
    I CATALOGUE AND DISTRIBUTE §5§lRESEARCH MATERIALS§r TO MANY LABORATORIES WITHIN §3§lTHE FERRET BUSINESS§r. I AM NOW AUTHORIZED BY THE §3§lCEO§r TO GIVE YOU §2§lPAYMENT§r, KNOWN AS A §2§lBOUNTY§r, FOR PROVIDING VARIOUS §5§lRESEARCH MATERIALS§r.
    THE LARGER ORDERS GIVE A BONUS IN REWARD. YOU MAY SUBMIT AS MANY RESEARCH MATERIALS AS YOU COLLECT BY INSERTING THEM INTO AN §4§lENDER IO§r §lSAG MILL§r AS AN ALTERNATIVE SUBMISSION METHOD.

betterquesting.name: Exploring Your World
betterquesting.desc:
Hey there §d§lBandit§r, my name is §3§lExplorer Eric§r. I'm an §lexplorer§r, an §ladventurer§r, sort of like you've just become! 
    Oh. Uh. Sorry about that... but thats why I've been asked to help you out! As a seasoned adventurer, there are a lot of little tricks and tips I can give you to help you §lsurvive§r in that new world you've discovered! 
    Thankfully it seems that in your §lworld§r, you can't §ldie§r of anything but old age, so we don't have to worry about that and take SOME risks... cause you know, dieing ain't final, but pain still hurts!

betterquesting.name: Building Your Home
betterquesting.desc:
Hello hello there! My name is §5§lDaisy§r, and I'm a §lDecorator§r, §lDesigner§r, §lDeveloper§r... some other things that aren't as important, but my §lmain passion§r is §lDesigning§r and §lDecorating§r! I'm known as §3§lDecorator Daisy§r, and I can help you §lspruce§r up your §lHome§r slash §lBase§r slash §lCave§r, and make it feel more §lcomfortable§r! 
    Step on in...

betterquesting.name: Protecting Your Assets
betterquesting.desc: Hi there Bandit! My name is Serge, I'm an assisting to Engineer Erin and leading Stockmaster for many of the labs and shops around the Ferret Business. I was asked to help you get a little more organized in your...well, wherever you happened to land. Hopefully we'll be able to get you home soon, but my understanding it might be a while, and its a dangerous world. Sometimes, knowing where your sword, your food, and your towel are stored at any time can be the key to survival.

betterquesting.name: Magical Flowers
betterquesting.desc:
Hi there Bandit. I'm Occult Botonist Belle, lead researcher of uh... lets just say unique plants. Apparently when you crossbreed and genetically modify plants to make synthetic meat and bodyparts, or make them start walking around demanding to be fed blood, you're suddenly.... nevermind! 
    Not important! What IS important is you've found some very very interesting plants! Working together, I bet we can make a LOT of interesting discoveries!

betterquesting.name: Bit o This n That
betterquesting.desc:
Hey there Bandit! Good to meet you! 
    Biologist Bitsy passed those materials I kind of maybe hinted at wanting to look at to me, and I'm quite pleased with them! I think she just wanted me to stop bugging her, but thats fine, I got what I was after! I'm Inventologist Irvine, lets see what we can invent!

betterquesting.name: Conduit Machinery
betterquesting.desc:
Hello, Bandit. The samples you sent me are quite nice, and I think they'll be quite servicable for what I'd like to show you. You've got a whole lot of materials, items, machines, and other such collection of items you need to deal with. I can definitely teach you a whole slew of things about Input and Output of an inventory system. 
    And who knows, some of the research here on your world may even help me broaden my own knowledge and abilities, and I'll share those profits with you. Oh, my name? I'm Engineer Erin. A pleasure to meet you.

betterquesting.name: Machine Life
betterquesting.desc:
Hello, hello? Bandit? I... oh! It connected! Good, didn't feel like breaking my tools out already. My name is Mechanic Meeko, and I'm one of the head factory engineers in The Ferret Business. The other one is my twin sister, have you met her yet? 
    No? Well... trust, me, she's my twin. Where were we? Ah yes, let's talk more in private, okay?

betterquesting.name: Automation Station
betterquesting.desc:
[Clank]
    [Clank]
    [Clank]
    Dang th... oh, it's working finally! Greetings, Bandit! I'm Machinist Meeka! My twin brother and I are the head factory engineers here! We make sure things are automated like... well... clockwork! A well oiled machine! A well choreographed mechanical dance! 
    Come on, lets go talk more in private!

betterquesting.name: Crystals and Essences
betterquesting.desc:
Tell me, kit, do you believe in magic? Well, of course you do, thats a foolish question. 
    Do you believe in the existance of auras, the power of crystals, and the infinite depth of magic itself? Now that... that is a proper question! 
    My name is Wizard Watson. Please, step into my study, Bandit, I feel we can definitely help each other to answer this...

betterquesting.name: Soul Food
betterquesting.desc:
Welcome, welcome to the §3§lCafe la Ferret§r! Here, we create all sorts of delicacies, from the familiar to the strange!
    We are a trio of researchers who are working on new foods, from planting to plate! We'd like to thank you for introducing us to even more §lfoods§r to expand our palettes with, Bandit.  
    Who are we, you ask? We would be: §3§lMaster Gardener Grey§r, §3§lHead Chef Charlie§r, and §3§lFood Critic Candy§r, at your service!

betterquesting.name: Crystaline Storage
betterquesting.desc:
G'day, Bandit! My name is Dataologist Dante and with me is Linguist Larry. I handle researching new, more efficient data storage and handling methods, while Larry handles translating unknown languages.
    Your strange location has presented us with new alien technology to research, and Larry and I have created a new research branch to explore the ability to store items as pure data and energy.
    We call this new branch Applied Energistics. Would you like to help us?

betterquesting.name: Cauldron Bubble
betterquesting.desc:
Well met, Bandit. I am Witch Weatherwand, the head witch of The Ferret Business' Witchery coven.
    I am of the impression you could use some training, and in return your world could provide us with some new and... interesting... things.
    Then follow, and do not dawdle, child.

betterquesting.name: Special Research
betterquesting.desc: Greetings, §d§lBandit§r, my name is §3§lCaigan§r. You've done a lot for §3§lThe Ferret Business§r so far, a real asset! We have much to discuss though...

betterquesting.name: (WIP)The Power of Red
betterquesting.desc:
Ya'll are here, great! I'm §4§lThermal§r §3§lEngineer Erstul Teris§r, but ya can just call me §3§lTeris§r, makes it a lot easier, yah?
    Simply, I know a lot about §lmachines§r. I've designed a great variety of devices and tools that can definitely help ya'll with yer current mess.
